skills.description: Wind Engineers have changed the world, first with great sailing ships and now with renewable energy. We harness a powerful force, with sails, kites, and turbines.
skills.title: Wind Engineer
skills.notes: Make a Wind Tunnel Challenge (example: http://makeprojects.com/Project/Model+Wind+Tunnel/267/1#.USO2zlpARgI)

skills.description: Woodworkers make objects of timeless utility and beauty. In every cut and every joint of cabinet, clock, or table you can see our craftsmanship.
skills.title: Woodworker

skills.description: Writers put words together to tell stories and describe ideas. Language is our tool, and communication our goal. We try hard to be observant, honest, and insightful.
skills.title: Writer

skills.description: A large, hairy creature resembling a human or bear. Is said to live in the snowy mountains everywhere.
skills.title: Yeti

skills.description: Zoologists study the great animal kingdom – all things that crawl, walk, swim or fly. With a keen sense for animal biology, behavior and habitat, we puzzle over the mysteries of evolution.
skills.title: Zoologist

challenges.description: Make a video describing and showing your acting warmup. Acting warmups can be tongue twisters, quick reaction games, or emotion exercises. Anything that requires quick thinking and real words.
challenges.title: Create an Acting Warm Up

challenges.description: Record a 15 Second Intro impersonating a famous celebrity or character. Make sure it's one that everyone knows. If you're feeling it, wear a costume. A video is a must.
challenges.title: Perform an Impersonation

challenges.description: Film a 1-2 minute video of yourself reciting a memorized monologue. Try to recite it from memory rather than read from a page or screen. That way, it sounds more natural. And... ACTION!
challenges.title: Memorize a Monologue

challenges.description: Read throughs are a great way to familiarize yourself with a script. Film a short video as you and your friends do a read through of something you've written, or pull from an existing script. There's a link in the examples.
challenges.title: Do a Read Through

challenges.description: Improv is when you make up an acting scene on the spot. Gather some friends to do this because the best improv scenes are created by different actors reacting to each other in unexpected ways. Record a video of your improv.
challenges.title: Perform Improv

challenges.description: Film a 1-2 minute dialogue between you and another person. You can use one you've written yourself or pull a conversation from your favorite play or movie. Costumes are a great addition.
challenges.title: Film a 2 Person Dialogue

challenges.description: Shakespeare is the most famous english playwright. Perform and film a 2-5 minute scene from a Shakespeare play.
challenges.title: Perform Shakespeare

challenges.description: Stage combat is planned to a tee and practiced repeatedly, not only to ensure the safety of the actors, but also so it looks like the real thing. Share a video of your stage combat, and share any tips and secrets that you used to make it look real.
challenges.title: Do Stage Combat

challenges.description: Share a pic of you in a show or sing a number from your favorite musical. You can perform a capella or with a soundtrack, but just be sure to belt it out in a clear video!
challenges.title: Perform Musical Theater

challenges.description: Casting allows anglers to place their lures exactly where the fish are. Share a photo or a video of you casting your line.
challenges.title: Practice Your Cast

challenges.description: Tackle boxes can take many forms, but all have plenty of compartments. Find a box to use, or build your own, and fill it with the bait and tools you need to catch fish.
challenges.title: Assemble a Tackle Box

challenges.description: Live bait is oftentimes the best way to catch fish. Learn how to find and gather bait then share a video of your techniques.
challenges.title: Find Live Bait

challenges.description: Head to your fishing hole and see what you can catch. Once you've hooked one, reel it in, measure it, and snap a photo of you with your catch.
challenges.title: Catch a Fish

challenges.description: Fly Fishing is art form that takes years to master. Record a video of you practicing your cast.
challenges.title: Learn to Fly Cast

challenges.description: Design and fabricate a custom lure however you'd like. Share photos or video of your process and the finished lure.
challenges.title: Make Your Own Lures

challenges.description: Share photos of your fish before and after filleting it and remember to be extra careful when using a fillet knife – they're super sharp.
challenges.title: Fillet a Fish

challenges.description: Once you've caught and cleaned your fish, cook it and eat it. Share any recipes you use and take a picture or video of the cooked fish.
challenges.title: Eat What You Catch

challenges.description: Making flies for your fly rod will allow you to have the right fly for any season and fish. Give fly tying a shot and post photos of your creations.
challenges.title: Tie Your Own Flies

challenges.description: Anyone can catch a fish with a rod, but can you catch one with your arm? See if you have what it takes to noodle a catfish.
challenges.title: Go Noodling

challenges.description: Fish don't like to live in water that's polluted. Find ways to keep your water clean and share it with a video.
challenges.title: Keep the Water Clean

challenges.description: Make a flip book on a small notebook or a stack of index cards, then upload the project as a video.
challenges.title: Make a Flip Book Movie

challenges.description: Move something a little and take a picture. Repeat. Small movements and many frames works best. Upload a video of your stop-motion
challenges.title: Do Stop-Motion with Objects

challenges.description: Do stop-motion with clay, called 'Claymation'.
challenges.title: Make Claymation

challenges.description: Real people make great animated puppets! Make it look like they're performing magic or levitating.
challenges.title: Animate People

challenges.description: Make a grid, or use ours, then fill it in shot-by-shot for every scene of a story you want to animate.
challenges.title: Make a Storyboard

challenges.description: Design a character that you want to turn into animation. Tell as much as possible about the character through your drawing.
challenges.title: Make a Character Design

challenges.description: Animate with a series of drawings, then upload the video.
challenges.title: Animate 2D Drawings

challenges.description: Breath life into a toy or other figure by making a stop-motion puppet movie. A figure with wire inside, or one with stiff, posable joints, works best.
challenges.title: Animate a Doll or Figure

challenges.description: To add realism to your scene, shoot your animation over a background painting or in sculpted scenery. Show us the original background you created for your animation!
challenges.title: Make an Animation Background

challenges.description: A sandbox can become a desert, a hole in a tree can be a cave. Send your characters on outdoor adventures, or just make leaves and stones dance.
challenges.title: Make an Animation Outdoors

challenges.description: Make a rendered movie with a computer animation program. These days, most animated movies are made on a computer.
challenges.title: Make a Computer Animation

challenges.description: Show the natural movement of fire, water, wind, landslides, or falling leaves in an animation movie. Observe nature, then recreate it with an animation.
challenges.title: Animate Natural Patterns

challenges.description: A zoetrope is a cool optical toy that uses a spinning mechanism and a series of drawings to show movement. Use a kit or build a zoetrope from scratch, then share your final mechanism and animation with a video.
challenges.title: Build a Zoetrope

challenges.description: Special cameras, lights, tools, and computer programs are used in animation. Get them together and you've got an animation studio!
challenges.title: Make an Animation Studio

challenges.description: Every great app starts with an idea. The best ideas solve big problems and help all kinds of people. In a short video, share an idea for an app you've invented. Explain who would use your app and how it would improve their lives.
challenges.title: Pitch an App Idea

challenges.description: Wireframes are sketches that app makers use to plan out how an app might look or work. They can be neat and detailed or small and messy. Share some sketches of at least three different screens (or pages) for your app idea.
challenges.title: Draw App Wireframes

challenges.description: The first step for app development is preparing your tools. To get started with iOS, install Xcode. For Android, download Android Studio and the Android SDK. Share a screenshot showing off your installed tools.
challenges.title: Set Up A Dev Environment

challenges.description: Once you understand the basics of programming in Objective-C, Swift, or Java, write a beginner app that displays the text “Hello World!” Share a screenshot of your code and your app in an app simulator.
challenges.title: Create a "Hello World" App

challenges.description: A prototype is a detailed model that shows how an app will look and work. Prototypes can be made with detailed drawings, digital designs, or with free programs like InVision. In a video, show off your prototype and explain how your app idea works.
challenges.title: Prototype an App

challenges.description: Once you're ready to make a real app, use a digital program to design what it will look like. Professional app designers use software like Adobe Photoshop or Sketch. Share finished designs for at least 3 screens of your app.
challenges.title: Design Digital App Screens

challenges.description: There are tons of ways to organize things in an app. Code a menu—slide-out, drop-down, or anything else—for practice or in a real project. Share a screenshot of your menu and explain how you made it in a video or the comments.
challenges.title: Code an App Menu

challenges.description: To-do list apps let a user save items to a list and remove them by checking a box or swiping. Code a basic to-do list app for iOS or Android, and share a video or a few screenshots showing off what you made.
challenges.title: Build a To-Do List App

challenges.description: Apps use waiting screens called "splash screens" to show that they're loading. They usually have looping animations to show that they're still working and haven't crashed. Use code or software to make an animation  for a splash screen, and share it with a video.
challenges.title: Animate a Splash Screen

challenges.description: There are tons of different ways to build a mobile game—trivia, puzzles, arcade, and many more. Program an interactive game for any mobile device. Post a video showing your game in action and explain how you built it.
challenges.title: Build a Game App

challenges.description: Mobile apps have the ability to use the phone's location services and maps to make really helpful tools. Experiment with programming location services or maps into a simple app, and share a screenshot or video of your creation.
challenges.title: Build an App with a Map

challenges.description: Build an app that uses sensor hardware in your smartphone. Your app could sense rotation, detect its location, or make a sound when you shake it. Share a video explaining which sensor you used and showing how your app works.
challenges.title: Build an App Using Phone Sensors

challenges.description: Once you're done coding and debugging, you're ready to share your app with the world! Share a screenshot and a link to your app in the Apple App Store or the Google Play store. (Note: This isn't free! Make sure your parents are cool with it first.)
challenges.title: Ship Your App

challenges.description: A hackathon is an event when a group of people work together to make app or other big projects in a short period of time. Gather a group of friends and attend or host a hackathon! Share some pictures or video of your event, and show off what you make!
challenges.title: Attend a Hackathon

challenges.description: Build something solid to shoot at. Take a picture of your target after you hit it with your arrow.
challenges.title: Build A Target

challenges.description: Do some research and find a bow that fits you just right. Make sure to include an explanation why your bow is right for you.
challenges.title: Set Up Your Bow

challenges.description: The right form comes from practice and is essential for a good shot. Take a video or clear picture as you practice your shot. Share any tips you have.
challenges.title: Practice Your Shot

challenges.description: Add a personal touch by putting feathers on your arrows! Post a photo or video of arrows you have fletched.
challenges.title: Fletch an Arrow

challenges.description: You can use all sorts of materials to create a system for holding your arrows. Get creative and build one! Record a video of your quiver in use.
challenges.title: Make a Quiver

challenges.description: Add inserts to your arrow shafts so you can attach points, or haft a wooden shaft. Explain how you did it with a quick video.
challenges.title: Add Arrow Points

challenges.description: Get artistic and add some flare to your arrow shafts. Paint your arrows and share by posting a photo or video of your completed crest.
challenges.title: Crest Arrows

challenges.description: Turn several strands of fiber into strong string for your bow. Don't forget to add knocking points! Share a video showing your technique or explain how you did it.
challenges.title: Make a Bowstring

challenges.description: Completely customize your archery experience by creating your own bow! Share a picture or video of your completed, custom bow. Bonus points if you include a video showing it shoot an arrow!
challenges.title: Build a Bow

challenges.description: Create a detailed, colored illustration of your fantasy building in its environment.
challenges.title: Draw an Imaginary Building

challenges.description: Make a sketch from a real building. Choose a detail of the building you love to look at.
challenges.title: Sketch a Real Building

challenges.description: Use Minecraft to build an architectural model.
challenges.title: Make Architecture in Minecraft

challenges.description: Make an Axon, or Axonometric, drawing. This type of drawing is not actually how we see, but can be helpful in showing the overall view.
challenges.title: Make an Axon Drawing

challenges.description: Draw a two-point perspective view of a building. This type of drawing mimics how we actually see things in space.
challenges.title: Draft a Perspective View

challenges.description: Make a video of yourself describing an architectural style that is common in your area.
challenges.title: Make a Local Architecture Documentary

challenges.description: Create a building sketch in the style of an architect. Use straight, confident lines, square corners, and patterns for shadows and surface texture.
challenges.title: Sketch Like an Architect

challenges.description: Make a floor plan – as if you were looking down on your building from above. Include details about rooms, doors and windows.
challenges.title: Draft a Floor Plan

challenges.description: Draw a sliced open side view – also called a Section – of your building.
challenges.title: Draft a Section

challenges.description: Draft an Elevation. Elevations are straight-on drawings of the faces of a building: front, sides or rear.
challenges.title: Draw an Elevation

challenges.description: Upload a model of a design you created with 3D software, like Sketchup.
challenges.title: Build a Digital 3D Model

challenges.description: Build a detailed, to-scale model of a design you created. Use materials like cardboard, chipboard, wood, sticks and glue. Lots of glue!
challenges.title: Make a Scale Model Building

challenges.description: Present your own model or design in an intelligent spoken description to friends or family. Record it with a video.
challenges.title: Make a Presentation Video

challenges.description: A spacesuit is more than an astronaut's outfit—it's a one-person spacecraft. Spacesuits must let astronauts bend and move and should store oxygen, water, and other useful tools to help them work in space. Invent the ultimate spacesuit and label each unique feature.
challenges.title: Design a Spacesuit

challenges.description: All astronauts show be able to understand the Russian language. Astronauts-in-training take hours of Russian classes to prepare for speaking with Russian Mission Control. Learn at least 3 Russian words or phrases and share them in a video.
challenges.title: Learn 3 Russian Phrases

challenges.description: Moving underwater is similar to moving in space, which means all Astronauts should be strong swimmers. Swimming laps builds great stamina and is a required part of an Astronaut's fitness exam. Share a video of you swimming at least 3 laps in a pool.
challenges.title: Swim Laps

challenges.description: The universe is a big place, and scientists on Earth still aren't sure if extra-terrestrial life exists out there. Do you think aliens exist? Explain your opinion in a video. Share proof if you've got it!
challenges.title: Share Your Opinion on Extra-Terrestrial Life

challenges.description: Orbital mechanics is a complex kind of physics that helps us understand how things move in space. Try out a simulator like Kerbal Space Program or NASA's GMAT to understand how these mechanics work.
challenges.title: Use an Orbital Mechanics Simulator

challenges.description: Did you know that there's a body of law related to space-related things? Research and learn about the current space laws and their history. In a video, explain your opinion on space law,  share cool things you found out, or explain a law you think should be added.
challenges.title: Research Space Law

challenges.description: Collecting dirt and rock samples for analysis is an important part of space exploration. Collect at least 2 soil samples from your yard or from a foreign source. Share a photo of what you collected and label things like the soil's texture or pH for each sample.
challenges.title: Analyze Soil Samples

challenges.description: Scuba diving is a crucial skill for any astronaut-in-training to master. To get used to space's zero-gravity environment, astronauts practice for their missions deep underwater. Share a shot of you in the water or in your scuba gear.
challenges.title: Go Scuba Diving

challenges.description: Space Camp is the perfect place for Astronauts to start their careers. It's the best way to learn basic engineering, learn about current missions to space, and meet real astronauts. Share a picture of you at space camp.
challenges.title: Attend Space Camp

challenges.description: Astronauts use programming and logic skills to figure out tough tasks with only a few resources. Program a microcontroller (like an Arduino or Raspberry Pi) to solve a problem—move a motor, control an actuator—and share a video of what you've made.
challenges.title: Program a Microcontroller

challenges.description: Astronauts use remote-controlled (RC) vehicles like rovers to explore unfamiliar planets and environments. To understand how they work, build an RC vehicle from scratch. Share a video of your process and your RC car in action.
challenges.title: Build an RC Vehicle

challenges.description: Having flying experience and a pilot's license is a required part of becoming an astronaut. Once you turn 16, earn your license and share a picture of it. (Make sure to cover or blur out your name and personal information!)
challenges.title: Earn Your Pilot License

challenges.description: Make a realistic model of an asteroid from materials of your choice. Describe the characteristics that make it realistic and use labels as necessary.
challenges.title: Model an Asteroid

challenges.description: Make a solar viewer and take a picture of the sun through it.
challenges.title: Make a Solar Viewer

challenges.description: Make a scale 3D model of the solar system to try and grasp its massive size. Use labels when necessary.
challenges.title: Build a Model Solar System

challenges.description: Make a sundial and compare its reading to an actual clock. How far off is it? Take a side-by-side picture to show the two readings.
challenges.title: Make a Sundial

challenges.description: Think about challenges of traveling to or living in space. Design something that will help you live in outer space, and explain how your device works with a video or in the comments of your project.
challenges.title: Design a Space Aiding Apparatus

challenges.description: Take a time lapse photo or video of a celestial body in the sky, such as a planet or a star, and watch it move! Share your photo or video, or make a how-to.
challenges.title: Take a Time Lapse of a Celestial Body

challenges.description: Sketch or prototype your ideas that will protect the Earth from an oncoming asteroid! Make a video and describe how your solution works.
challenges.title: Protect  Earth from Asteroids

challenges.description: Astronomy flashlights allow you to set up telescopes and read star charts without losing your night-vision. Red light is cool that way.
challenges.title: Build an Astronomy Flashlight

challenges.description: Build an astrolabe and measure the height of the tallest thing in your neighborhood. Record a video and mention how tall you think it is.
challenges.title: Build an Astrolabe

challenges.description: Create your own spectrometer and take a picture through the eyepiece as you look at an object
challenges.title: Make a Spectroscope

challenges.description: Get yourself a near space balloon and attach a cheap camera to it. Take a video from the edge of space!
challenges.title: Launch a Near-Space Balloon

challenges.description: Build a telescope with real lenses. Take a picture of your creation along with a photo looking through the eyepiece.
challenges.title: Make a Telescope

challenges.description: Predict where an asteroid, comet or planet will be in a few days. Then compare your prediction with the actual location. Share your prediction and results with a video.
challenges.title: Predict the Path of an Object in Orbit

challenges.description: Build your own dome and projector to immerse your audience in the wonder of the night sky. Take a video and show it off.
challenges.title: Build a Planetarium Dome and Projector

challenges.description: Find a tree, building or boulder, whatever...just make sure it's safe! Take a video yourself climbing it or snap a pic that provides a good reference to it's height.
challenges.title: Climb Something Taller Than You

challenges.description: Snap video of yourself showing how you build strength.
challenges.title: Develop Strength

challenges.description: Take videos of your gymnastics to track your progress and share your tips and tricks.
challenges.title: Perform Gymnastics

challenges.description: Find a pick up game in your area or join a team at school. Have someone take a video of you in action or share a photo of you and your team.
challenges.title: Play a Team Sport

challenges.description: Let your creativity and athleticism shine and make up your own game.  In a photo or video, explain the rules of your game. (Even better, grab some friends and show how to play!)
challenges.title: Invent an Athletic Game

challenges.description: Find a recipe suited for your athletic endeavors and make it. Be sure to explain why it's good to eat. You can do this in a video or in the comments. Take a picture or video of your tasty, healthy food.
challenges.title: Cook an Athletic Diet

challenges.description: Swimming is a great form of exercise. Swim 10 laps, tread water for 60 seconds, compete in a race, or explain how to do your favorite stroke. Share a picture or video of you in the water for this challenge.
challenges.title: Swim

challenges.description: Take a video as you make the city your playground.
challenges.title: Perform Parkour

challenges.description: Snap a video of some basic martial arts moves or put together a routine.
challenges.title: Perform Martial Arts

challenges.description: Before competing you have to train hard. Share your training routine with pics or video.
challenges.title: Train for a Competition

challenges.description: Races are a great way to show off your skill. Share a photo or video of you competing in a race, and if you got a ribbon or a trophy, show it off!
challenges.title: Complete a Race

challenges.description: Explain all of the obstacles in your course and then take a video as you complete it.
challenges.title: Run an Obstacle Course

challenges.description: Show off your athletic prowess by performing an extreme sport.
challenges.title: Go Extreme!

challenges.description: Install Node.js, Google Chrome Browser and Sublime Text editor. Take a screenshot with these programs open.
challenges.title: Set up a Development Environment

challenges.description: Run the Node.js server we've made and see just how browsers and servers talk to each other. Upload a screenshot of the server when it has started.
challenges.title: Run a Node.js Server

challenges.description: Now that you get what a web server does, use Node.js to write your own! Use the resources here and submit a screenshot of your new server code.
challenges.title: Write a Simple HTTP Server

challenges.description: Learn about NPM and use a Node.js module to see how fast your server is. Take a screenshot of your speed!
challenges.title: Clock Server Speed

challenges.description: APIs are the way servers translate the data they give to websites and other apps. Query DIY's API and upload a screenshot of your result.
challenges.title: Query an API

challenges.description: Create a server that talks to other servers – a proxy! Follow the intro and get your DIY Stream's API, then take a screenshot of the JSON!
challenges.title: Create a Proxy Server

challenges.description: Use the intro and Heroku to deploy, and upload a screenshot of your live web app.
challenges.title: Deploy a Web App

challenges.description: Show off all of your livestock and explain how you take care of them. Make sure your photo or video clearly shows your livestock.
challenges.title: Raise Livestock

challenges.description: Using a video or a series of photos, give a tour of your backyard farm. Explain what you've planted, what animals you have, and what you want to do in the future.
challenges.title: Show Off Your Backyard Farm

challenges.description: Milk, eggs, wool, honey... all good things that come from animals. Explain what you're harvesting and how you plan on using it.
challenges.title: Harvest an Animal Product

challenges.description: Draw a map of your land with your garden plans, water sources, and areas that get sun and shade and add labels.
challenges.title: Draw a Map of Your Farm

challenges.description: Perennial plants come back year after year, often producing bigger and better harvests as they grow. Try and plant a local perennial.
challenges.title: Plant Perennial Crops

challenges.description: Start by testing to see how much sand, silt, and clay your soil has has.  No matter what, adding compost always helps the situation!
challenges.title: Manage Soil

challenges.description: Find the hardiness zone of your area and list three plants that work best in that zone.
challenges.title: Find Your Hardiness Zone

challenges.description: Unlike perennial crops, annual vegetables need to be replanted every year. Start early enough and you can grow your plants from seed.
challenges.title: Plant Annual Crops

challenges.description: With careful planting and timely pruning, fruit trees can bring shade, beauty, and, of course, food! Plant a new tree or care for an existing one.
challenges.title: Tend a Fruit Tree

challenges.description: Research your crops before picking them to make sure you're harvesting at the right time. Share what you've picked with a video.
challenges.title: Harvest Crops

challenges.description: Raised beds are a great way to grow things when you don't have a big yard. Shoot a video of your raised bed and explain how you made it.
challenges.title: Make a Raised Bed

challenges.description: Save seeds from the best of your harvest to plant the following season. Take a video and share techniques on how to collect and store seeds.
challenges.title: Collect and Save Seeds

challenges.description: Go take a good look at your land. What areas get sun or shade? Where is it wet or dry? Record your observations and share them with a video.
challenges.title: Observe Your Land

challenges.description: You may find yourself with far more produce than you can use at one time. Dry, can, freeze, or ferment extra food so you can enjoy it year-round.
challenges.title: Preserve Your Harvest

challenges.description: Building a barn, coop, shed, or pen will keep your animals (and your plants) happy, healthy, and safe.
challenges.title: Build an Animal Enclosure

challenges.description: Take the guesswork out of your watering by building an irrigation system for your backyard farm.
challenges.title: Build an Irrigation System

challenges.description: A backyard farm will produce a lot of waste. Don't let that waste go to waste! Create a composting system to recycle nutrients back into your soil.
challenges.title: Produce Compost

challenges.description: Often the best thing about creating something is sharing it with others. Start a CSA, take your produce to market, or give your bounty to a friend.
challenges.title: Share Your Harvest

challenges.description: Gather all of your ingredients and utensils that you'll need for baking, lay them out neatly, and take a photo of your space.
challenges.title: Set Up a Bake Space

challenges.description: Most recipes list ingredients by volume, but measuring by weight is more accurate. Show how you measure ingredients with a few photos or a video.
challenges.title: Measure Ingredients

challenges.description: Cakes, brownies, cookies, banana bread, biscuits, cornbread, muffins, pancakes or scones. It's all good.
challenges.title: Bake a Quick Bread

challenges.description: Transform your stale bread into anything from French toast to crunchy croutons. Show what you've made with a photo or video.
challenges.title: Revive Stale Bread

challenges.description: A simple loaf of bread uses flour, water, salt, and yeast. Take a picture of your loaf before AND after baking.
challenges.title: Bake a Loaf

challenges.description: By scoring (or slashing) your bread, you not only make it look cool, but you help it to expand and grow during the baking process.
challenges.title: Score Your Bread

challenges.description: Pizza is better when it's homemade. Grab your ingredients and a baking stone, then get your hands sticky creating a delicious pizza dough! Share a picture of your uncooked dough. Bonus points if you include a pic of your finished pizza!
challenges.title: Make Pizza Dough

challenges.description: Tossing dough takes some skill, but it's an important step to make sure your crust is even and free of holes and bubbles. Grab a lump of pizza dough and share a video of yourself tossing it high in the air!
challenges.title: Toss Pizza Dough

challenges.description: No matter whether sweet or savory, a pie should always have a flaky crust and a perfect filling. Bonus points if you add a lattice (woven dough) on top! Share some pictures of your process and finished pie.
challenges.title: Bake a Pie

challenges.description: There are commercial yeasts, which are fast acting and quick to use, but wild yeast creates more complex flavors, texture, and nutrition.
challenges.title: Make a Sourdough Culture

challenges.description: Some people have an allergy to gluten. You can make your own gluten free flour, or buy it in a store. Bake something tasty with it.
challenges.title: Bake Gluten-Free

challenges.description: There's no better way to appreciate the process of bread than by growing the grains yourself. Find a patch of land and start growing!
challenges.title: Grow Grain

challenges.description: There are all kinds of mills designed for the home kitchen. You can even use an old juicer or a high-powered blender to make your own flour.
challenges.title: Mill Grain

challenges.description: Creeper, Steve, Angry Birds, Mario, Spongebob and any other character you can think of, all make sweet looking cakes.
challenges.title: Bake a Character Cake

challenges.description: In the old days, bakers made their own ovens, usually from bricks or cob. Build an oven that can withstand high heat and take a video.
challenges.title: Make an Oven

challenges.description: Get back to the basics – drum a beat on a real drum or any other object.
challenges.title: Drum a Beat!

challenges.description: By using your lips, breath, and voice you can sound incredibly close to a real instrument, or sounds that have never been heard.
challenges.title: Try Beatboxing

challenges.description: Use editing software to remix a song you like, or do it the old school way – with turntables! You can even sample the catchiest part for a brand new track.
challenges.title: Remix a Song

challenges.description: Make a looped recording, or drum the basic ingredient of a beat – usually counted in groups of four.
challenges.title: Make a Looped Beat

challenges.description: Record a sound – any sound – and bring it into editing software, or make it playable on a drum pad.
challenges.title: Sample a Real Instrument or Voice

challenges.description: Find a computer or analog synth and make a beat with it. A synth, or synthesizer, is an electronic instrument used for making drum beats and other sounds.
challenges.title: Make a Beat with a Synth

challenges.description: Find a track on DIY and remix it. Make sure to mention where it came from, and share it with a video.
challenges.title: Sample a Beat from DIY

challenges.description: Layer your looped beats up into a track! Learn the tools like Audacity or Garageband that will help you.
challenges.title: Make Multi-Track Music

challenges.description: Make a Hip Hop song using software, or just bust out with some household objects.
challenges.title: Make a Hip Hop Beat

challenges.description: Electronic dance music has a fast beat made for dancing. A synthesizer often appears instead of vocals.
challenges.title: Make Electronic Dance Music

challenges.description: If you're making a beat from samples, you'll want to find the most awesome and rare sources, not just stuff everybody knows. That's why beatmakers go digging for old records.
challenges.title: Dig for Records

challenges.description: Create a musical interface by building an electronic instrument from various parts.
challenges.title: Make Beats with a Custom Music Interface

challenges.description: Polyyrhythms are beats that contain multiple rhythms, instead of just sticking to the same meter. They are more complex, and sometimes more interesting to the ear.
challenges.title: Make a Polyrhythm

challenges.description: Upload a track to Soundcloud, then share your link in the comments. Soundcloud is a website where electronic musicians often share their work.
challenges.title: Upload a Song to Soundcloud

challenges.description: DJ a dance party for 3 or more that makes everyone move!
challenges.title: Make a Dance Party

challenges.description: Plant blue or yellow flowers to attract bees, since these are the colors they like the most. Take a picture of your flower, preferably with bees on it.
challenges.title: Attract Bees with Plants

challenges.description: Smoke makes bees calm and docile. Build a smoker from things found at home and upload a video of it smoking.
challenges.title: Make a Homemade Bee Smoker

challenges.description: Beekeeping suits cover your whole body and are sealed from any gaps that could allow bees to sneak in. Make one from things you already have.
challenges.title: Make a Beekeeping Suit

challenges.description: One of the perks of beekeeping is the honey! You can harvest it by spinning it out or melting the wax comb. Take a picture of the natural comb.
challenges.title: Harvest Honey

challenges.description: Once you've gotten all of the honey from the comb, you can melt it down to render the beeswax. Weigh your wax and post a picture of it.
challenges.title: Render Beeswax

challenges.description: Mason bees don't sting, and they're 100 times better than honeybees at pollinating flowers. Build a home for mason bees.
challenges.title: Build a House for Mason Bees

challenges.description: Snap a video of honeybees doing the Waggle Dance or a video of you doing your own version.
challenges.title: Discover the Waggle Dance of the Honey Bee

challenges.description: A bee hive isn't just a home for bees. It's also the place where they store their honey. Take pictures of your materials and finished hive.
challenges.title: Build a Bee Hive

challenges.description: Clean and lube your chain and create a how-to and show everyone else how to maintain that smooth ride.
challenges.title: Create a Chain Lube How-To

challenges.description: Wacky colors, custom seat covers, crazy frame mods, and whatever else you can think of.
challenges.title: Customize Your Bike

challenges.description: You ran over glass. Bummer. Turn lemons into lemonade and take a how-to video as you either patch the flat or replace the tube.
challenges.title: Fix a Flat

challenges.description: Construct a bicycle repair stand using easy to find parts and share your creation with a video.
challenges.title: Build a Repair Stand

challenges.description: Set up a video camera and film while you adjust your rear derailleur and help make your bike shift smoothly!
challenges.title: Adjust a Rear Derailleur

challenges.description: Wrap your own handlebars and show off your craft!
challenges.title: Wrap Handlebars

challenges.description: Make your own fenders, install them on your bike and keep your back clean of mud and water.
challenges.title: Make Bike Fenders

challenges.description: Using a truing stand or dishing tool, adjust the spokes on your wheel to line it up perfectly.
challenges.title: True A Wheel

challenges.description: Cycling at night is dangerous without a proper light. Build one and show us how bright it is with a video at night.
challenges.title: Build a Bike Light

challenges.description: A bike trailer can help you carry large loads over long distances. Design your own bike trailer, construct it and show us how much stuff you can haul!
challenges.title: Build a Bike Trailer

challenges.description: Every so often, your bike can get so dirty that you'll want to do a complete tear down. Take a video of your entire process and share it.
challenges.title: Tear Down, Clean & Reassemble a Bike

challenges.description: Old rusty bikes are easy to find at garage sales or even in your own garage! Find an unloved bike, restore it to it's former glory and ride it.
challenges.title: Restore an Old Bike

challenges.description: Draw a food web to show how different life forms in an ecosystem depend on each other for survival.
challenges.title: Draw a Food Web

challenges.description: Create a model of double helix DNA strand. These are the microscopic set of instructions that tells cells how to replicate themselves.
challenges.title: Make a Model of DNA

challenges.description: Make a model of a cell. Research the anatomy of a cell, then make it out of food, clay, or any other material.
challenges.title: Make a Model Cell

challenges.description: Bring a specimen back to your laboratory and preserve it. Make sure not to disturb a natural habitat. Take a video of your preserved specimen.
challenges.title: Preserve a Natural Specimen

challenges.description: Use food to demonstrate the biological process called Osmosis. Share a picture showing the food before and after osmosis, or take a video/time-lapse to show the effect in action.
challenges.title: Do Osmosis with Food

challenges.description: Use food dye to see how plants get the water and nutrients they need through tiny capillary tubes.
challenges.title: Demonstrate Capillary Action

challenges.description: Some living things are easy to see, but others require special tools to observe. Create something that will let you look at life in a different way.
challenges.title: Build a Bio-Observer

challenges.description: Use enzymes to remove the long DNA strand from its cell. DNA is too small to cut out with a knife, but enzymes break down material into smaller pieces. Try this on yourself, a strawberry, or any other form of life.
challenges.title: Extract DNA

challenges.description: You can buy pre-prepared slides, but it's way more fun to make your own. That way, you can look at whatever you like! Take a video showing how you prepared your slide. Bonus points for showing a clear image of your slide under the microscope.
challenges.title: Prepare a Slide

challenges.description: So much life is invisible to the naked eye. That's where a microscope comes in handy. Get a microscope (or make your own) and a drop of pond water, and check out everything you're missing out on! Share a shot of what you see.
challenges.title: Observe Life Under a Microscope

challenges.description: Harvest live bacteria and grow it in a petri dish. Bacteria are some of the smallest living things – but they're everywhere!  Some are harmless, some make us sick, and some we can't live without.
challenges.title: Grow a Bacteria Culture

challenges.description: Use a dissection software, or dissect a worm, frog, snake or fish. Take screenshots or pictures along the way. If you're using a real specimen, be mindful that it was once a living, breathing thing.
challenges.title: Dissect a Specimen

challenges.description: There are millions of living organisms all around you, hiding just outside your range of vision! Build a microscope and check them out.
challenges.title: Make a Microscope

challenges.description: Biologists can use their knowledge of an organism to help it survive.  Learn about moss, then help it grow in some unusual ways.
challenges.title: Make Living Art with Moss

challenges.description: Use littleBits to make a bot that combines craft materials like crayons, paint and markers to produce a work of art.
challenges.title: Make an Art Bot

challenges.description: Use the fan bit to harness the power of the wind to propel a toy, blow a huge bubble or create a confetti cannon.
challenges.title: Build a Wind Tunnel

challenges.description: Make a light-activated alarm to rise and shine with the sun.
challenges.title: Wake Up with the Sun

challenges.description: Fashion an accessory using Bits and craft materials. The light wire is especially useful here.
challenges.title: Make a Wearable Circuit

challenges.description: Increase circulation by crafting a windmill out of Bits and craft materials.
challenges.title: Create a Windmill

challenges.description: Decorate your room or window with an animated sign that lights up.
challenges.title: Create a Flashing Sign

challenges.description: Use the sound sensor to create a project that's controlled by noise. Your voice works perfectly for this.
challenges.title: Build a Sound-Triggered Circuit

challenges.description: If you get the Bits to interact with each other, you can create a sweet Rube Goldberg machine.
challenges.title: Create a Rube Goldberg Machine

challenges.description: Use littlebits to create a wheel or vehicle that can change speeds and go fast or slow.
challenges.title: Alter a Vehicle’s Speed

challenges.description: There are lots of toys without electronic components. Choose one to "bitify" with an electronic circuit.
challenges.title: Bitify a Toy

challenges.description: Keep score with a littleBits game! Use Bits and craft materials to create a game that at least two people can play.
challenges.title: Design a Game for Friends

challenges.description: Secure your room from parents or siblings by making a noisy littleBits alarm.
challenges.title: Ward Off Intruders

challenges.description: Use your littleBits and create something BIG. Four foot sharks, gigantic puppets and monster Ferris wheels are all really cool.
challenges.title: Make Something BIG

challenges.description: No needle and thread? No problem! With a few folds and a scissor cut, you can create a quick and easy 8- or 16-page book using just a single sheet of paper.
challenges.title: Fold a Book from a Single Sheet

challenges.description: The most basic way to bind a book is a method called the pamphlet stitch. All you really need is some paper, a needle, and some thread! Sew a small book using the pamphlet stitch and share what you've made with a picture.
challenges.title: Stitch a Booklet

challenges.description: A zine is a small hand-made magazine, usually about a specific theme. They're made by collaging a collection of photographs, drawings, or text about the theme into a booklet format. Make a zine and share a video or series of pics showing the pages inside.
challenges.title: Make a Zine

challenges.description: Accordion binding is a method that gets its name from its zig-zag appearance. Accordion books can be taped, glued, or sewn together, then attached to covers to make a professional-looking and fairly easy book.
challenges.title: Make an Accordion Book

challenges.description: Stab binding is a technique that uses a stack of single sheets of paper and some stitching to make a durable book that's perfect for a scrapbook or journal. Start with the basic sewing pattern, then experiment with some more complex stitches when you're ready.
challenges.title: Sew a Stab Binding

challenges.description: Perfect binding is used to bind softcover books and magazines. Instead of thread, a layer of glue is added to the side of a stack of paper to hold it together. Once you've mastered this technique, you can make tons of impressive books in no time.
challenges.title: Perfect Bind a Book

challenges.description: Many techniques can be used to bind together a pile of recycled materials. Pick a binding method you like, then use food wrappers, old newspaper, or anything else you can find to bind a unique book.
challenges.title: Make a Book from Recycled Materials

challenges.description: Finished books can be transformed into a variety of unique sculptures and art pieces. Using a book you've made yourself or an old book you don't want anymore, cut, fold, glue, paint, or otherwise alter it into something new and awesome.
challenges.title: Transform a Book into Art

challenges.description: A flag book uses the accordion technique and a series of pieces of paper (or "flags") to create a unique effect. When read, the individual flags form pages, and when completely opened, the flags overlap and lay flat to create a cool single surface.
challenges.title: Bind a Flag Book

challenges.description: A tunnel book uses a layered pieces of cut paper and two small accordions to make a 3D scene. They can be used to tell a story or create an amazing piece of art. Share a photo of your completed tunnel book.
challenges.title: Create a Tunnel Book

challenges.description: Coptic binding is a type of hand-sewn binding. This technique can tricky, but it's great for homemade journals and sketchbooks because the pages lay totally flat when it's opened. Share a shot of your finished book.
challenges.title: Sew a Coptic Binding

challenges.description: Hardcover books (or "case binding") can be complex to make, but the result looks awesome and can be used for nearly anything. Create a sewn or glued book block and a wrapped hard cover to place it in. Share some pics of your process and final book.
challenges.title: Make a Hardcover Book

challenges.description: A clamshell (or "drop spine") box is a protective case that unfolds and holds books or other valuables. They prevent wear and tear on bindings, making homemade books last forever! Try making your own clamshell box from book board or cardboard.
challenges.title: Make a Clamshell Box

challenges.description: Book cloth is a type of thin fabric backed with paper that is used to wrap book covers. You can buy it at most craft stores, but if you have a specific fabric or look you want, try making some yourself! Share your process and a shot of your final cloth.
challenges.title: Make Homemade Book Cloth

challenges.description: A screw press uses adjustable screws to compress a book after it has been sewn or glued. They're important tools that evenly flatten bindings and prevent warped pages. Make a homemade press, and share some process pics and a shot of your book press in action.
challenges.title: Build a Screw Press

challenges.description: Take a video as you (correctly) identify a plant.
challenges.title: Record Yourself Identifying a Plant

challenges.description: Take a picture a day of a growing plant for at least 10 days and turn it into a time-lapse video.
challenges.title: Time-Lapse a Plant's Growth

challenges.description: Shoot a video of yourself dissecting a plant. Point out at least 3 plant parts.
challenges.title: Dissect a Plant

challenges.description: A botanist kit contains items like tweezers, a sharp knife and a needle tipped probe. Create a cool case for your tools and put it all together.
challenges.title: Assemble a Botany Kit

challenges.description: You can make a plant press from simple materials that you already have. Press some plants and show how your press works.
challenges.title: Build a Plant Press

challenges.description: Identify a poisonous plant and explain what would happen if you rub up against it or ingest it.
challenges.title: Identify a Poisonous Plant

challenges.description: A microscope is the perfect tool to get a closer peek at plants. Once you've focused your lens and you have a good view, try and snap a picture.
challenges.title: Explore Plants Microscopically

challenges.description: Pick some seeds and germinate them in different ways. A good start is using paper towels vs soil. Be sure to document the results!
challenges.title: Germinate Seeds

challenges.description: By mounting and labeling pressed plants, you can have something that is both beautiful and informative. Bonus points for framing them.
challenges.title: Display Pressed Plants

challenges.description: Some plants contain chemicals that can be used just like man-made medicine. Identify the name of a plant you've found in the wild and explain its medicinal use either in a video or in the comments of your project.
challenges.title: Identify Medicinal Plants

challenges.description: Collect at least 20 small seeds (apple, tomatoes, carrots) or 5 large seeds (avocado, coconut), and snap a clear photo of them. Store bought seeds don't count — these must be collected by you!
challenges.title: Collect Seeds

challenges.description: Grafting lets you combine the best traits of two plants. Show how grafting is done by making a How-To video.
challenges.title: Graft a Plant

challenges.description: A great way to share your plant prowess is to make a plant ID book. You can draw the illustrations yourself or use pressed plants. Label everything!
challenges.title: Create a Local Plant Guide

challenges.description: Greenhouses keep heat and moisture trapped so your plants can grow stronger and faster. You can make one from scrap wood and plastic wrap.
challenges.title: Build a Greenhouse

challenges.description: Capture a dramatic photo or video of yourself as you travel a wilderness trail.
challenges.title: Travel a Trail

challenges.description: Protect the wilderness by making a low impact campfire. A ground cloth or tarp piled with earth will protect the topsoil and completely remove traces that you were ever there.
challenges.title: Make a Low Impact Campfire

challenges.description: Set up a shelter in the wild using a rope and tarp, or logs and sticks. Take a picture or video of yourself inside it.
challenges.title: Set up a Shelter in the Wild

challenges.description: Open up your hiking pack and describe the things you've packed to go on a camping expedition. Upload a video of your packed bag.
challenges.title: Pack a Backpack

challenges.description: Learn a survival skill to help you survive in the wilderness, then demonstrate it through photo or video. It may save your neck one day!
challenges.title: Practice Survival Skills

challenges.description: Make your own backpack, survival kit, or stove. Tailor your camping experience to your own needs!
challenges.title: Make Your Own Gear

challenges.description: S'mores are the perfect camping treat: a campfire-roasted marshmallow sandwiched with a piece of chocolate between two graham crackers. Customize by adding peanut butter, dark chocolate, or anything else you can think of. Share a shot of your perfect s'more!
challenges.title: Make S'mores

challenges.description: Protect native plants and animals by clearing out invasive species, or gather the trash left by others. Leave the wild better off than when you arrived.
challenges.title: Protect the Wild

challenges.description: There are many techniques and natural materials you can use to make dirty water drinkable. Build a filter, use special chemicals, or try boiling to purify and cleanse water. Share a shot of your water before and after purifying, and explain the technique you used.
challenges.title: Purify Water

challenges.description: Learn and share the methods of backcountry cooking. Making meals full of proteins, fats and calories will keep you fueled for the hike.
challenges.title: Cook on a Campfire

challenges.description: Build your own costume from cardboard.
challenges.title: Make a Cardboard Costume

challenges.description: Use cardboard to invent your own toy, or a new version of your favorite design.
challenges.title: Make a Cardboard Toy

challenges.description: Build an animal, a dragon, or a space alien – anything! Or why not try adding a face or arms to some object that might not already have them.
challenges.title: Build a Creature with Cardboard

challenges.description: Print out a few paper templates, glue them to your cardboard, and cut them out. A contraption should move, so take a video of it in action.
challenges.title: Build a Cardboard Contraption

challenges.description: Make a prop for a game, make believe, or just fooling around, then take a picture or movie of it in action.
challenges.title: Make a Prop from Cardboard

challenges.description: You can make just about any game using cardboard. Create a marble run, or get creative and make something totally new. Capture it with a video or pictures clearly showing the game.
challenges.title: Make a Cardboard Game

challenges.description: Build a cardboard shelf, a toolbox, anything that helps you get organized. Show a before and after picture once your stuff finds a new home.
challenges.title: Organize Using Cardboard

challenges.description: Flutes, Guitars and Xylophones are just some of the instruments you can make with cardboard. Build an instrument, then take a video of it in action.
challenges.title: Make a Cardboard Instrument

challenges.description: Cardboard tubes are versatile. You can make art, or you can make something that's strong and sturdy. Take a picture when you're done.
challenges.title: Make with Cardboard Tubes

challenges.description: Use cardboard as a sculpture medium for your designs and dreams. White and yellow glue hold best. Take a picture of your masterpiece.
challenges.title: Make Cardboard Art

challenges.description: Cardboard furniture isn't just for prototypes. By folding and gluing, you can create a super-strong piece of furniture. Once you're done, snap a photo.
challenges.title: Make Cardboard Furniture

challenges.description: Cardboard vehicles are more about novelty than reliability, but they're still pretty fun. Try making something that can really move!
challenges.title: Build a Cardboard Vehicle

challenges.description: Make an entire building, or create a cardboard room. Use lots of layer for a solid structure. Take us on a video tour once you're finished.
challenges.title: Make a Cardboard Building

challenges.description: Some enjoy the plain look of cardboard, but finishing it with paint or varnish can help your projects last longer! Share your finished piece with a photo.
challenges.title: Paint and Finish Cardboard

challenges.description: Join the Imagination Foundation's yearly Global Cardboard Challenge, or create your own Cardboard Challenge. Capture everything with video.
challenges.title: Host a Cardboard Challenge

challenges.description: Find all the places you've been or all the places you want to go. Pin them on a paper map, or use a digital one, and post a picture.
challenges.title: Make a Travel Map

challenges.description: Some people love a good park, others their house. Create a map of the place where you like to hang out the most.
challenges.title: Map Your Favorite Spot

challenges.description: Hide a treasure somewhere and make a map, or geolocate it, so people can find it again. Be sure to leave plenty of hints, marks, and clues.
challenges.title: Make a Treasure Map

challenges.description: Find your way through unfamiliar territory using map and compass.
challenges.title: Voyage with a Map and Compass

challenges.description: Pick a fictional city like Harry Potter's Hogwarts, map it, then share it with a photo or video.
challenges.title: Map your Favorite Fictional World

challenges.description: A surveyor's job is to find the topography of the land. Build a surveying tool and show how it's used with a video.
challenges.title: Build Surveying Equipment

challenges.description: A topographic map displays changes in elevation. You can make one out of nearly anything. Share yours with a clear picture or video.
challenges.title: Make a Topographic Map

challenges.description: Collect your own data, such as where people in your house travel, or where your bus goes, and map it. Share it with a picture or screenshot.
challenges.title: Make a Data Visualization Map

challenges.description: There are many ways to edit or contribute to digital maps. Show the map before and after your edit with a screenshot.
challenges.title: Edit a Digital Map

challenges.description: Some digital maps let you explore the Earth's terrain in 3D. Make a video flying tour in Google Earth to share a part of the Earth of your choice.
challenges.title: Create a Virtual Flying Tour

challenges.description: Cartoonists create drawings called "model sheets" to help them plan and keep track of characters. Invent an original character, then sketch out their full body, some facial expressions, and any other cool stuff you can think of to bring your subject to life.
challenges.title: Draw A Character Model Sheet

challenges.description: A single-panel cartoon (AKA a "gag cartoon") uses one panel to tell a joke or story. They usually show a single funny scene with brief dialogue or a caption underneath. It can be very simple but still imply a lot.
challenges.title: Draw a Single Panel Cartoon

challenges.description: Sometimes the best way to get inspired to make awesome stuff is to look at other people's work. Your favorite cartoons have a big influence on what you draw! In a video, share a cartoonist that inspires you, and explain what you like about their work.
challenges.title: Share Your Favorite Cartoonist

challenges.description: A comic book convention (or a "comic con") is a big event where fans gather to celebrate their favorite comic books and characters. Share a picture or video of the cool stuff you see and the awesome merch you get. (Bonus points if you cosplay!)
challenges.title: Go To a Comic Convention

challenges.description: Comics don't have to just be all fantasy—sometimes the most interesting stories are told from real life. Draw a cartoon or comic that tells a story about something that really happened to you.
challenges.title: Cartoonify Your Life

challenges.description: A "caricature" is a type of cartoon drawing that exaggerates a person's facial features. Draw a caricature of yourself, a friend, or a famous person. Post your drawing and a photo of the person you drew. (Don't post any caricatures you didn't draw yourself!)
challenges.title: Draw a Caricature

challenges.description: A political cartoon (or "editorial cartoon") is an illustration that talks about or makes fun of pop culture and current events. Cartoonists use political cartoons to share their opinions, point out problems, or show things they think need to be fixed.
challenges.title: Draw a Political Cartoon

challenges.description: You know what they say: A picture is worth 1000 words! A comic that doesn't have a caption or any speech bubbles is called a "pantomime cartoon," and they have to use just illustrations to tell a story. Write a comic strip that tells a joke without any words.
challenges.title: Tell a Story Without Words

challenges.description: Normal comic strips have 3 or 4 panels, but some cartoonists break that format to add motion, scale, or new context to their work. Pick an idea for a new comic, and sketch out at least 2 different layouts you could use to tell your story.
challenges.title: Experiment With Comic Layouts

challenges.description: A tracing table (or "light box") is a flat box with lights inside that makes it easy to trace over messy planning sketches. Traditional cartoonists use light tables to ink their final illustrations. Build a homemade light box and share some pics of how you made it.
challenges.title: Build a Tracing Table

challenges.description: Webcomics are comics published on a website that are often about the same topics or set of characters. Start a website to host your very own webcomic series. Post a link to your website and at least 2 of your finished comics.
challenges.title: Start a Webcomic

challenges.description: Traditional cartoonists start with a pencil sketch, then use a light table or tracing paper to ink a final outline, and finish by adding color with markers, inks, or paint. Draw a cartoon—share pics or video of your sketch, inked outline, and final colored piece.
challenges.title: Sketch, Ink, Color

challenges.description: A comic book is a long series of cartoons that tells a story or shows time passing. Comic books are often "serialized," meaning the same story lasts for multiple books. Create a comic book at least 5 pages long—share the entire thing with pictures or a video.
challenges.title: Write a Comic Book

challenges.description: It takes lots of practice and patience to see your cartoons in print, but it's totally worth it! Share a picture of your work printed in a newspaper, magazine, or art journal. (Make sure to cover your full name if it's printed next to your cartoon!)
challenges.title: Publish a Comic

challenges.description: Make an omelette filled with all of your favorite ingredients, and share your tasty egg creation with a picture or video.
challenges.title: Fold Eggs into an Omelette

challenges.description: Grab a blender and throw in fruits, ice cream, veggies and anything else you can think of and make a tasty smoothie. Share with a picture.
challenges.title: Make a Smoothie with a Food Processor

challenges.description: Carefully cut an entire fruit or vegetable into super thin slices – take a picture of them next to a ruler to prove their thinness.
challenges.title: Cut 1/4 Inch (6mm) Thin Slices

challenges.description: Cookies, cakes, pies and puddings — just a few reasons why we save room for dessert. Take pictures of the process and finished treat.
challenges.title: Make a Dessert

challenges.description: The road to becoming a great chef is paved with burnt burgers, broken eggs, and sunken soufflés.  Document a cooking experiment that didn't work out—show what went wrong and share what you learned for next time!
challenges.title: Share a Cooking Fail

challenges.description: There are lots of techniques for cutting food, but chopping, dicing, and mincing are important basics that every chef should master. Grab an ingredient for practice, and share a picture that shows your food chopped, diced, and minced.
challenges.title: Chop, Dice, and Mince

challenges.description: Vegetables look pretty and taste great. Even broccoli. Make a vegetable dish using local produce and take a picture before you scarf it.
challenges.title: Make a Vegetable Dish

challenges.description: The best place to source meat is from a farm where you know the animals were treated right. Pick your favorite meat, cook it, and snap a photo.
challenges.title: Cook a Meat Dish

challenges.description: Make an extra awesome pizza.
challenges.title: Make a Pizza

challenges.description: A condiment is a sauce that adds flavor and texture to a meal. Take a picture of your ingredients, and then the finished condiment.
challenges.title: Make a Condiment

challenges.description: Make a patty from meat, potatoes, noodles, even veggies. Take pictures of your patty before and after it's cooked.
challenges.title: Make a Patty

challenges.description: A vegan dish contains no animal products—instead of meat and dairy, vegan chefs create magic using tofu, soymilk, and other tasty alternatives. Share a photo of your vegan dish and explain what you used to make it in the comments.
challenges.title: Make a Vegan Dish

challenges.description: Store bought noodles don't count; you must make them from scratch. Show a picture of your pasta dough as well as the finished noodle.
challenges.title: Make Noodles from Scratch

challenges.description: Creating a meal with multiple dishes (or "courses") is the true test of a chef's ability to cook and multi-task. Make a meal with at least 3 different courses (like an appetizer, main course, and dessert) and share pictures of all of your finished dishes.
challenges.title: Cook a Full-Course Meal

challenges.description: Crazy things happen when you mix cornstarch with water. Make oobleck and take a photo or video as you experiment with it.
challenges.title: Make Oobleck

challenges.description: Some chemicals go nuts when you mix them. Mix together two chemicals (like vinegar and baking soda) and let the explosions begin. Video is a must.
challenges.title: Create a Foam Explosion

challenges.description: Show your chemical message before and after it's activated. Video is the best way to do it.
challenges.title: Write a Chemical Message

challenges.description: Chemical indicators change color when they come into contact with certain substances. Make your own and film or photograph the results.
challenges.title: Make a Chemical Indicator

challenges.description: See how soap breaks surface tension, collects oils, even expands in a microwave! Share your results with a picture or video.
challenges.title: Experiment With Soap

challenges.description: Use chemical processes to create cleaners, chalk, paint, and other useful products. Include an explanation of what you made and how you made it either with a video or in the comments of your project.
challenges.title: Chemically Manufacture a Product

challenges.description: Build your own battery and take a video as it powers an LED.
challenges.title: Light an LED with a Homemade Battery

challenges.description: While they make look similar, liquids have different densities and don't always mix.  Layer different liquids on top of one another and film it.
challenges.title: Experiment with Density

challenges.description: Molecules are groupings of two or more atoms through chemical bonds. Make a scale model of a molecule and tell everyone what it is in a video.
challenges.title: Build a Molecular Model

challenges.description: Ever wonder what color dyes are used to make a marker look black or why leaves change color? Chromatography is a technique used to separate and analyze mixtures of things like color pigment. Try it out and share the results with a picture or timelapse video.
challenges.title: Try Chromatography

challenges.description: Design a system to collect, label, and store your chemicals in a safe and logical way. Snap a clear picture of your chemicals and legible labels.
challenges.title: Collect and Label Chemicals

challenges.description: Chemical reactions often require precise tools, temperatures and timing. This is why a lab is a must. Take us through a your of yours with a video.
challenges.title: Set Up a Chemistry Lab

challenges.description: Sodium acetate is a solution that can be supercooled, meaning it will instantly turn from a liquid to a solid. Take a video as your cools in a super way.
challenges.title: Make Hot Ice (Sodium Acetate Trihydrate)

challenges.description: Meditation is being mindful. Some practice breathing in quiet places and others meditate in their day to day. Make a video describing how you meditate.
challenges.title: Describe Meditation Techniques

challenges.description: Amazing things are happening all around us! Keep your eyes peeled for something that you find incredible and share it with a video or cool picture! A video with narration is highly recommended.
challenges.title: Observe the Life Around You

challenges.description: Many teas have calming effects that soothe your nerves. The ritual of heating water and pouring it over leaves is also incredibly chill.
challenges.title: Take Time for Tea

challenges.description: Yoga, Chi Gong, Tai Chi, and many forms of dance are all incredibly effective techniques for increasing your sense of well-being. In a video, show us how you practice body movement.
challenges.title: Practice Body Movement

challenges.description: Movies from the 80's were – and are – super chill. Watch a movie from one of the chillest decades in cinema, then post your thoughts on the movie with a video.
challenges.title: Review an 80's Movie

challenges.description: It's amazing how just walking through a natural setting can relax you. Shoot some video  or take some pics as you hike your favorite trail.
challenges.title: Go Hiking in Nature

challenges.description: Ping Pong is a great way to get the blood pumping and creative juices flowing when taking a break from making. Play a game or twenty with some friends and see who can volley the longest! Post a video of your chill spin shots!
challenges.title: Play Ping Pong

challenges.description: Reading a good book is about as relaxing as it gets.  Make a video and explain what book you've read and why it's so great.
challenges.title: Review a Book

challenges.description: Hammocks are great napping devices. You can whip one up with a large sheet and rope, or make a really stellar one with ripstop nylon. Make a quick video explaining how you made your hammock and show how it supports your body as you chillax in it.
challenges.title: Make a Hammock

challenges.description: The most delicious way to find blissful pleasure is by eating great food. Take the time to focus on your sensations of taste as you eat healthy, fresh, and flavorful food. Show us all the great food you enjoy and share the experience of eating WITH A VIDEO.
challenges.title: Really Enjoy Food

challenges.description: Invent a battery powered circuit that creates art or washes the dishes. Snap a video of your invention.
challenges.title: Invent a Battery Powered Circuit

challenges.description: Hack your way to weirdness by modifying a battery-powered toy. Film it, with sound.
challenges.title: Circuit Bend a Battery-Powered Toy

challenges.description: 555 timers are a simple and cheap way to mod sounds or flash lights. Take a video explaining what you made.
challenges.title: Build a 555 Timer Circuit

challenges.description: A contact mic senses audio vibrations through solid objects. Build your own and take a video of every sound you can capture with it.
challenges.title: Make a Contact Mic

challenges.description: Soldering is a great skill for anyone interested in electronics. Take a close up, in focus picture of your soldering job. Better yet, make a how-to.
challenges.title: Solder

challenges.description: Forrest M. Mims III created the Atari Punk Console (APC). Build your own take your first step towards becoming an audio electronics wiz.
challenges.title: Build an Atari Punk Console

challenges.description: Amplifiers come in all shapes and sizes, from amps that are used in concert venues to tiny amplifier circuits that are used in iPods. In this challenge you'll build a super high quality pocket amplifier (called a CMOY) using some basic parts and soldering skills.
challenges.title: Construct a Pocket Amplifier

challenges.description: Take something you already have and mod it by adding pockets or changing the way it fits. Before and after pictures, please.
challenges.title: Mod Your Clothing

challenges.description: Sew a hat that resembles a character you're into.
challenges.title: Sew a Character Hat

challenges.description: Tweak your outfit or fix a hole by adding a sweet looking patch.
challenges.title: Sew on Patches

challenges.description: Gather everything you need for sewing and get it organized. Snap a photo of your sewing space.
challenges.title: Set up a Sewing Space

challenges.description: Add a zipper to an existing outfit, or practice on scrap fabric. Take pictures along the way to show each step.
challenges.title: Sew in a Zipper

challenges.description: Buttons, snaps and hooks are all great examples of fasteners that fasten. Add one to an outfit and take pictures to show a before and after.
challenges.title: Attach Fasteners

challenges.description: Pockets give you a place to put your hands, hold your keys or phone, and look good to boot. Take pics as you sew your pocket.
challenges.title: Stitch a Pocket

challenges.description: Measuring someone for an outfit is a simple but super important step when making clothes. Record a video as you measure someone for an outfit.
challenges.title: Fit Someone for an Outfit

challenges.description: Pleats, darts, tucks and ruffles are simple ways to add spunk or make an outfit fit better. Sew one type or sew all four! Take video or pictures.
challenges.title: Stitch Pleats, Darts, Tucks and Ruffles

challenges.description: Find a pattern that looks great, take measurements to find your size, and then cut and sew it! Take a ton of pics to share every detail of the process.
challenges.title: Sew from a Pattern

challenges.description: Sleeves can be a bit tricky, so it's best to dedicate some time to learning how they're made. Upload a video or photos of your attempt at a sleeve.
challenges.title: Construct a Sleeve

challenges.description: Hats add style to your head. Find a pattern or create your own and then sew a hat. Takes pictures as you go and one of the finished hat.
challenges.title: Sew a Hat

challenges.description: By making your own pattern or modding a pre-made one, you can sew clothes with a personal touch. Upload a pic of your custom pattern.
challenges.title: Draft or Mod a Pattern

challenges.description: Once you've got a few stitches under your belt, it’s time to make a garment. Show all of your steps with pictures or video.
challenges.title: Sew a Garment

challenges.description: Design a finished logo that you can use anywhere to represent your DIY Club. Creating a logo that lets the world know what your club is all about.
challenges.title: Design Your Club's Logo

challenges.description: Get to know the members of your Club. If there are members who are new to DIY help them get started by creating an account. Take a behind the scenes video of your first meeting or include pictures that clearly show the DIY club in action!
challenges.title: Capture the First Meeting

challenges.description: Send an email, make a phone call, write a letter, make a flyer to pin up, or tell them about it in person. Capture how you invited your friends to DIY with pictures or a video. DIY is even better if all your friends are on the site, too.
challenges.title: Recruit Club Members

challenges.description: Club meetings are always better with food. Take turns with the other Club Members cooking for your club. Post photos or videos of your spread at the next meeting.
challenges.title: Cook for Your Club

challenges.description: Create a place where your club can post photos of group projects, schedule future meetings, and let others know what your club is all about. Post a link.
challenges.title: Make a Website

challenges.description: A DIY Club meets regularly to get Skills. Find the right place to meet that will help you get the Skills your club is after. Make a video tour once you've found the right spot!
challenges.title: Video Tour Your Club Space

challenges.description: The best part of DIY Clubs are the friends you have to join adventures. Go visit a creative place to see how other makers make, or take a trip out into the wild. Document what you experience.
challenges.title: Go On an Adventure

challenges.description: Make a durable fabric flag that you can take wherever your DIY Club goes.
challenges.title: Make a Fabric Flag

challenges.description: Don't be shy, track down a expert of the skill you want to learn. Make a video of the interview so the knowledge can be spread across DIY! And if you earn their trust and respect, they might even let you use their shop, borrow tools, and mentor you.
challenges.title: Interview an Expert

challenges.description: Everyone has a special skill. Share your favorite project with your fellow makers, and see what they have to share with you. Record your lesson.
challenges.title: Teach a Project

challenges.description: Now that you’ve got a DIY Club you can collaborate with one another to tackle projects you couldn’t do alone. Combine your Skills to make something great.
challenges.title: Do an Epic Project

challenges.description: So, you've built an amazing project, learned a few things, maybe broke a few rules – now's the time to share it. Beyond your house and the internet are Maker Faires, Science Fairs, and more. Go outside and show your work to others in a public way.
challenges.title: Have a Show

challenges.description: Take a snapshot of your coded message on its own as well as wrapped around your scytale.
challenges.title: Share Secret Messages with a Scytale

challenges.description: Cipher devices help you create coded messages that you can share with friends. Code a message and take video explaining how your cipher works.
challenges.title: Create a Cipher Device

challenges.description: A transposition cipher is an encryption method that shifts letters. Take pictures of your encrypted message and have friends decrypt it.
challenges.title: Make a Transposition Cipher

challenges.description: Create your own substitution cipher or learn how to use the Vigenere . Upload your encrypted message as well as the solution.
challenges.title: Encrypt with a Substitution Cipher

challenges.description: A keyword cipher uses transposition plus a secret keyword. Create, encode and decode a secret message! Take pictures, or better yet, video.
challenges.title: Create a Keyword  Cipher

challenges.description: A playfair cipher uses a 5x5 grid and keyword. Decode the DIY Playfair cipher and take a snapshot of your work.
challenges.title: Decode a Playfair Cipher

challenges.title: Decode a Message in Base64

challenges.description: Learn about the different ways to encrypt and choose a method to send an encrypted message. Upload your encryption to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Send an Encrypted Message

challenges.description: Generate a public key that's safe to share using OpenSSL (Secure Socket Layer). Upload a screencast and explain how you did it.
