challenges.title: Encrypt Using OpenSSL

challenges.description: Everyone is secretly an amazing dancer. The best dancing happens when you don't care what people will think.
challenges.title: Improvise a Dance

challenges.description: Find the beat in your favorite song, then count 1 to 8, and repeat. Upload a video of yourself clapping along.
challenges.title: Count Sets of 8

challenges.description: Choose a song you love to dance to. Shoot a choreographed dance to it, then edit it all together into a full-length music video.
challenges.title: Make a Dance Music Video

challenges.description: Memorize a dance routine, then perform it and upload a video.
challenges.title: Memorize a Routine

challenges.description: Most classical dance moves begin and end with one of five basic positions. Upload a video to show off all five.
challenges.title: Perform 5 Basic Ballet Positions

challenges.description: Try experimenting with lots of different ideas and styles as your create your own dance. Make big and small shapes with your body, zig-zap, curve, and spiral through space, communicate different emotions, move with lighting speed or go in slow motion.
challenges.title: Choreograph a Dance

challenges.description: Notation is to dance what notes are to music. Scribbles, symbols, and drawings allow choreographers to capture and preserve their dances.
challenges.title: Write Dance Notation

challenges.description: Many dances of the past are the best example of the people who came before. Learn a traditional dance and record it on video.
challenges.title: Perform a Traditional Dance

challenges.description: Dance is more fun when done together. Form a crew, and try new styles and steps,  improve your skills, and expand your repertoire. Share a video of your group doing a dance together to complete this challenge.
challenges.title: Form a Dance Group

challenges.description: Make your own costumes and props, build a stage, draw up a playbill, and invite friends and family to watch. Record your performance.
challenges.title: Stage a Performance

challenges.description: Flash mobs seem to appear out of nowhere, bringing audiences joy through spontaneity and surprise. Make sure it's filmed and upload a video.
challenges.title: Stage a Flash Mob

challenges.description: Make a costume by hand using materials that you already have. Cardboard and scrap fabric are great things to use.
challenges.title: Make A Costume

challenges.description: Props can add realism to the halloween character you've created. Use materials you have at hand and make a prop for your costume.
challenges.title: Make a Costume Prop

challenges.description: Grab the attention of others with a surprising new identity and make a mask to make your costume epic.
challenges.title: Make a Mask

challenges.description: Turn an ordinary pumpkin into a head turning masterpiece by getting creative and carving something far beyond a normal Jack O' Lantern.
challenges.title: Decorate a Pumpkin

challenges.description: Food can make a great building material.  Bring out what's magical, scary, or gross about food, and share it with a picture or video.
challenges.title: Make a Halloween Treat

challenges.description: The experience of making a horror movie can be chilling one. Create a scene that makes your skin crawl and capture it with a video.
challenges.title: Make a Scary Movie

challenges.description: Get out a flashlight, turn off your lights, and record a video while you tell the scariest story you can think of. It can be true or totally made up, but it has to be spooky!
challenges.title: Tell a Scary Story

challenges.description: Even a little decoration can make a normal house into a scary one. Hang cobwebs, make glowing potions, or fill a bowl with fake slimy eyeballs to show off your spooky spirit.
challenges.title: Make Spooky Decorations

challenges.description: Make your costume glow by adding at least 5 LEDs.
challenges.title: Light Up Your Costume

challenges.description: Incorporate an epic illusion into your costume that will confuse and amuse others. Share your entire costume with a photo or video.
challenges.title: Make an Illusion Costume

challenges.description: Throw a party or transform your house into a frightening theme park. Create scary and fun surprises around every corner.
challenges.title: Create a Haunted House

challenges.description: Use a bar graph, pie chart or line graph and show the compelling story in your data. You can plot your data by hand, or use a spreadsheet.
challenges.title: Make a Data Graph

challenges.description: Gather data on paper, a spreadsheet, or a survey form. You can record jellybean flavors or family member heights – anything that you can count.
challenges.title: Collect Data

challenges.description: Draw a data map by hand or create a digital map using Mapbox, Google Maps or other tools. Upload a photo of your finished map full of data.
challenges.title: Map Data

challenges.description: An infographic is a series of charts and illustrations create a story out of complex data. Use a computer or draw by hand to create an infographic.
challenges.title: Design an Infographic

challenges.description: A timeline is a way to visualize data about events that occur over time. Create a timeline about your life or another subject and upload an image of it.
challenges.title: Create a Timeline

challenges.description: There's a ton of data out there that's already been collected. It's your job to find it! Take a screenshot of a dataset you want to turn visual.
challenges.title: Find Datasets

challenges.description: You can record how much you walked, where you went or how many apples you eat a week. Display the information in a stylish way.
challenges.title: Quantify Yourself

challenges.description: Use D3 (Data Driven Documents) to create a web visualization, then upload a screenshot and link.
challenges.title: Code an Interactive Visualization

challenges.description: Lift fingerprints off of a surface, then use a stamp pad and a piece of paper to collect prints from your suspect.
challenges.title: Dust for Fingerprints

challenges.description: Take an object and demonstrate if it is a forgery or the real thing. Use video or the comments section to explain how you know.
challenges.title: Spot a Forgery

challenges.description: Show photographs of your evidence and explain in a video how it could help you solve the case.
challenges.title: Collect and Analyze Evidence

challenges.description: Photograph your stakeout location and take video of what you saw.
challenges.title: Stake Out a Location

challenges.description: Build a surveillance system and take a picture or video of what you can see with it.
challenges.title: Create a Distance Surveillance System

challenges.description: Keep all five senses on alert for evidence and document yourself as you investigate--collect, record, or photograph what you find.
challenges.title: Analyze the Scene

challenges.description: If no one around you has witnessed a crime recently, practice your technique by asking detailed questions about any experience.  Video the interview.
challenges.title: Interview a Witness

challenges.description: Practice your tailing technique by giving a friend a head start, then trying to keep up with them without being detected. Take a video of the chase.
challenges.title: Tail a Suspect

challenges.description: Design the DIY logo with your own twist.  Upload a photo or screenshot of your creation.
challenges.title: Redesign the DIY Logo

challenges.description: Is there a skill missing on DIY? Invent it! Create a design for the patch and share a list of at least 3 challenge ideas in the comments of your project.
challenges.title: Invent a Skill

challenges.description: Create a how-to video for any challenge. Edit your video and upload it with the hashtag #howto.
challenges.title: Create a How-To for a DIY Challenge

challenges.description: Makers that want to leave their patches unstitched have to find creative alternatives for showing off their skills. Design a unique way to display your DIY patches. Share some process pics if you've got 'em!
challenges.title: Design a Patch Holder

challenges.description: Redesign an existing skill patch and recreate it with your own twist. You can illustrate, build, or create a digital design - get creative!
challenges.title: Redesign a Skill Patch

challenges.description: Pick your favorite skill patch and make a 3D sculpture of it!  Use clay, cardboard, paper, 3D modeling software like Sketchup, or anything else you want to build your model.
challenges.title: Make a Skill Patch Sculpture

challenges.description: Build a real-life version of your digital DIY avatar. Drawings don't count. Masks definitely do.
challenges.title: Build Your DIY Avatar

challenges.description: A salute is a gesture that can be used to greet, congratulate, or show respect, especially between members of a club or group. Invent a new wave, hand sign, or secret handshake specifically for DIYers, and explain how to do it in a video or drawing.
challenges.title: Invent a DIY Salute

challenges.description: Design a DIY poster using photoshop, GIMP, or any other graphics editor. Upload a screenshot of your digital creation.
challenges.title: Design a DIY Poster

challenges.description: Mitchell and the DIY Yeti need a new friend. Create what you'd like to  be the next mascot. Bonus points if you include a slogan!
challenges.title: Create a New DIY Mascot

challenges.description: Compose an original piece of music related to DIY. It'll be our summer anthem!
challenges.title: Compose a DIY Jingle

challenges.description: Write a piece for the DIY blog. Keep it to 800 characters or less.
challenges.title: Write a Piece for the DIY Blog

challenges.description: Design a feature that you'd like to see in the DIY App.
challenges.title: Plan a New Feature for the DIY App

challenges.description: Make a physical object that you think people will pay money for. Take a quality picture of it, and share how you plan on selling it, either with a video or by writing in the comments.
challenges.title: Make a Product for the DIY Market

challenges.description: Make a compelling pitch for why a friend should join. Describe DIY to someone who hasn't heard about it before.
challenges.title: Make a DIY Pitch

challenges.description: It can be anything, as long as it shows off your development skills. Post a link of what you made in the comments. Bonus points for open sourcing it on GitHub!
challenges.title: Make Something with the DIY API

challenges.description: Safely capture an insect, then figure out what it is, snap a photo of it and write it in the title.
challenges.title: Identify an Insect

challenges.description: Find a queen ant and build an ant farm. Take a video showing their tunnels.
challenges.title: Construct an Ant Farm

challenges.description: Learn to see like an insect by building your own compound eye.
challenges.title: Build a Compound Eye

challenges.description: Create an insect habitat by drilling holes in a log, or building an insect house.
challenges.title: Create an Insect Habitat

challenges.description: Build a water viewer to see what insects might be living in the murky waters. Make sure to include a photo or video that shows what the water looks like through your viewer.
challenges.title: Build a Water Viewer

challenges.description: Construct a butterfly net using common household parts and put it to use.
challenges.title: Assemble a Butterfly Net

challenges.description: Create a bug catcher, catch some bugs, snap a video, and then set the bugs free!
challenges.title: Make a Bug Catcher

challenges.description: Berlese funnels are used to collect insects that live in top soil and ground debris. Snap a picture of yours.
challenges.title: Make a Berlese Funnel

challenges.description: Build a light trap and shoot a video of it in action.
challenges.title: Make a Light Trap

challenges.description: Pick anything you love, praise it for what it does well and suggest new ways to make it better. Make a video of the review.
challenges.title: Review a Product or Service

challenges.description: Make a physical object that you think people will pay money for. Take a quality picture of it, and share how you plan on selling it, either with a video or by writing in the comments.
challenges.title: Make Something to Sell

challenges.description: A logo is a simple graphic to identify your business. Study the logos of your favorite companies and then make your own. Upload a photo.
challenges.title: Make a Logo For Your Business

challenges.description: To practice marketing, pick something you don't need anymore and find someone who wants it. Show how you sold the item.
challenges.title: Find Something Used to Sell

challenges.description: You don't always have to make, sometimes you can just do. Perform a valuable service for your family or neighbor and ask for fair pay.
challenges.title: Offer a Service for Sale

challenges.description: Now a real challenge! Invent something to solve a problem for you or someone in your family.
challenges.title: Solve a Problem with an Invention

challenges.description: As your business grows it's important to keep track of the money you earn and the costs to run it. Keep a ledger for at least a month.
challenges.title: Record Your Profits and Losses

challenges.description: The best entrepreneurs are good listeners. Figure out a way to get feedback from your customers to improve your business, and share the results.
challenges.title: Get Customer Feedback

challenges.description: Websites are a cost effective way to market your business. Make one for a product you invented or service you provide. Share screenshots and a link.
challenges.title: Make a Website For Your Business

challenges.description: A joy of entrepreneurship is creating a job that someone loves. When your business can afford it, hire someone to help. Show how they contribute.
challenges.title: Create a Job

challenges.description: When you start making a profit, do something smart with the money. Invest in your own business or  try investing in someone else's business.
challenges.title: Invest Your Profits

challenges.description: Social entrepreneurs prioritize their positive impact on society. Create and manage a venture to achieve a desired social change.
challenges.title: Try Social Entrepreneurship

challenges.description: Conductive thread is the wire of fabric hacking. It connects your parts together and allows electricity to flow through your circuit, making it the perfect solution for putting electronics on your clothing. It's even washable!
challenges.title: Sew with Conductive Thread

challenges.description: If you're comfortable with sewing conductive thread, it's time to try sewing with (and lighting up) an LED, or light-emitting diode (just think of it as a small light). Shiny!
challenges.title: Sew a Single-LED Circuit

challenges.description: Add some bling to your accessories by making a bracelet that incorporates electronic textiles.
challenges.title: Make a Fabric Hacker Bracelet

challenges.description: Felt is a fun material to work with, and is available at pretty much any craft store. Let's see what you can do to make your own sewable circuit using felt!
challenges.title: Construct a Piece of Felt Electronics

challenges.description: Not every switch looks like the ones in your house you use to turn on the lights. Experiment with making a switch from conductive fabric - there are all sort of variations that you can use in your project.
challenges.title: Make a Switch with Conductive Fabric

challenges.description: Bored with your t-shirt collection? Make your shirt stand out by sewing a circuit into it  - trace along a pattern, sew on a sweet patch, or use a sensor that changes the color of LEDs as you swing your arms.
challenges.title: Hack A T-Shirt

challenges.description: Electro-Luminescent (EL) wire is a great way to get solid yet flexible strips of light onto your wearable project. Learn how to use it and incorporate some into your next project.
challenges.title: Construct A Wearable Using EL Wire

challenges.description: You can use conductive thread, conductive fabric, and simple microcontrollers to actually sense things out in the world like the bend of an object, how much pressure is on something, or even the distance between your object and another.
challenges.title: Build A Wearable Sensor

challenges.description: A glove is a great place to think about adding electronics - we use our hands for all sorts of motions and gestures that make hacking a glove a definitely project for any serious Fabric Hacker.
challenges.title: Hack A Glove

challenges.description: Make the best fairy wings ever by sprucing them up with some LEDs, EL wire, or fiber optics!
challenges.title: Make Wearable Fairy Wings

challenges.description: Time to get serious. Make a large garment that covers at least half your body, can sense something about your body, AND react to it.
challenges.title: Make a Half or Full Body Sensor Suit

challenges.description: Draw a figure wearing clothing you dream up. Drawing is a first step in creating a new look.
challenges.title: Draw a Fashion Illustration

challenges.description: Make a necklace, pin, bracelet or ring to help you complete an outfit. Jewelry is a great way to explore and express your personal style.
challenges.title: Make Jewelry

challenges.description: Mod your own or someone else's hair with pins, braids, color, or a new cut. Find a look that's new and surprising.
challenges.title: Mod Your Hairstyle

challenges.description: Gather at least three samples of fashion inspiration from magazines or the internet. Explain why they inspire you with a video.
challenges.title: Gather Inspiration

challenges.description: Try different combinations of tops, bottoms, and accessories, then take a picture or video and share!
challenges.title: Assemble an Ensemble

challenges.description: Take an ordinary piece of clothing and paint, cut, patch, or stitch it into something completely new!
challenges.title: Make a Fashion Hack

challenges.description: Find a good location and shoot awesome pictures of a model wearing your fashion creation.
challenges.title: Stage a Fashion Photoshoot

challenges.description: Turn up the volume on your nails with some color and gloss!
challenges.title: Do Nails

challenges.description: Express yourself with a sweet bag you make yourself. Use duct tape, newspaper, or stitch real fabric.
challenges.title: Make a Bag or Pouch

challenges.description: Give your shoes a colorful mod podge makeover or build some new shoes from scratch.
challenges.title: Make or Mod Your Shoes

challenges.description: Get your clothes from a thrift store, Craigslist, or a clothing swap. When you wear used clothing, you not only save money, but you find fashions that may be ready for a comeback – rock your grandpa's clothes!
challenges.title: Rock Used Clothes

challenges.description: Before investing the time and energy into making a full-sized outfit, make a scale model, or a mini mock-up.
challenges.title: Make a Mini Mock-Up

challenges.description: Take your design skills to the next level by creating an entire collection of clothes that are all one style!
challenges.title: Make a Collection

challenges.description: Create a design with a material not normally used for clothing – it DOES have to be wearable.
challenges.title: Design Clothing From Unusual Materials

challenges.description: Make a pattern from an existing garment, or draft a new one from scratch. Clothing makers sew together cut-out pieces of fabric using these patterns as a guide.
challenges.title: Draft a Pattern

challenges.description: Sew an original garment from scratch – turn one of your out-there ideas into a maximum reality!
challenges.title: Create an Original Garment

challenges.description: Use sound, staging, and lights to film a fashion show or a music video that shows off your collection. Make it real by finding models, crew, and audience.
challenges.title: Make a Fashion Show or Film

challenges.description: Start with music you like and then shoot and edit your film around it. It can be a performance or a far out film experiment.
challenges.title: Make a Musical Video

challenges.description: Make a trailer for an imaginary film, or a fan trailer for a film you love.
challenges.title: Make a Movie Trailer

challenges.description: Combine multiple video clips to create an edited film. All films can be improved by a good editor with a sense of timing and style. Upload a screenshot of your edits and your final video.
challenges.title: Edit a Film

challenges.description: A storyboard is like a cartoon of a film. They are widely used to help plan a future film.
challenges.title: Make a Storyboard

challenges.description: Make your shots look better by building a custom tripod, lens, or other film gear.
challenges.title: Hack Your Film Gear

challenges.description: Create the sense of time speeding up with a time lapse app or editing program. (NOTE: THIS IS NOT STOP-MOTION)
challenges.title: Make a Time Lapse Movie

challenges.description: Write a screenplay and use Justpaste.it to share it.
challenges.title: Write a Screenplay

challenges.description: Tell jokes, be a fool, make 'em laugh! Sometimes the funniest stuff is played totally seriously.
challenges.title: Make a Comedy

challenges.description: Use planning and rehearsal to make a movie that's captured in one shot – at least one minute long.
challenges.title: Film a One-Take Movie

challenges.description: Shoot a Science Fiction or Fantasy film that bends reality.
challenges.title: Make a Sci-Fi Fantasy Film

challenges.description: Get a great performance from an actor. Ask yourself, "Does it feel real?"
challenges.title: Direct Actors

challenges.description: Use real people and events to tell a story – Truth is stranger than fiction!
challenges.title: Make a Documentary

challenges.description: Some plants have poison in their leaves or grow poisonous berries as a form of defense against predators. Take a photo or video of a poisonous plant you've found in the wild. Make sure to identify what it's called and what makes it poisonous!
challenges.title: Identify a Poisonous Plant

challenges.description: Collect edible wild greens. Some greens are great raw, and others need to be cooked before eating. Prep your greens for eating and snap a picture.
challenges.title: Forage for Wild Greens

challenges.description: Collect and identify edible wild mushrooms. Be very careful before eating anything you've found in the wild! Identify the type of edible mushroom you've found and post a picture or video of where you found it.
challenges.title: Hunt for Edible Mushrooms

challenges.description: Many kinds of edible berries grow in the wilderness: blackberries, raspberries, strawberries, even grapes. Some kinds are poisonous, though, so be careful what you eat! Find and collect some wild berries, and show off your bounty with a picture or video.
challenges.title: Collect Wild Berries

challenges.description: Find a tree with ripe fruit and pick some – be sure to ask if the tree belongs to someone else.
challenges.title: Forage from a Fruit Tree

challenges.description: Consult a guidebook and harvest nuts or seeds that grow in the wild.
challenges.title: Forage for Wild Nuts and Seeds

challenges.description: Find a farmer or gardener and harvest the leftover crops they don't want.
challenges.title: Glean for Food

challenges.description: Be smart and safe when dumpster diving. Oh, and if you score big, share the wealth.
challenges.title: Dumpster Dive for Free Food

challenges.description: Before we had Peroxide or Aspirin to cure our aches and pains, we used plants! Find a medicinal herb out in the wild, and in a video or the comments of your project, identify your plant and explain how it can be used as a medicine.
challenges.title: Identify a Medicinal Herb

challenges.description: Find a tree at a farm or nursery. Plant it somewhere and share some info about its species.
challenges.title: Plant a Tree

challenges.description: Walk around your neighborhood and snap photos of the trees you identify. Put their names in the project title.
challenges.title: Identify Local Trees

challenges.description: Take a soil sample and describe your soil type.
challenges.title: Take a Soil Sample

challenges.description: Figure out what kinds of trees, shrubs, and grasses are native to where you live and plant one. Explain how you chose what kind of tree to plant.
challenges.title: Plant a Native Species

challenges.description: Make an clinometer (also called Inclinometer) and calculate the height of the tallest tree in your neighborhood.
challenges.title: Measure the Height of a Tree

challenges.description: Learn about what can be used as fuel in your local forest, gather what you can find, and share a photo with details about your collection.
challenges.title: Harvest Fuel from the Forest

challenges.description: Try calculating a tree’s age by counting it's rings.
challenges.title: Calculate a Tree's Age

challenges.description: Draw a map of a park, marking the location, species and height of its trees.
challenges.title: Map a Park

challenges.description: Build a model to demonstrate how grass, roots, and tree litter help hold soil in place.
challenges.title: Model Erosion

challenges.description: Build a model to show how a landslide happens. Record a video of your experiment in action.
challenges.title: Design a Landslide

challenges.description: Find a small log and mill it into boards using hand tools. Upload a photo of the lumber you made.
challenges.title: Mill a Log

challenges.description: Foresters frequently cut down trees for lumber or safety. Very carefully (and with permission from whomever owns the land), record a video of you felling a tree.
challenges.title: Fell a Tree

challenges.description: Get together with a restoration group and plant a forest of native trees, shrubs, and grasses.
challenges.title: Plant a Forest

challenges.description: Get acquainted with the  insides of websites by remixing one of your favorites. Use X-Ray Goggles to hack a website and upload a screenshot of your remix to complete the challenge!
challenges.title: Remix a Website

challenges.description: HTML, or "markup", is what browsers read and turn into websites, so you'll need it for every website you make. Create a basic HTML site on www.jsfiddle.net and upload a screenshot and link.
challenges.title: Create a Basic HTML Website with JSFiddle

challenges.description: CSS is what you'll use to give your website's HTML elements some style - like colors, fonts and a lot more. Jazz up a simple site at jsfiddle.net so everyone can learn from each others code.
challenges.title: Style your Website with CSS with JSFiddle

challenges.description: The most recent versions of HTML and CSS allow for some pretty neat things on your website - moving parts! Learn a few of the new tricks and add them to your jsfiddle.net site.
challenges.title: Animate with CSS in JSFiddle

challenges.description: All browsers understand the JavaScript programming language. Use Javascript to change the color properties of your site. Edit your jsfiddle.net site, upload a screenshot and link to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Flash Colors with JavaScript in JSFiddle

challenges.description: When you're ready to compose a whole site it's easiest to use a text editor. Install Sublime and build a site in it. Install Chrome to view your page. Take a screenshot of your page in Sublime and upload it to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Code in a Text Editor

challenges.description: A invaluable tool inside your browser allows you to find where errors are coming from and quickly test CSS ideas. Take a screenshot of your website with the inspector open on it.
challenges.title: Find Bugs with Web Inspector

challenges.description: Go further with Javascript and code some neat interactions and experiences on a website - like build a calculator to do multiplication for you! Upload a screenshot of the site you make.
challenges.title: Make a Calculator with Javascript

challenges.description: GitHub is one way to host websites - all you have to do is put the files in a branch on your repo named gh-pages. Set one up and upload a link and screenshot!
challenges.title: Host your Website

challenges.description: Add a new rule to the game of 'Tag' to make it yours! Tag is an old folk game: one person's "it" and has to tag everyone else before they make it home.
challenges.title: Introduce a New Rule to Tag

challenges.description: Ball game possibilities are infinite – invent your own!
challenges.title: Create a Ball Game

challenges.description: Make a game using just a piece of paper, pen or pencil, and a set of rules.
challenges.title: Make a Pen and Paper Game

challenges.description: A Choose Your Own Adventure is a branching story. Write a zine, draw a comic - but give it CHOICES!
challenges.title: Write a Choose Your Own Adventure

challenges.description: All a body game needs is a human body! They help us explore how our bodies relate to what's around them or to themselves.
challenges.title: Design a Body Game

challenges.description: Word games let us explore language and vocabulary. They're easy to make with pen and paper, or they can be entirely vocal.
challenges.title: Invent a Word Game

challenges.description: Puzzles or solitaire games are things that  help us focus and give us a challenge when we're alone. Record a video of your puzzle game creation.
challenges.title: Create a Puzzle Game

challenges.description: 1000 Blank White Cards is a game where all the players make their own cards. Show us the most interesting one from your game!
challenges.title: Play 1000 Blank White Cards

challenges.description: A board game has some spatial component: the board itself could be anything, a piece of cardboard, an arrangement of playing cards.
challenges.title: Make a Board Game

challenges.description: Twine is a free program for making Choose Your Own Adventure stories on the computer. Upload yours and post the link!
challenges.title: Write a Twine Game

challenges.description: Card games feature luck and chance. Using a deck of playing cards or some index cards and a pen, you can make your own.
challenges.title: Design a Card Game

challenges.description: Story games encourage us to role-play or to make up stories. Let us hear part of the story that comes out of yours.
challenges.title: Make a Story Game

challenges.description: Big games make us think about how we relate to a space or environment. Play them outdoors or in a big, cavernous building.
challenges.title: Orchestrate a Big Game

challenges.description: Graphical computer games use art and sound to tell a story. Using free programs you can find online, you can make your own videogame.
challenges.title: Create a Graphical Videogame

challenges.description: Sprites are images that contain all the frames or faces of an animation and are used in building games (and web apps, too!). Use either Pickle or Scratch to make it, then upload a screenshot!
challenges.title: Create a Sprite Sheet

challenges.description: Texture tiles are repeated patterns used to create the background environment in games. Think: all the blocks in Minecraft have texture tiles. Use Pickle or Scratch to create your own environment textures and upload them to complete the challenge!
challenges.title: Make Environment Textures

challenges.description: Use the sprites and textures you've created to build a 2D game. Use Stencyl or Scratch, and upload a screenshot of your game and a link to the actual game so other Makers can play it and be inspired!
challenges.title: Make a 2D Game

challenges.description: Web browsers are powerful enough to host some awesome games these days - they're built with HTML5 and JavaScript. See what's possible by using some pre-existing JavaScript game engines. Upload screenshots and and a link to your game to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Use a JavaScript Game Engine

challenges.description: If you know JavaScript well you can build or, as they say, "roll" your own game engine that does exactly what you want it to. Checkout these resources for learning how and when you've rolled your own upload a screenshot and share the code on GitHub!
challenges.title: Roll Your Own JavaScript Game Engine

challenges.description: Unity is a free and powerful 3D game engine. Its got audio, lighting, physics and more built in. Go through some of the tutorials and then make your own 3D game! Upload a screenshot and link to your game to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Make a 3D Game in Unity

challenges.description: Blender is 3D modeling software, use it to create custom 3D elements for your game and import them back into Unity. For this challenge, upload a screenshot of the awesome 3D things you make.
challenges.title: Build 3D Game Elements in Blender

challenges.description: Upload a screenshot of art you made in a game.
challenges.title: Use A Game To Make Art

challenges.description: Play a Co-Op game with your friends and take a screen shot or screencast video of you and your team in action.
challenges.title: Play a Co-Op Game with Friends

challenges.description: Post a screen grab or video of a character you designed.
challenges.title: Make a Character with an In-Game Editor

challenges.description: Engineer a mechanism and explain how it works in a video or in the comments section.
challenges.title: Engineer a Mechanism Using A Physics Simulator

challenges.description: Set up your own game server so you can host your friends and soon-to-be-friends and take a screenshot showing how you made it happen.
challenges.title: Set up a Game Server

challenges.description: Many games have built-in level editors that let you invent your own worlds. Take a screen shot and list the game you used in the comments.
challenges.title: Design a Game Level with an In-Game Editor

challenges.description: Some games are capable of modeling civilizations. Post a shot of your civilization and mention what game you used in the comments.
challenges.title: Manage a Simulated Civilization

challenges.description: Explore new areas in a game and learn how the game itself works. Make sure to provide enough details so a new player will have a good understanding.
challenges.title: Write A Guide Explaining A Game

challenges.description: Garry's Mod lets you take models from your favorite games and change them in cool ways. Explain your mod with video or in the comments.
challenges.title: Make Something Rad in Garry's Mod

challenges.description: Some games let you use external tools to create radically different levels. Post a shot of your Game Level and explain it in the comments.
challenges.title: Author a Game Level From Scratch

challenges.description: Raise a seedling indoors, then share when the seed has started to grow. Starting indoors protects young plants.
challenges.title: Grow a Seedling

challenges.description: Seed tape makes it easier to plant small seeds in neat rows.
challenges.title: Make Seed Tape

challenges.description: Create a sped up film of a plant growing with a time lapse app or editing program.
challenges.title: Timelapse a Growing Plant

challenges.description: Raise plants in pots, jugs, cans – Remember to make a drain hole in the bottom.
challenges.title: Grow Plants in a Container

challenges.description: Plant seeds or starts in good soil, outside, in a garden box or hole you dig.
challenges.title: Plant an Outdoor Garden Bed

challenges.description: Make a slow-drip watering system – Most plants like their roots to be damp, but not muddy.
challenges.title: Build an Irrigation System

challenges.description: Build a greenhouse and create a little extra warmth and moisture for your plants.
challenges.title: Build a Greenhouse

challenges.description: Create compost by mixing kitchen scraps with garden clippings, or make a worm bin compost.
challenges.title: Make Compost

challenges.description: Come up with techniques to battle pests and invite useful bugs to your garden.
challenges.title: Protect Your Garden From Pests

challenges.description: Build a bed by filling it with good soil.
challenges.title: Prepare a Garden Bed

challenges.description: Share a picture or video of your garden bounty!
challenges.title: Harvest Seeds, Leaves, Fruits, Flowers, or Roots

challenges.description: Rock piles for snakes, ponds for frogs, birdhouses or wildflowers – Invite natural predators into your garden to eat your pests.
challenges.title: Make a Habitat for Creatures

challenges.description: Capture rain and store it in a barrel to use again in the summer months.
challenges.title: Collect Rainwater

challenges.description: Learn about the spiral structure of DNA by building your own model.
challenges.title: Build a Spiral DNA Model

challenges.description: Use simple household materials to extract DNA from a fruit, vegetable, or even your self!
challenges.title: Extract DNA

challenges.description: Study a genetic process such as cellular mitosis or DNA transcription, then make your version with a colored drawing or animation.
challenges.title: Illustrate or Animate a Genetic Process

challenges.description: Draw a chart or make a photo collage tracking genetic traits through several generations of your family.
challenges.title: Make a Family Tree

challenges.description: Fill in Punnett Squares for a pair of animals you want to mate. Explain the variety of traits you can expect from the combination of those two animals.
challenges.title: Predict Animal Traits

challenges.description: People that taste bitterness on a higher level are called Supertasters! Record a video of yourself performing a PTC test and find out if you're one, too.
challenges.title: Take the Supertaster Test

challenges.description: Fingerprints are unique but share similar patterns. Take a fingerprint of your thumb, and compare it with a parent or sibling. Label the patterns.
challenges.title: Uncover Genes from a Fingerprint

challenges.description: Find a genetically modified organism (GMO) and explain how it was modified in a video. Usually a GMO is food, but it can be anything living.
challenges.title: Describe a GMO

challenges.description: Solve a protein puzzle in an online game called FoldIt, then upload your score. Help real scientists see and understand the structure of new proteins.
challenges.title: Solve a Protein Puzzle in FoldIt

challenges.description: Rocks can be broken into three categories: igneous, metamorphic and sedimentary. Start there and narrow down your options until you've found the right one. Share your rock ID with a photo or video.
challenges.title: Identify a Rock

challenges.description: Start a rock collection – be sure to label each one. If you don't know the exact rock, label it with clues like color, heft, hardness and streak.
challenges.title: Start a Rock Collection

challenges.description: Use evaporation to create intricate crystals on sugar, salt, or ice. Diamonds take thousands of years, but these can grow much faster.
challenges.title: Grow Crystals

challenges.description: Break open a rock and show what's inside – it's a Geologist's magic trick!
challenges.title: Break Open a Rock

challenges.description: You can experiment with the same forces that create rocks in nature:  temperature, pressure, and different chemicals and minerals.
challenges.title: Make Rocks

challenges.description: Geologists often use scale models to understand the behavior of physical things. Create a table top experiment that demonstrates a geological event taking place.
challenges.title: Make a Geological Model

challenges.description: From a marble balanced on top of a pencil to the Sudden Motion Sensor in a laptop computer, many different things can be used to make a seismometer that will measure movement in the ground around you.
challenges.title: Make a Seismometer

challenges.description: Make your own compass to measure the powerful magnetic fields produced by the Earth. Your compass must actually work to complete this challenge—no drawings allowed!
challenges.title: Make a Compass

challenges.description: A compass, a clinometer, and some calculations are all you need to discover the angle of a cliff, slope, or rock bed. Explain how it works with a video.
challenges.title: Make a Clinometer

challenges.description: Once you're familiar with the kinds of rocks and minerals around you, condense your observations into a map.  A colorful key will help your readers decipher the map, whether it's as big as a planet or as small as patch of garden.
challenges.title: Draw a Geological Map

challenges.description: A geologist knows everything about rocks. How they're made, what rock is what and how old they are. Find a geologist and ask them some questions. Share a short video of something interesting.
challenges.title: Talk With a Geologist

challenges.description: The rocks, minerals, and organic matter found in soil give clues to its history. Geologists can use this information to do anything from offer forensic evidence in a court case to suggesting the right soil amendments for a healthy garden.
challenges.title: Conduct a Soil Test

challenges.description: Glaciers are huge ice forms that build up when snow falls and doesn't melt. Freezing and melting over millennia has shaped mountains. Now, glaciers are melting very fast because of changes in the climate – if we understand them, we may keep them from disappearing.
challenges.title: Make a Glacier Simulation

challenges.description: Design your own custom business card that communicates what it is you do. Don't use your real information (name, address, etc.)
challenges.title: Create a Business Card

challenges.description: A logo is a mark or symbol that represents a person, idea, or organization. Design a new logo that represents you or redesign an existing logo to make it fresh and awesome.
challenges.title: Design a Logo

challenges.description: Design your own packaging or find a product you love to use and redesign its packaging. If redesigning, show the original along with the new design.
challenges.title: Design a Package

challenges.description: A pictogram is an icon or symbol that is used to represent something. It should be simple and easy to understand. Create a pictogram that conveys an action, place, thing or idea.
challenges.title: Design a Pictogram

challenges.description: Use a computer program or hand draw a t-shirt design. Use the blank t-shirt as your canvas.
challenges.title: Make a T-Shirt Design

challenges.description: Pick a book, CD or DVD you like and design a cover for it. It should make people want to read, listen or watch it.
challenges.title: Design a Cover

challenges.description: Hand draw or use a program to create an infographic.
challenges.title: Design an Infographic

challenges.description: Grid systems help keep things ordered and looking good. Design something using the grid system and outline your grid so it really pops.
challenges.title: Use a Grid System

challenges.description: Screen print a design onto a t-shirt, poster, postcard, or anything else that's flat. Show the process with pictures of video.
challenges.title: Screen Print a Design

challenges.description: Think of something awesome to print, then carve out a block of wood or linoleum and print it.
challenges.title: Make a Relief Print

challenges.description: Design a typeface with all the letters of the alphabet, plus 0-9, and use it to write your username.
challenges.title: Design a Typeface

challenges.description: A roll is like a flip, but on the ground. It's the most fundamental skill in gymnastics. Take a video of yourself doing a forward or backward roll. Or maybe even try both!
challenges.title: Do a Roll

challenges.description: Keeping your back and legs straight, place one hand on the ground and then the other as your legs pass over your body and land on the ground. Share a video of you doing your best cartwheel.
challenges.title: Do a Cartwheel

challenges.description: A roundoff is like a cartwheel, but with a slight twist. Literally. Start off like you're doing a cartwheel, and then twist your body as you come around. Share your roundoff with a video.
challenges.title: Master a Roundoff

challenges.description: A backbend kickover, or bridge kickover, is a great way to get your body in shape before attempting a back handspring. Practice your kickover a few times, and share your best one with a video.
challenges.title: Practice a Backbend Kickover

challenges.description: A full turn on a beam requires body awareness. Have a coach or partner help you practice until you feel comfortable doing it yourself. Take a video of your best turn.
challenges.title: Do a Full Turn on a Beam

challenges.description: A handstand requires balance and upper body strength. Practice against a wall until you feel you can do one on your own. Share your perfected handstand with a video.
challenges.title: Practice a Handstand

challenges.description: A straddle roll is a forward roll where your legs stay straight and in a splits shape during the entire roll. If you need to, use a cheese (wedge) mat to help you out. Share your straddle roll with a video.
challenges.title: Practice a Straddle Roll

challenges.description: Vaulting can be done in all sorts of ways, the simplest being getting a running start and gliding over a surface, like a table. Make a video showing your best vault.
challenges.title: Perform a Vault

challenges.description: A back handspring is performed with the legs together at all times. Be careful with this one so you don't hurt your back. Practice on the ground, then with a partner, perfecting the movement until you can do it on your own. Share with a video.
challenges.title: Do a Back Handspring

challenges.description: A kick up, or kip up, is where you spring up from a laying position. This one requires some practice. Do this one on a padded or grassy surface so you don't hurt your back. Share your best one with a video.
challenges.title: Perform a Kick Up

challenges.description: Aerials are like cartwheels, but without using your hands. Also, they look really cool! Share your best aerial with a video.
challenges.title: Perform an Aerial

challenges.description: You can build a balance beam out long pieces of wood covered with thick cloth, or sand it smooth so you don't get a splinter. A piece of wood laid on the ground is not a balance beam. Balance beams are 10 cm wide, 500 cm long, and usually 124 cm off the ground.
challenges.title: Build a Balance Beam

challenges.description: Beam routines combine leaps, dance poses, handstands, rolls and walkovers. Have someone film your beam routine and share it with everyone.
challenges.title: Create a Beam Routine

challenges.description: Most floor routines are done on a spring floor, which make the floor more bouncy. If you don't have access to a spring floor, find a large, flat patch of grass. Film your floor routine and include at least five different moves.
challenges.title: Do a Floor Routine

challenges.description: A bar routine should have flight elements, at least two different grips, a close bar circle element, non flight with a turn on the bar, and a dismount. Share your routine with a video.
challenges.title: Complete a Bar Routine

challenges.description: Use an Ardiuno, a computer, and a USB cable to make an LED blink. Record it blinking with a video.
challenges.title: Make an LED blink with an Arduino

challenges.description: Use "RGB LEDs" to make a color mixer that can change colors between red, green, and blue.
challenges.title: Build a Rainbow LED Mixer

challenges.description: Make music or just some really strange tones to annoy your friends. Share it with a video.
challenges.title: Make Music with a Microcontroller

challenges.description: Who doesn't like booby traps? Build a "trip wire" security alarm for a room and take a video of someone setting it off.
challenges.title: Construct a "Trip" Alarm

challenges.description: Don't throw away your dead batteries! Use a Joule Thief circuit to bring them back to life. Build a Joule Thief and use it to power an LED using a "dead" battery.
challenges.title: Make a Joule Thief Circuit

challenges.description: A sensor can be used to measure all manner of different things including temperature, light, vibrations... heck even air quality and your heartbeat! By connecting a sensor to the internet you can monitor it from anywhere and share it with your friends.
challenges.title: Connect a Sensor to the Internet

challenges.description: One thing that modern electronics are really good at is sound. Find a stuffed animal, build some electronic guts that make it talk, then share your franken-critter with DIY.
challenges.title: Build a Talking Stuffed Animal

challenges.description: Why check the weather yourself when you can have a robot do it? Build a weather station using common sensors and an Arduino and show it off with a video.
challenges.title: Build an Arduino Powered Weather Station

challenges.description: Joysticks and video game controllers for your computer can be pretty nifty, but wouldn't it be better if you could design and build your own? In this challenge you'll invent your own computer input device and take a video of you using it.
challenges.title: Build a Video Game Controller

challenges.description: Remembering to water your garden can be a real pain. Why not hack together a circuit that can do it for you? Build an automated garden and shoot a video of it.
challenges.title: Automate Your Garden

challenges.description: Our five senses (hearing, sight, touch, smell and taste) are great and all, but why not build something to give us more? How about being able to "feel" distance or what about being able to "hear" magnets? Build a circuit and show off your invention with a video.
challenges.title: Give Yourself Extra Sensory Perception

challenges.description: Research a local landmark or historic event and film yourself telling us about it. Tell us where you got your info.
challenges.title: Make a 1-Minute History Video

challenges.description: Dig around in the ground or in your grandparent's attic and find an artifact that is older than 1970.  Explain what it is and where you found it.
challenges.title: Find Old Artifacts

challenges.description: Everybody has an important history. Collect someone's life story or ask them about an important moment. Record a video with sound.
challenges.title: Record Oral History

challenges.description: Make a timeline telling the history of a place, object or group. Use color and shapes to enhance your timeline!
challenges.title: Draw a Historical Timeline

challenges.description: Before hardware stores, people made their own tools. Try you hand at making these simple objects.
challenges.title: Make Ancient Tools

challenges.description: Time Capsules are filled with objects from the present and opened in the future. Film a video of you explaining what you put in your capsule and why.
challenges.title: Make a Time Capsule

challenges.description: A coat of arms was a design worn by medieval knights to identify  and represent their family. Typically, it consisted of a shield, a crest, a wreath, and a motto. Design your own coat of arms.  (Make sure to cover up your real name if you write it on the crest!)
challenges.title: Design a Coat of Arms

challenges.description: Examine maps to learn about the history of your town. Make a map that shows how the place changed over time.
challenges.title: Map the Past

challenges.short: Spend a Day in the Past
challenges.description: Research an era of the past and live just as they did, or visit a historic reenactment. Share some pics or a video of your experience in the past.
challenges.title: Spend a Day in the Past

challenges.description: History is full of riveting stories. Make a documentary that tells the story of a person, place or movement.
challenges.title: Make a History Documentary

challenges.description: Nothing says "You're all right!" like a handmade card.  Sketch out a design, then craft your card. Bonus points for pop-up cards.
challenges.title: Make a Holiday Card

challenges.description: Those holiday tunes are so darn catchy - and heartwarming. Sing, whistle, hum, or play an instrument to bring holiday cheer to people around you.
challenges.title: Perform a Holiday Song

challenges.description: Making a set of resolutions is a great way to plan for the year ahead. Resolutions can be anything you want to improve—eat more vegetables, spend more time with your family, or earn 100 skills on DIY! Share your resolutions in a video or with a written list.
challenges.title: Share New Year's Resolutions

challenges.description: There are plenty of cool holidays that already exist, but what about the cool ones that don't? Invent a new holiday complete with a name, a backstory, and some traditions. Share your holiday idea with a photo or a video.
challenges.title: Invent a New Holiday

challenges.description: Nothing makes a gift feel more special than homemade wrapping paper, and it's a great way to recycle old materials. Using some paper and art supplies, design a new look for your packages. Share with a photo.
challenges.title: Make Gift Wrap

challenges.description: Make ornaments, snowflakes, trees and lanterns, and transform your space into a place that feels inviting and warm for others.
challenges.title: Decorate the House

challenges.description: Stalking out into the woods and returning with a small piece of your local forest is an honorable tradition that brings the outdoors in.
challenges.title: Forage for Natural Decorations

challenges.description: There's something about foliage laid in a circle that's really cool. Make a wreath with a wire coat hanger and foliage from trees in your neighborhood.
challenges.title: Make a Wreath

challenges.description: Once the holidays are over, piles of amazing food can often turn into piles of boring leftovers. Design a creative way to recycle your holiday leftovers into a new snack or meal, and share your creation with a photo or video.
challenges.title: Recycle Leftovers

challenges.description: The most cherished gifts are handmade. Think of something awesome to make for someone, and then make it! Share a picture of your completed, unwrapped gift.
challenges.title: Make a Gift

challenges.description: Everyone does the holidays a little bit differently. In a video or clear photo, explain what winter holiday you celebrate and show or describe a unique tradition that your family does each year.
challenges.title: Share a Unique Family Tradition

challenges.description: Every great family tradition has to start somewhere! Pick a new winter holiday tradition to try—open a gift early, make festive hats, volunteer with friends—and share it with a photo or a video.
challenges.title: Try a New Tradition

challenges.description: People from all around the world celebrate a variety of unique holidays. Research a new holiday, and choose a tradition from that holiday to try. In a video, explain the holiday you researched and the tradition you tried out.
challenges.title: Try a Tradition from Another Culture

challenges.description: The best way to share the love is to cook. That's the oldest rule in the world. Cook for the whole family and show off your entire spread in a photo.
challenges.title: Cook for Everybody

challenges.description: There's a lot of people who don't have it as good as you. Find volunteer opportunities in your town and give a helping hand to your friends in need.
challenges.title: Volunteer or Donate

challenges.description: Build more space on your wall using shelf brackets.
challenges.title: Build a Shelf

challenges.description: Find something broken around your home and fix it.
challenges.title: Fix Something Basic

challenges.description: Pick out a cool color for your wall and get to painting! Share a picture of you painting or of your painting supplies to complete this challenge.
challenges.title: Paint a Wall

challenges.description: Walkways allow us to focus more on what's around us than what's below our feet. Use logs, pavers, bricks or anything else you can think of to create an outdoor walkway.
challenges.title: Make a Walkway

challenges.description: Ceiling fans, sconces and chandeliers all require basic wiring as well as something solid to fasten them to. Take a time-lapse or video of your hang.
challenges.title: Hang a Fixture

challenges.description: Dimming your screen is a good start to saving energy, but for this challenge you need to take it to the next level. Changing your home's lighting to energy efficient bulbs, turning down your hot water heater, and using timers on your thermostat are great start.
challenges.title: Save Energy

challenges.description: The yard can be an extension of your house if done right. You can plant trees for shade or fruit, as well as flowers and vegetables. Create a space that people can't help but want to use.
challenges.title: Plant a Garden

challenges.description: Building your own furniture isn't just making a chair to sit on or a table to eat at. It's a way to add character to a room while learning basic construction. Sketch a few designs and pick the best one to build.
challenges.title: Build Custom Furniture

challenges.description: Knowing how to wire a plug or switch is a great skill to have. Always make sure to shut off the breaker and use a voltage reader to check for power. Take a video and explain the process of wiring a plug or switch.
challenges.title: Wire a Plug or Switch

challenges.description: Leaky faucets, clogged drain and running toilets are problems we've all experienced. Instead of shelling out tons of cash by calling a plumber, you can fix it yourself. Take a video showing how you did it.
challenges.title: Fix a Plumbing Problem

challenges.description: A home can be something as simple as a tiny cabin or shelter. Find a spot of land, gather all your supplies and tools, and build a place to live.
challenges.title: Build a Home

challenges.description: Draw your own version of your DIY Avatar – make it even better!
challenges.title: Draw Your DIY Avatar

challenges.description: Draw an animal using a photo – or even real life – as your reference.
challenges.title: Draw Animals

challenges.description: Draw faces with the proportions and character of a real person.
challenges.title: Draw a Face

challenges.description: Drawing upside down is a great way to copy complex images. When you look at an upside down picture, your brain only sees the basic shapes, making it way easier to draw what you see. Share a video/timelapse of you creating your upside-down drawing.
challenges.title: Draw Upside Down

challenges.description: A still life is a drawing made by looking at a group of real, inanimate objects. Collect a few objects that you like (like flowers, fruits, or toys) and recreate them in a realistic illustration.
challenges.title: Draw a Still Life

challenges.description: Block your vision with a folder or piece of cardboard while you look at an object. Now, draw what you see, but don't peek at your hand as it moves. Share a video of the whole thing, and make sure to share your finished drawing at the end!
challenges.title: Draw Blind

challenges.description: By using many dots or short strokes, you can create forms with a sense of dynamic movement and complex, vibrant tones.
challenges.title: Use Various Drawing Styles

challenges.description: Buildings, cars, streets, and landscapes are some of the best subjects for a picture. There is no end to the variety and surprises that are everywhere around you.
challenges.title: Draw Your Environment

challenges.description: A Zentangle is an abstract drawing made up of lots of simple, repeating patterns. Creating Zentangles is a fun and relaxing form of artistic meditation—for best results, focus on drawing each individual line and don't worry about the final drawing!
challenges.title: Draw a Zentangle

challenges.description: Understanding how the natural world works is often only possible when we can visualize it. You can help people grasp scientific concepts easier by drawing out a natural process or structure in a clear way, with indications of movement and labels.
challenges.title: Illustrate Science

challenges.description: A self-portrait is an image of the artist by the artist. Many famous painters like Rembrandt and Frida Kahlo spent their entire career perfecting their ability to draw their own face. Use a mirror or photo as reference, and draw a realistic self portrait.
challenges.title: Draw a Self-Portrait

challenges.description: Draw a monster of your own design. Monsters can be cute and fluffy or big and ferocious. Don't forget the teeth!
challenges.title: Draw a Monster

challenges.description: Copying from a photo is an awesome way to practice your detailing and shading skills. Using a grid system, you can accurately blow up a small photo with perfect proportions. Share your drawing and the photo you used.
challenges.title: Draw from a Photograph

challenges.description: Anatomy sketches use just lines and shading to recreate the appearance of the human body and its various parts. Figure drawing has long been an important learning exercise for young artist – its important to memorize the body and be able to draw it accurately.
challenges.title: Sketch Human Anatomy

challenges.description: With a few simple guidelines, you can create the illusion of perspective in your drawings. Its so easy! When you can draw with perspective techniques, your scenes and worlds will come to life with a sense of realism.
challenges.title: Draw in Perspective

challenges.description: Use illustrations to tell a story. Invent a character and give them a challenge to overcome, or try picking a theme to explore. Share a video or a series of photos that show the pages in your illustrated picture book.
challenges.title: Illustrate a Picture Book

challenges.description: Draw or build a prototype chair. It's nice if the chair looks great, even better if it's comfortable to sit in – that's Ergonomics!
challenges.title: Design a Chair

challenges.description: Make a drawing that clearly communicates your design idea – it can be doodles, technical drawings, or anything in between.
challenges.title: Sketch a Design

challenges.description: Do a drawing of a vehicle that excites you, or even build the prototype!
challenges.title: Design a Vehicle

challenges.description: Keep a notebook to capture thoughts, brainstorm problems, and sketch ideas. The best way to have good ideas is to have LOTS of ideas first, then later take your pick of the best ones.
challenges.title: Start an Idea Notebook

challenges.description: When a problem arises, a great product provides an eloquent and simple solution to it. Remember, sometimes the simplest solution is the best solution.
challenges.title: Solve a Problem With Design

challenges.description: A big part of an industrial designer's job is making a product sustainable. Where do your materials come from and where they will end up after the product's life is over? Make a product that is more energy efficient and build it using green and recycled materials.
challenges.title: Make a Green Design

challenges.description: A package is more than just a product container. A good package design speaks to the consumer. It begs to be picked up and touched. It also sets itself apart from a competitor's product by making the best use of shape, color, texture, and even font type.
challenges.title: Create a Package Design

challenges.description: A great way to see if a new design works is to build a prototype of it. Some prototypes are simple, just made to get a feel for size or shape. Other prototypes actually work exactly like a real product.
challenges.title: Build a Prototype

challenges.description: CAD, also called Computer Aided Design, allows designers to quickly create a 3D object on their computer. CADs model can be changed and tweaked before ever having to build, or even be printed directly with a 3d printer.
challenges.title: Design in 3D CAD Software

challenges.description: Uncover a problem that you or someone around you experiences. Take a video describing how it could be made better.
challenges.title: Identify Something to Improve

challenges.description: Brainstorming is a fun way to think about solutions to a problem in many different ways. Pick a  problem and solve it together with friends. Sketch your 10 ideas.
challenges.title: Brainstorm with Friends

challenges.description:
Prototypes help innovators test their ideas quickly and make improvements to their designs. Build 
three different solutions to a design problem.
challenges.title: Build 3 Quick Prototypes

challenges.description: A life hack is trick, shortcut, or improvement that makes using an object or finishing a task easier and more efficient. Innovators often practice by improving things they already love. Add a new feature to something you already own to make it better.
challenges.title: Make a Life Hack

challenges.description: Design a snack to help people eat healthy in a fun way.
challenges.title: Make a Snack for a Picky Eater

challenges.description: Create an app that encourages people to move. Sketch what the screens look like and build a prototype. Have a friend try it out and give you feedback.
challenges.title: Design an App to Get People Moving

challenges.description: Ask friends what they wish for in a summer camp. Draw a layout of the camp and plan a few of its activities. Sketch or build out your ideas, and use them as props in a promotional commercial.
challenges.title: Design the Ultimate Summer Camp

challenges.description:
Innovators focus on human needs. There are a range of phobias people experience - from fear of 
heights to fear of chickens. Choose a phobia and design a solution for it.
challenges.title: Invent a Phobia and Design a Solution

challenges.description: Innovators are always thinking about what life will be like in the future. Imagine yourself sixty years from now and design something that will help you live a better life in old age. Think about how you will travel, communicate and live.
challenges.title: Design for the Future You

challenges.description: Designers begin by observing the world around them. Walk around your neighborhood and talk to a few neighbors about something they wish were improved in your community. Design a tool, service or a space that addresses this need. Make a video about your solution.
challenges.title: Re-design Your Neighborhood

challenges.description: Choose a big problem in your community and think up solutions. Explain why they help make your community better and create a video pitch.
challenges.title: Make a Pitch To Your Local Community

challenges.description: Innovators aren't afraid to try, which usually means making mistakes so they can ﬁgure out a better way. Share something you tried that didn't work and what you learned from it.
challenges.title: Learn From Your Failure

challenges.description: Boxes can all make sounds by adding vibrating strings.  Banjos, Guitars, Violins, Sitars, Harps are just a few of the 'Chordophones'. Share your sound with a video.
challenges.title: Make a String Instrument

challenges.description: Make a drum by stretching a thin material over a rigid frame. The trick is to get the "membrane" tight enough, and to have "resonance heads" that amplify the sound.
challenges.title: Stretch a Drum

challenges.description: Make an experimental musical instrument. Any object that can make a sound is an instrument – but what kind of sounds do you enjoy? Show us how your instrument sounds with a video.
challenges.title: Invent an Experimental Instrument

challenges.description: Bells, Cymbals, Xylophones, Marimbas, and Rattles are all types of idiophones. They are made of rigid material, often in several sections – the length of the section determines the pitch of the note. They must be struck or plucked directly.
challenges.title: Build an Idiophone

challenges.description: Adjusting the pitch of each of the tones on your instrument is an important skill. You'll need to stay in tune to match up with others in the band or to play written songs. To do this challenge, record a video (with sound!) of your tuning job.
challenges.title: Tune Your Instrument

challenges.description: Woodwinds are instruments that make sound when blown, causing air inside a tube to vibrate. Flutes, Recorders, Saxophones, Clarinets, and Bagpipes are all kinds of woodwinds. To do this challenge, record video of your woodwind being played or take a photo of it.
challenges.title: Make a Woodwind

challenges.description: Trumpet, bugle, horn, trombone, tuba – just some of the instruments in the Brass family. They have tubular bodies that resonate the lip vibrations of the player. Brass instruments don't need to be made out of brass, just as woodwinds aren't all made of wood.
challenges.title: Make a Brass Instrument

challenges.description: Mozart called the organ the "King of Instruments." Indeed, it is epic. It makes sound by passing wind through pipes. Some are built 5 stories tall, yet you can build one in a bedroom. To solve this challenge, record video or snap a shot of your organ being played.
challenges.title: Build an Organ

challenges.description: Synthesizers, keyboards, sequencers, and samplers are a few of the many electronic instruments.  They all produce electrical audio signals that vibrate a speaker. There are many ways to play with electronic signals – an infinite variety of amazing sounds await you.
challenges.title: Make an Electronic Instrument

challenges.description: A musical scale is a series of notes created by an instrument, and a tuning system is what determines those notes.  Alternative scales can be found anywhere that you listen for them. Record a video with sound of your system.
challenges.title: Invent an Alternative Tuning System

challenges.description: Build a real or virtual model of the inside of a room.
challenges.title: Make a 3D Model Room

challenges.description: A design board (or "mood board") is a collage of colors, textures, and objects that helps an interior designer brainstorm the way a room will look. Using magazine cutouts or an editing program, create a mood board for your dream room.
challenges.title: Make a Room Design Board

challenges.description: Make a collage or color chart with five or more colors for an imaginary room.
challenges.title: Create a Color Scheme

challenges.description: One of the simplest ways to make a room feel more relaxed and pleasant is to get rid of clutter.  It's also faster and easier to find things you need when they are organized in a useful and creative way.  Take a before and after photo of your organization project!
challenges.title: Organize Objects

challenges.description: Trophies, photographs, souvenirs, toys, concert tickets: things like these remind us of our favorite memories and help us tell our story to others.  Create an interesting way to permanently display a collection of objects in a room.
challenges.title: Display a Collection

challenges.description: Plants bring life, color, and texture to a room, not to mention extra oxygen!  Humans are hard-wired to enjoy nature, and studies suggest that we are happier, more productive, and breathing better when plants are around.
challenges.title: Arrange an Indoor Garden

challenges.description: Photographs of family and friends, souvenirs from vacation, old toys, tickets from a concert--it's things like these that remind us of our favorite memories and help us tell our story to others.  Find a creative way to display these kinds of objects in a room.
challenges.title: Decorate a Wall

challenges.description: What would your room look like if you had no limits?  Use your favorite medium to create a picture of a room that is focused on awesomeness, not feasibility.  This is the time to let your imagination run wild!
challenges.title: Draw a Fantasy Room

challenges.description: Well-arranged furniture can mean the difference between comfort and collisions.  Think about how a room will be used--where will people sit, talk, eat, sleep, and play?  It's a good idea to draw some plans before you start the heavy lifting!
challenges.title: Arrange Furniture

challenges.description: Interior Designers know that lighting can make or break a room.  You may need ambient lighting for an overall glow, or focused lighting for a specific task.  A lamp can be simple or a statement, but it should always bring illumination.
challenges.title: Design Lighting

challenges.description: Everyone needs a secret space--a place where you can shut out the rest of the world. Secret spaces can be temporary or permanent, inside or outside, as big as a house or as small as a sheet draped over a table.  Create a space and make it as comfortable as you can!
challenges.title: Make a Secret Space

challenges.description: Textiles can bring texture, warmth, and comfort to a room in a way that nothing else can.  It's also quick way to add a burst of color or pattern.  Can't paint your walls or reupholster your sofa?  Just add fabric!
challenges.title: Transform a Room with Textiles

challenges.description: Sometimes the perfect piece of furniture doesn't exist yet, and it's up to Interior Designers to create it.  Carefully measure the space and make detailed plans before building your masterpiece.  Take pictures of your process along the way!
challenges.title: Build Custom Furniture

challenges.description: Interior Designers aren't limited by how an object looks or how it's intended to be used.  Take something that you have and re-imagine it--add new paint or hardware, put it in an unexpected place or use it in a new way.  Be sure to take before and after photos!
challenges.title: Upcycle Furniture

challenges.description: Rainbow looms are so hot right now. Weave some rubber bands into a sweet looking piece of jewelry and share with a photo. How many bracelets do you think you can make?
challenges.title: Make Rainbow Loom Jewelry

challenges.description: You can make some funky looking jewelry with stuff you find around the house or in the trash. Take a picture of your junk to jewels and mention what materials you used in the comments.
challenges.title: Transform Junk to Jewelry

challenges.description: Sketch by hand or use a CAD program to design a custom piece of jewelry. Give it some thought, take your time, and design something you think people would love to wear.
challenges.title: Design Custom Jewelry

challenges.description: Earrings can be made from just about anything. Create a funky pair of earrings and share with a few photos.
challenges.title: Make Earrings

challenges.description: Beads look really cool as a necklace, bracelet, even a toe ring. Grab some string and a handful of beads and share what you made.
challenges.title: Make Beaded Jewelry

challenges.description: What's a wrist without a bracelet? Make a few eye catching bracelets and snap a picture of them on your wrist. How many can you fit on one arm?
challenges.title: Create a Bracelet

challenges.description: Use a thick wire made from copper or silver and create a pendent, bracelet, or a set of earrings. Snap a few photos or explain your process with a video.
challenges.title: Fashion Jewelry from Wire

challenges.description: Bright beads are a staple of jewelry. Make your own from clay, plastic, paper, rocks – just about anything, really. Snap a shot of your finished beads. No less than five.
challenges.title: Make Custom Beads

challenges.description: Braid, weave or loop together strands of fabric, rope or wire into a nice looking bracelet or necklace.
challenges.title: Create Woven Jewelry

challenges.description: A clasp is how you hold together a bracelet or necklace. Use copper or silver wire and share your technique with a video.
challenges.title: Make a Clasp

challenges.description: Decorate your neck with a handmade necklace! Show your progress and the final piece with a set of pictures or a video.
challenges.title: Make a Necklace

challenges.description: Once you get good at jewelry making, you're going to want to share your gift with other jewelry lovers. Etsy is a great place to sell such things. Take a screen grab or video as proof of your first sell, and a link to your site if you have one.
challenges.title: Sell Handmade Jewelry

challenges.description: Build a sweet looking box or wire tree to hold all of your handmade jewelry. Explain how you made it with a video.
challenges.title: Build a Jewelry Holder

challenges.description: Solder, heat and flux are used to join together pieces of metal. Careful now. Your heat has to be super hot in order to work correctly. That means you need a torch with a sharp, accurate flame. Have someone film while you add flux and flow solder into your joint.
challenges.title: Solder Jewelry

challenges.description: This method is a bit tough to do, but the outcome is really slick looking. Find a coin, drill a hole, hammer a bit, and voilà, you have a coin ring. Take a series of photos or a video to show the process.
challenges.title: Make a Ring from a Coin

challenges.description: Jewelry has been made this way for thousands of years. Capture the  process with a video, starting with a wax model and ending with a finished piece.
challenges.title: Cast a Piece of Jewelry

challenges.description: Record an interview with an expert using an audio recorder or your phone.
challenges.title: Interview an Expert

challenges.description: Go to where news is happening and film a report – keep it around 30 seconds.
challenges.title: Film a 30 Second Field Report

challenges.description: Choose a newsworthy story. Dig up the details. And then write a short article. Publish your piece to justpaste.it and put the link in the comments.
challenges.title: Write an Article

challenges.description: Photojournalists tell stories with pictures. Take a series of images that craft a narrative.
challenges.title: Shoot a Photo Essay

challenges.description: Edit down a raw interview. Select only the most interesting bits and discard the rest. Record with iMovie or the iMovie app; upload as a video to DIY.
challenges.title: Produce a Radio Interview

challenges.description: Introduce someone interesting to the world. Keep it short. Keep it compelling.
challenges.title: Report a Personal Story

challenges.description: Scientists are making discoveries daily. Report on the latest research. Tell us where your information is from.
challenges.title: Report on Science News

challenges.description: Tell a true story. Choose a tale others would like to hear. Record and then edit out the dull parts. Use iMovie or the iMovie app, then upload as a video.
challenges.title: Craft a Radio Story

challenges.description: Go to a game and take brief notes. Report the score and any interesting details. Be sure to tell us where you get your info.
challenges.title: Do Sports News

challenges.description: Publish news through the internet. You can write from your opinion or choose to be objective. Post at least three articles.
challenges.title: Write a News Blog

challenges.description: Zines are self-published magazines usually produced with photocopiers. Pick a topic you love and make a zine to trade with a friend.
challenges.title: Publish a Zine
