challenges.description: Choose a single topic you have a strong opinion on and tell us why. Be concise and persuasive. Upload through justpaste.it.
challenges.title: Write an Op-Ed

challenges.description: Dress nice, slick your hair back, and sit down in the studio to bring the world the news. Have a friend film your news report. Don't forget to prepare notes!
challenges.title: Present the Nightly News

challenges.description: Tell a true story. Edit your footage into a tight documentary.
challenges.title: Make a Documentary Film

challenges.description: Publish a physical newspaper. Gather articles, do layout, then print. Circulate your newspaper.
challenges.title: Publish Print Journalism

challenges.description: A bend knot joins two pieces of rope. Tie one, then take a clear picture or video of it.
challenges.title: Use a Bend

challenges.description: Hitches attach rope to a pole, metal ring, or even another rope. Rig a rope swing or hitch your horse in front of the supermarket.
challenges.title: Tie a Hitch

challenges.description: Take a clear photo showing you've mastered a loop knot. You can use it to do anything from hanging a rope ladder to tying a dog’s leash!
challenges.title: Master Loop Knots

challenges.description: Whippings keep rope from fraying, and are beautiful too! You can make it flashier by using colored thread, dental floss or metal wire.
challenges.title: Whip Frayed Ends

challenges.description: Sennits make for great lanyards, Monkey's Fist or a Star Knot make an excellent key fob. Make your own.
challenges.title: Make a Knot Key Chain

challenges.description: Fool your friends with knots that are not! Film a video of you performing knot magic.
challenges.title: Perform Knot Magic

challenges.description: Learn to properly store and organize your rope. Any specialist must take care of their tools.
challenges.title: Keep Rope Shipshape

challenges.description: Tie up a paracord bracelet and have a useful rope supply wherever you are.
challenges.title: Tie a Paracord Bracelet

challenges.description: Lashing is when you join poles together with rope. Try your hand at lashing a quick stool from branches or build yourself a sweet lookout.
challenges.title: Lash a Structure

challenges.description: Try your hand at making a mat to protect a table or place at your doorstep.
challenges.title: Craft Rope Coasters

challenges.description: Good for climbing into secret tree-houses or escaping from an evil witch's tower, rope ladders are surprisingly easy to make! Shoot video of you climbing your ladder!
challenges.title: Make a Rope Ladder

challenges.description: Hang something from an eye you make or splice a never-ending ring.
challenges.title: Learn to Splice

challenges.description: The decorative Turk's Head Knot makes for a great bracelet. Try your hand at tying the classic knot.
challenges.title: Tie a Turk's Head Knot

challenges.description: Craft a quick survival net or make a trendy net tote bag! Use your net to catch a fish or stow your stuff.
challenges.title: Create a Net

challenges.description: Create a path in your yard or land.
challenges.title: Make a Path

challenges.description: Determine what types of trees are best suited for your area and plant them.
challenges.title: Plant a Tree

challenges.description: Get shredded wood, grass clippings, or other organic mulch and cover all your bare soil.
challenges.title: Mulch a Landscape

challenges.description: Find a drab spot in your area and transform it. Show before and after pics.
challenges.title: Guerrilla Garden

challenges.description: Survey your area and figure out what plants and features work best, then design your layout. Be sure to explain your design!
challenges.title: Design a Landscape

challenges.description: Sculpt your land in a way that helps the Earth, taking before and after photos.
challenges.title: Sculpt the Land

challenges.description: Identity an existing microclimate or create your own. Take a photo and label the microclimate and its effect on the area. Rocks, trees, south facing walls, nearby water sources and soils types can all play a role how an area's microclimate behaves.
challenges.title: Create a Microclimate

challenges.description: Find a quiet place in nature to turn into a sitting spot, or create your own by surrounding yourself with natural things like potted plants.
challenges.title: Build a Sitting Spot

challenges.description: Vertical gardens are great when space is limited. Try and use as many recycled materials as you can, such as pallets and bottles.
challenges.title: Make a Vertical Garden

challenges.description: Water features can be as simple as a birdbath or as complex as a pond. Snap photos of your materials as well as the finished project to create a simple How-To.
challenges.title: Build a Water Feature

challenges.description: Retainer walls come in handy when you need to hold back dirt. Most walls are made from urbanite or stone, but you can use anything large and sturdy, such as tires and logs. Build a retainer wall and takes pictures of your progress as well as the finished wall
challenges.title: Create a Retaining Wall

challenges.description: Find a list of native perennials and plant a few in your yard or neighborhood. Take a picture and label it. Perennials are plants that live at least two years.
challenges.title: Plant a Perennial Garden

challenges.description: There are great ways to harvest water that would otherwise be wasted. Pick a harvesting method, build it out and snap a few pictures.
challenges.title: Harvest Water

challenges.description: Turn a parking spot into a mini-park, or place some potted plants on a sidewalk. Take before and after pictures to show the difference.
challenges.title: Create an Urban Parklet

challenges.description: Find a spot that could use a little play and create a place for you and your friends to enjoy. Take before and after pics or a video explaining what you did.
challenges.title: Build an Adventureland

challenges.description: You can use potted plants or cover your whole roof with vegetation. Take before and after pics.
challenges.title: Build a Living Roof

challenges.description: Leather chisels make fast work of punching holes in leather. First score a line around your leather to act as a guide, and then follow it with your punch. Use a wooden or rawhide mallet if you have one.
challenges.title: Use a Leather Chisel

challenges.description: Most leathers are naturally brown, but you can make them any color you want by using special leather dye. Share your dyed leather with a picture or video. Even better, explain what dye you used and how you applied it.
challenges.title: Dye Leather

challenges.description: Awls are used to punch holes in leather so you can stitch your pieces together. They're super sharp, so go slow and be careful. Make a video showing how you use your awl.
challenges.title: Use an Awl

challenges.description: Snaps and rivets are simple ways to attach two pieces of leather. After you punch your hole you'l need special tools to help you set or lock your snaps or rivets. Share with a picture or video.
challenges.title: Set Snaps and Rivets

challenges.description: Hand stitching leather is the best way to attach two pieces. It's super strong and looks good to boot. There are a few techniques out there, but a saddle stitch is the strongest. Share your stitch and  mention what type it is in a video or the comments.
challenges.title: Hand Stitch Leather

challenges.description: You don't need to finish your leather edges, but it makes it look more polished and professional. There are a ton of techniques out there. Some require a paint brush and other a burnishing tool. Share your method with a video or explain it in the comments.
challenges.title: Finish Leather Edges

challenges.description: Carving and embossing leather (also called "tooling") is a great way to add art to your leatherwork. It takes a few tools and a bit of trial and error, but if you have the patience the payoff is huge. Take a picture or video of your piece.
challenges.title: Carve and Emboss Leather

challenges.description: Make a leather pouch or case that can hold coins, a pocket knife, or anything else in need of holding. Show your pattern and the finished pouch.
challenges.title: Make a Leather Pouch

challenges.description: When sewing leather, you're going to want to be able to use both hands. A stitching pony does just that. Build one and show how it works with a video.
challenges.title: Build a Stitching Pony

challenges.description: Make a mold and use it to create a custom bag, pouch, mask... any and all things. Show a picture of your mold along with the finished leather product.
challenges.title: Use a Wet Mold

challenges.description: Leather shoes are super comfortable once they're broken in, and they last a long time. Design your own pattern or find one online and give it a shot. You'll need to explain your process with a video, as well as show your finished shoe.
challenges.title: Stitch a Pair of Leather Shoes

challenges.description: Design a leather bag or purse, create a pattern for it, then cut it out, punch it, and sew it. Add straps and snaps to give it a finished look. Take video.
challenges.title: Make a Leather Bag

challenges.description: Create a stop motion movie that makes use of LEGO bricks or figures.
challenges.title: Make a LEGO® Stop Motion

challenges.description: Build a vehicle with LEGO bricks and share a picture of your final creation. Bonus points if it rolls!
challenges.title: Build a Vehicle

challenges.description: Use LEGO bricks to create pixel art.
challenges.title: Create LEGO® Pixel Art

challenges.description: Use LEGO® bricks to build a bridge that holds at least 10 pounds.
challenges.title: Support a Load

challenges.description: Make a tool using LEGO bricks. Camera dollies, iPhone stands and key holders are all pretty useful things.
challenges.title: Make a Tool using LEGO® bricks

challenges.description: Using LEGO® bricks, build a bridge that spans at least a 4 ft (1.2 m) gap. Take a picture or video of your bridge with a measuring tape.
challenges.title: Bridge a Gap

challenges.description: Use LEGO bricks to create three small creatures or one gigantically huge creature.
challenges.title: Make Creatures Using LEGO® Bricks

challenges.description: Make a human-sized costume or prop inspired by LEGO bricks. Share a picture of you or a friend wearing your homemade LEGO creation.
challenges.title: Make a LEGO® Costume

challenges.description: LEGO Masters don't just build with LEGO: they accessorize with it! Build a LEGO creation that you can wear—it can an accessory like glasses or jewelry, or it can be a full costume. Share a picture of you wearing your final creation .
challenges.title: Make Fashion with LEGO

challenges.description: Use a digital design program to build something with LEGO bricks without using physical blocks. Take screenshots.
challenges.title: Build with Digital LEGO® bricks

challenges.description: Build a mini-scene (also known as a vignette) using LEGO bricks. Try and tell a story with your vignette.
challenges.title: Create a Scene

challenges.description: Create houses, streets, restaurants, and anything else that belongs in a city and give a video tour of the place.
challenges.title: Build a LEGO® City

challenges.description: Use LEGO to design a font or make a sign. Write something cool. Your name is cool.
challenges.title: Make Words with LEGO

challenges.description: Use LEGO® bricks and build a trebuchet that launches a minifigure.
challenges.title: Construct a Trebuchet

challenges.description: Using bricks you already have, create a step-by-step how-to video or instruction manual for a kit you designed from scratch.
challenges.title: Design Your Own LEGO® Kit

challenges.description: Use a CAD program that uses digital blocks to make cool 3D shapes.
challenges.title: Use a CAD Program to Build with LEGO

challenges.description: Use LEGO Mindstorms to build a machine of your design. Demonstrate or explain how your machine works with a video.
challenges.title: Make a LEGO® Mindstorms® Machine

challenges.description: Get together with a couple of friends and participate in FIRST LEGO League. Take video of the action.
challenges.title: Compete in FIRST® LEGO® League

challenges.description: In a 15 second video, tell everyone your native language, then introduce yourself in another language.
challenges.title: Introduce Yourself in Another Language

challenges.description: Record yourself performing a song in another language. You can write your own or sing one of your favorites.
challenges.title: Perform a Song in Another Language

challenges.description: Invented languages are called Conlangs. Create a dictionary for your own Conlang with a minimum of 25 words and share with a picture or video.
challenges.title: Invent a New Language

challenges.description: What language are you trying to learn? Make a video dictionary to help you and your friends remember everyday words in another language.
challenges.title: Make a Video Dictionary

challenges.description: Research a dialect or accent not native to you, and try it out. Record your efforts with a video and mention the area of the accent you chose.
challenges.title: Explore a Dialect or Accent

challenges.description: Language learning apps are a really cool way to learn the basics of a new language. Share what you've learned using your favorite language learning app.
challenges.title: Use a Language-Learning App

challenges.description: Do you think internet slang and txt-speak are ruining language or making it more awesome? State your opinion with a video and give reasons to back up your claim.
challenges.title: State Your Opinion on Internet Slang

challenges.description: Show off your proficiency by speaking with someone else in another language. Bonus points if it's a native speaker and you add subtitles. Take a video.
challenges.title: Have a Conversation in Another Language

challenges.description: In a short video, demonstrate a language you've invented by speaking it yourself, or, better yet, having a conversation with a friend.
challenges.title: Speak Your Invented Language

challenges.description: Make a video that dives into the history behind a language you are interested in. Where did it come from, why did it remain separate from languages around it?
challenges.title: Report on the History of a Language

challenges.description: Control what your audience sees. Things can appear magical when seen from the right angle.
challenges.title: Set Up the Angle of Your Audience

challenges.description: Build a magic wand to create the illusion of magical powers.
challenges.title: Make a Magic Wand

challenges.description: Amaze your audience with some unusual feats of science! Share a video showing off your trick.
challenges.title: Perform a Science Trick

challenges.description: A simple deck of cards and a lot of practice is all your need to perform hundreds of astounding card tricks.
challenges.title: Master a Card Trick

challenges.description: Before they linked rings or sawed a woman in half on stage, many great Magicians practiced their tricks with paper.
challenges.title: Perform a Trick with Paper

challenges.description: Table tricks need just a little set up and look best when your audience is close...but not too close. Take a video that shows off your sleight of hand.
challenges.title: Set Up and Perform a Table Trick

challenges.description: Whether they're using special knots or simple sleight of hand, a skilled Magician can make an ordinary piece of rope do extraordinary things.
challenges.title: Master a Rope Trick

challenges.description: Mentalism is the branch of magic that deals with predictions, telepathy, hypnotism, and other mind tricks.
challenges.title: Learn a Mentalist Trick

challenges.description: With plenty of practice, Magicians can train their hands to move smoothy and quickly, creating illusions their audience doesn't expect.
challenges.title: Practice Sleight of Hand

challenges.description: Some tricks require special devices to be built ahead of time.  Practice your skills with some small props that easily let you take your show on the road.
challenges.title: Build a Pocket-sized Magical Prop

challenges.description: The best Magicians are not dependent on fancy costumes to wow their audience.  However, a few good props can add some style and flourish to your act.
challenges.title: Create a Costume

challenges.description: A simple angled mirror is all you need to make objects appear and disappear in a magic box.
challenges.title: Build a Disappearing Box

challenges.description: In a 15-second video, introduce yourself and tell us what makes you awesome! You can share stuff like favorite hobbies or which skills you want to earn first. (Don't share any personal info like your real name or where you go to school, though!)
challenges.title: Introduce Yourself in 15 Seconds

challenges.description: Tell a joke, or do a quick bit of standup. The delivery is just as important as the joke itself. Practice a bit in front of your friends, and then record a video or your joke.
challenges.title: Tell a Joke

challenges.description: You need to use tools to get skills. It's simple. So learn to use them, learn to keep them nice, and be ready for action.
challenges.title: Set Up your Tools

challenges.description: You can shoot stop-motion with our new App. If you take a frame, move something a little, then take another frame, and you keep doing that, you can make something that feels like magic.
challenges.title: Animate with Objects

challenges.description: Are you a yo-yo master?  A beatboxing champ? Really awesome at solving a rubik's cube?  Show off something that you're good at in a short video.
challenges.title: Show Off Something You're Good At

challenges.description: Use the DIY App to shoot something weirder than anything ever before seen.
challenges.title: Make an Experimental Film

challenges.description: All you need is duct tape and scissors! Boom.
challenges.title: Make a Duct Tape Thing

challenges.description: Invent a meme and watch the world recreate it over and over. A meme is any idea that can be copied. A good meme is really FUN to copy. We won't approve memes that don't seem like they'd be fun to copy.
challenges.title: Make a Video Meme

challenges.description: Use a kit to make a model car, boat, train, plane, skateboard, sled, bike, helicopter, quadrocycle.... you know where this is going....
challenges.title: Make a Model Vehicle

challenges.description: Get your earned patches from the DIY Marketplace, and then stitch it on your backpack, hat, jacket, blanket - anything!
challenges.title: Stitch Your Patches

challenges.description: Beads are an easy way to make IRL pixel art. Make an awesome character or picture using beads, and share your creation with a photo. You can even assemble flat pieces to create 3D shapes!
challenges.title: Make Art with Beads

challenges.description: Just show us how you do it.
challenges.title: Make a How-To Video

challenges.description: With some cheap batteries and a couple of little metal wires you can power a light or a motor to make an electric toy.
challenges.title: Make a Battery Powered Circuit

challenges.description: Make a cool creature with just some fabric, thread and stuffing.
challenges.title: Stitch a Creature

challenges.description: Build yourself a house with sticks. If a woodrat can do it you why can't you?
challenges.title: Build a Stick Fort

challenges.description:
1. Get some cardboard.
2. Cut it out into shapes that you can fold around you.
3. Duct tape it together.
4. Be awesome in your costume.
challenges.title: Build a Cardboard Costume

challenges.description: A piñata is a papier-mâché or cardboard container covered in tissue paper and filled with goodies.  They're fun to make and even more fun to thwack with a baseball bat at birthday parties.
challenges.title: Make a Piñata

challenges.description: Is it wrong to change your appearance, or is makeup a form of self expression? Share your opinion with a video.
challenges.title: State Your Opinion About Makeup

challenges.description: Out of paints and pastels? Draw with makeup! Draw anything you want, or make a plan for how you would put makeup on someone's face.
challenges.title: Draw with Makeup

challenges.description: What did or didn’t you like about the product you bought? Are you going to continue using it? Share your review with a video.
challenges.title: Review a Cosmetic Product

challenges.description: Make a video showing other DIYers how you apply makeup. Use at least three different products.
challenges.title: Shoot a Makeup Tutorial

challenges.description: Colored lip glosses are simple to make with ingredients you probably already have, but to go pro, try and make eyeshadow and nail polish.
challenges.title: Make Your Own Makeup

challenges.description: Apply a full face of makeup- without a mirror. Film the whole thing. Good luck!
challenges.title: Do the "No Mirror Makeup Challenge"

challenges.description: Use latex, fake blood, and crazy colored eyeshadows to make scrapes, scars and bruises. Share your gruesome gashes with a picture or video.
challenges.title: Fake an Injury with Makeup

challenges.description: What special products and tricks do you use to make sure your model looks especially good on camera? Share your tips with a video or in the comments.
challenges.title: Apply Makeup for a Photo Shoot

challenges.description: When someone performs far from the audience, it's hard to see their facial features. Use makeup to help them stand out and snap a photo.
challenges.title: Do Stage Makeup

challenges.description: Do special-effects makeup to transform a face into someone or something completely different.
challenges.title: Transform a Face

challenges.description: Why was 6 afraid of 7? Because 7 8(ate) 9! Pick your favorite math-related joke and share it with a video.
challenges.title: Tell a Math Joke

challenges.description: Pizza is great for everything. Great for making, great for eating, and great for making fractions! Using pizza (or any other food of your choice), cut and label at least 3 fractions. Accuracy matters!
challenges.title: Make Fractions with Food

challenges.description: The golden ratio (aka the Fibonacci spiral) is a special number and proportion that often appears in manmade and natural structures. Find it in a building, piece of art, or plant, and label on your photo to point it out.
challenges.title: Find and Photograph the Golden Ratio

challenges.description: Collect some numerical data or find statistics other people collected. Make an infographic that shows your data with graphs, shapes, color, and other forms. Good infographics make complex data easy to grasp.
challenges.title: Make an Infographic

challenges.description: A clinometer is a cool instrument that can be used to measure the height of really tall objects. Find or make a clinometer and use it to determine the height of a tree or nearby structure. Post a video explaining the object you measured and its height.
challenges.title: Measure Something Tall with a Clinometer

challenges.description: There are clever tricks to speed up just about everything. Memorize a mental math trick, find an awesome way to count on your fingers, or practice interesting ways of multiplying big numbers. Teach and share your trick with a video.
challenges.title: Learn a Quick Math Trick

challenges.description: The abacus is one of the oldest existing counting tools in history, older even than written numbers! It may not look complex, but it’s an extremely quick way to count numbers. Find or make an abacus and post a video demonstrating how to use it.
challenges.title: Count on an Abacus

challenges.description: String art visualizes some of math’s common concepts—order, pattern and symmetry—and explores how straight lines can form a curve. It also looks awesome. Using reinforced graph paper or a peg board, make some geometric string art.
challenges.title: Make String Art

challenges.description: Mathematicians can scale an image easily by using the grid method.  Grid over an image or a flat object like a candy wrapper, then scale it by redrawing it on a larger or smaller grid. Share your drawing, the image you based it on, and the scale ratio you used.
challenges.title: Scale a Drawing with a Grid

challenges.description: There are plenty of great tools to help with solving math problems, but if you don’t have one handy, it can be a huge pain. Find a way to make a homemade compass, ruler, protractor, or anything other tool you might need.
challenges.title: Create a Homemade Math Tool

challenges.description: Using only paper, you can make mathematical structures with any number of sides! (You can even make a one-sided structure: a mobius strip!) Build a 3D polyhedron form and label its number of sides. Share your papercraft with a photo.
challenges.title: Make Paper Polyhedra

challenges.description: A fractal is an infinitely-complex, never-ending pattern that is made by repeating a shape over and over again while making it smaller and smaller. Try replicating this effect with a computer program, in 3D, or on paper. Share your results with a photo.
challenges.title: Make Art with Fractals

challenges.description: Logic puzzles are hard to write but addicting to solve! You can make it as easy or hard as you want, but make sure it has a solution. Post your puzzle (without the answer) so other members can try to solve it!
challenges.title: Write a Logic Puzzle

challenges.description: Create a carnival-esque game using dice, a spinner, balls, or anything else you can think of that uses probability and chance to win. In a video, explain how your game works and what the probability of winning is.
challenges.title: Design a Probability Game

challenges.description: Change the oil in an engine and then snap a picture or video of the process.
challenges.title: Change Your Oil

challenges.description: Snap a pic or video as you maintain a vehicle, and describe what you did.
challenges.title: Maintain a Vehicle

challenges.description: Build an organizer from scratch, or modify an existing one, and snap a photo with your tools in it.
challenges.title: Organize Your Tools

challenges.description: Fix a broken vacuum cleaner. Include a title or video to describe what was wrong with it, and what you did.
challenges.title: Fix a Vacuum Cleaner

challenges.description: Find a car, go-kart or mower and take video or pictures while you replace its spark plugs.
challenges.title: Replace a Spark Plug

challenges.description: It's always a good idea to know the names of the parts in your machine. Draw up a part of the whole device and label it.
challenges.title: Draw and Label a Mechanical Part

challenges.description: Take video or pictures as you repair a bike.
challenges.title: Repair a Bike

challenges.description: HVAC stands for Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning. Snap a photo or video of yourself keeping an HVAC system running smoothly and efficiently.
challenges.title: Maintain an HVAC System

challenges.description: Find a machine that isn't working properly and film a How-To as you fix it.
challenges.title: Repair a Sewing Machine

challenges.description: Learn about your particular machine and then open it up and try and fix it. Be sure to document it with video or pictures.
challenges.title: Fix a Washing Machine

challenges.description: Find an engine or motor that’s broke, troubleshoot the problem, and then film yourself while you fix it.
challenges.title: Repair an Engine or Motor

challenges.description: Build your own catapult or trebuchet and see what you can launch!
challenges.title: Build a Catapult or Trebuchet

challenges.description: Make use of the Six Simple Machines by combining them in creative, complicated, and comical ways to perform a simple task. You must have at least 5 different mechanisms. Capture your best run with a video.
challenges.title: Make a Rube Goldberg Machine

challenges.description: Simple machines are mechanisms that make it easier to control the direction or magnitude of a force. Build one of the six simple machines—lever, pulley, inclined plane, wedge, screw, and wheel and axle—and share a video of your machine in action.
challenges.title: Build  a Simple Machine

challenges.description: Build a vehicle, then record video that shows how it moves.
challenges.title: Build a Vehicle

challenges.description: Hydraulic devices use the flow of a liquid to make things move and perform simple tasks. Build a hydraulic device that moves, and share a video of your final creation.
challenges.title: Build a Hydraulic Device

challenges.description: The Stirling engine is known as an external combustion engine because the creation of heat happens on the outside. Record a video of your engine spinning.
challenges.title: Build a Stirling Engine

challenges.description: Using cardboard or paper, make a 3D gear that actually works. Show how your finished gear spins with a video.
challenges.title: Design and Make a Gear

challenges.description: Use Tinkercad , 123D or another CAD program, and model something you use everyday. Take a screenshot of your finished model.
challenges.title: Model an Object in CAD

challenges.description: Once you've made a few gears of various sizes, you can link together together and experiment with the outcomes. Linking together gears can change the direction of the input as well as increase or decrease the speed of rotation.
challenges.title: Create a Gear Ratio

challenges.description: When it comes to robotics, many disciplines bring their knowledge and skills to the table. Mechanical Engineers are tasked with all of the moving parts in a Robotic Device. Motors, joints, hydraulics and gears are some of the parts used in building such a device.
challenges.title: Build a Robotic Device

challenges.description: Often times, mechanical devices are so beautiful in their designs that they are considered works of art. Many kinetic artists blend mechanical engineering with other skills in order to produce machines that are mesmerizing.
challenges.title: Make a  Kinetic Machine

challenges.description: Put together a kit with bandages and medicine, and find a container to carry it all.
challenges.title: Assemble a First Aid Kit

challenges.description: Document yourself checking a volunteer's vital signs, and record your measurements. Pulse, breathing, temperature and blood pressure are signs that tell if a patient is healthy.
challenges.title: Measure Vital Signs

challenges.description: Record yourself carefully bandaging a volunteer. Bandages provide support, help stop bleeding, and protect open wounds. If you don't have medical bandages, you can improvise with cloth, old t-shirts, even paper towels.
challenges.title: Bandage an Injury

challenges.description: Anytime you treat a condition by cutting or removing something without anesthetic, you are performing minor surgery.  Fruit and vegetables make excellent patients if injured humans aren't available--try removing a splinter from a tomato without squishing it.
challenges.title: Perform Minor Surgery

challenges.description: Medicine men, apothecaries, midwives, healers--humans have been mixing up natural medicines for thousands of years.  Research the condition you hope to treat and the ingredients you have to create a tea, salve, or tonic to bring your patients relief.
challenges.title: Make Medicine

challenges.description: Most people get hurt far from a hospital and need to travel to get medical help. Broken bones, strained muscles, and dislocated joints can all get worse if they are moved, so Medics practice creating splints and slings out of whatever materials are available.
challenges.title: Immobilize a Limb

challenges.description: Medics are constantly challenged by the need to treat problems they can't see.  A stethoscope allows Medics to investigate the body by listening to it.  Hearing heartbeats, analyzing breathing, and taking blood pressure are all made easier with a stethoscope.
challenges.title: Make a Stethoscope

challenges.description: To quickly diagnose and treat injuries, Medics must understand the different parts of the body and how they work.  Add to your knowledge by making a model of a joint, organ, or other body part.
challenges.title: Construct a Body Part

challenges.description: A single injury can affect dozens of the complex, interconnected parts of the body. Medics must understand how these parts work together so they can choose the best treatment. Construct a 2D or 3D model of one of the body systems to demonstrate your knowledge.
challenges.title: Construct a Body System

challenges.description: When a bandage isn't enough, Medics use small, precise stitches called sutures to close a wound.  Practice your suturing technique on fruit, a chicken leg, or a hot dog.  If you can't find a suturing kit, a standard needle and thread will work as well.
challenges.title: Suture a Laceration

challenges.description: Do your version of this DIY meme – a 'Meme' is something funny that gets repeated.
challenges.title: Make a 'Doghands' Video

challenges.description: Make a MinecraftIRL (In Real Life) video – turn the game into reality!
challenges.title: Make a #MinecraftIRL Video

challenges.description: Remake a popular meme on DIY, such as Hand Surfing, Wolf on Turtle, or Anything But Cup.
challenges.title: Remake a Popular DIY Meme

challenges.description: Record a 5 second skit of you or your friends acting out the mundane or the hilarious. Use your time wisely to make something entertaining to watch!
challenges.title: Film a 5 Second Skit

challenges.description: Impact font over an image to create your very own meme! If you're uploading from the web, size your image to 960 x 640 so we can see your text.
challenges.title: Caption an Image

challenges.description: The web allows for an infinite canvas so style your comic in whichever way you want that makes it easy to read on the web.
challenges.title: Start a Webcomic

challenges.description: Stage a photo that captures a scene from a movie or something you think would be fun for others to recreate. The possibilities are endless!
challenges.title: Stage a Scene

challenges.description: Create a screen recording of you playing your favorite video game. Be sure to provide commentary as you navigate through different worlds.
challenges.title: Make a Let's Play Video

challenges.description: Create a commentary or spoof of your favorite media phenomenon.
challenges.title: Film a Spoof Video

challenges.description: Manipulate an image in Photoshop, GIMP, or in a mobile app to create a far out picture that makes the mundane seem extraordinary.
challenges.title: Alter an Image

challenges.description: Write a short script and create a voiceover for your favorite clip from the internet, a video of your dog, or even a music video.
challenges.title: Voiceover a Clip

challenges.description: Compose an original song, remake a video, or film yourself doing something hilarious.  Create something that you think others will enjoy and try!
challenges.title: Film a Video Meme

challenges.description: Showcase your personality, talents, or interests by creating a web series.
challenges.title: Create a Web Series

challenges.description: Make a barometer that shows the changes in atmospheric pressure. Scientists and sailors use these to predict changes in the weather.
challenges.title: Make a Barometer

challenges.description: Measure how fast the air is moving by building an anemometer. Show it in action with a video.
challenges.title: Measure Wind Speed

challenges.description: Collect rainwater and make a rain gauge to measure how much rain falls in your area.
challenges.title: Measure Rainfall

challenges.description: The atmosphere can hold a lot of moisture before it condenses and falls to the ground as rain.  Measure the relative humidity of the air with a hygrometer.
challenges.title: Measure Humidity

challenges.description: Meteorologists use maps to display data gathered by instruments in the field to create animations or pictures that show us how weather changes move and behave. Find an existing weather map and draw it, or find weather data and plot it yourself on a map.
challenges.title: Make a Weather Map

challenges.description: The temperature of the atmosphere is one of the first measurements meteorologists make, and they use a thermometer to gather their data. Making one is easier than you would think, and it's something that's practical and useful all the time.
challenges.title: Make a Thermometer

challenges.description: From dust devils in the desert to hurricanes over the ocean, meteorologists study vortexes to learn more about what causes them and how they operate.  Predicting these dangerous storms has saved thousands of lives.
challenges.title: Make a Vortex

challenges.description: Nor'easter?  So'wester?  Build a wind vane or windsock to measure the direction of the wind and find out!
challenges.title: Measure Wind Direction

challenges.description: It's a cat!  It's an elephant!  It's suspended water vapor condensing around particles in the air!  Study how different clouds form in a plastic bottle and up in the sky.
challenges.title: Make a Cloud

challenges.description: Rub your hair with a balloon, and the same static electricity that makes lightning will make your hair stand on end.  These bursts of electricity can make the air nearly 6 times hotter than the surface of the sun! Try and film your lightning in action.
challenges.title: Make Lightning

challenges.description: Weather stations measure  temperature, pressure in the atmosphere, as well as rain, wind and humidity. Build a weather station that includes devices to measure all of these things. Share what each device is called in a video.
challenges.title: Make a Weather Station

challenges.description: You can measure temperature, pressure, and humidity in the upper atmosphere by attaching your instrument to a simple weather balloon. Video your launch.
challenges.title: Launch a Weather Balloon

challenges.description: Every Minecrafter starts with their first night, and their first shelter. Post a screenshot of your shelter to complete this challenge.
challenges.title: Survive Your First Night

challenges.description: Use Minecraft to make 2D or 3D art in any style you want. Share a photo or screenshot of your final artwork.
challenges.title: Make Art in Minecraft

challenges.description: Making your own character skin is a great way to customize the game and stand out on any server. Go nuts! Upload a shot of your skin in the editor or a screenshot of your skin in-game. (Don't upload a skin you didn't make yourself!)
challenges.title: Create a Minecraft Skin

challenges.description: A note block is a special block that produces a single musical note when hit or triggered by redstone. Build a circuit with at least 10 note blocks, and share a video showing your blocks playing their tune.
challenges.title: Play a Tune with Note Blocks

challenges.description: Find a public server or a group of friends to play with, and get online! Post a shot of yourself on a server to complete this challenge.
challenges.title: Join a Minecraft Server

challenges.description: Using Redstone powers, you can build not just by hand, but with electronic logic in Minecraft. Post a video of your Redstone contraption in action.
challenges.title: Create a Redstone Contraption

challenges.description: Once the first night is over, Minecrafters inevitably move on to build their dream home. Every epic base needs a food supply and a place to store your stuff, but the rest is up to you.
challenges.title: Build an Epic Base

challenges.description: Post a video of your trap successfully pranking someone to complete this challenge.
challenges.title: Create a Trap

challenges.description: Make Minecraft stuff IRL (in real life).
challenges.title: Make Minecraft Papercraft

challenges.description: Unfortunately you can't play Minecraft 24/7, because you have to eat, right. Not to worry – you can eat Minecraft too!
challenges.title: Make Minecraft Food

challenges.description: Minecraft has 2 bosses: Ender Dragon and Wither. They're insanely hard to beat, but will reward you greatly. Post a shot of the loot you collect after slaying them in a normal Survival game.
challenges.title: Defeat a Boss

challenges.description: Mods add extra functionality to the game. Post a shot of your favorite mod running.
challenges.title: Install a Mod

challenges.description: The Minecraft world is a vast, infinite land. Walking is simply too slow sometimes. Thankfully, you can build rails!
challenges.title: Build a Rail System

challenges.description: To play with your friends on Minecraft, you need to have a server. You can join a public server, or make your own!
challenges.title: Host a Minecraft Server

challenges.description: Choose a well-known building, monument, or sculpture, and replicate it in Minecraft. The bigger and more detailed, the better! Share a picture or a video tour of your creation once it's complete.
challenges.title: Recreate a Famous Monument

challenges.description: Record an awesome video within Minecraft. Genre ideas: comedy, suspense, timelapse building, narrated adventure...
challenges.title: Make a Minecraft Video

challenges.description: Texture packs are used to change the way Minecraft looks. You can make your environment look realistic, create a themed world, or design something entirely new. Share a shot of your homemade texture pack in-game. (Don't post one you didn't make yourself!)
challenges.title: Make a Custom Texture Pack

challenges.description: You can essentially build your own themed game worlds inside Minecraft, called adventure maps.
challenges.title: Create an Adventure Map

challenges.description: Mods change the way the game is played. Use code, decompiling tools like Minecraft Coder Pack, or a mod generator to create your own custom Minecraft mod. Explain how it works and how you made it in a video or in the comments of your project.
challenges.title: Create a Minecraft Mod

challenges.description: Upload a video of yourself playing any instrument.
challenges.title: Play an Instrument

challenges.description: Upload a video of yourself performing an original song that you wrote.
challenges.title: Write and Perform a Song

challenges.description: Play a scale that you've learned or write a new one. Some scales have 5 notes, some have 47!  It's all up to the person that makes it.
challenges.title: Play some Scales

challenges.description: Music is way more fun when you're playing with your best friends! The best bands and groups are the ones where everyone has something different to bring to it. Shoot a video of your music group in action.
challenges.title: Form a Music Group

challenges.description: Sing anything to enjoy the fun of making music with your voice.
challenges.title: Sing a Song

challenges.description: Often the best music comes to a Musician note-for-note on the spot, while they're playing. They use their intuition to make up the song as they go!
challenges.title: Improvise Music

challenges.description: There are a bunch of awesome ways to make music with your mouth, besides just singing and rapping. You can make beats, whistles, or crazy noises and you don't need anything but yourself!
challenges.title: Make Mouth Music

challenges.description: Performing in front of complete strangers is every musician's rite of passage.  Perform a free outdoor concert and make a recording or video.
challenges.title: Perform Street Music

challenges.description: Some of the earliest computers were actually musical instruments, called "player pianos."  Now, most Musicians use computer software to synthesize sounds, arrange samples, and compose songs. Upload a video with sound to share your music with the community.
challenges.title: Make Computer Music

challenges.description: Most songs you've heard have been produced by recording each instrument and vocal part separately. Then each track is layered and mixed to create the right balance and effect. Make a multi-track recording to complete this Challenge!
challenges.title: Record and Mix Multiple Tracks

challenges.description: To be a good musician, you must always be listening. Train your ears to pick up the tones all around you. To complete this challenge, record a sound of something that stands out to you.
challenges.title: Listen!

challenges.description: As long as people have been playing music, they've been trying to think of ways to write it down and remember it.  While some musical languages are used all over the world, other types of music require their own special notation.
challenges.title: Read and Write Music Notation

challenges.description: Musicians find pitches in everything they hear.  Use a found or homemade instrument to play a song that you know, or improvise a new one.
challenges.title: Play Music on an Improvised Instrument

challenges.description: There are traditional techniques for playing instruments, and then there are innovations on those techniques.  Figure out how to play your instrument in a totally new way, or learn from someone else who is doing something fun.
challenges.title: Experiment with Musical Technique

challenges.description: Interfaces allow a Musician to trigger sounds in a computer or analog synthesizer. Invent a musical interface that allows for a new kind of expression.
challenges.title: Design an Interface

challenges.description: Find a mushroom online or in real life, then draw and label the parts. Knowing these helps to identify different species.
challenges.title: Draw and Label a Mushroom

challenges.description: Find a place that mushrooms grow and take a picture or video. Mushrooms like damp, shady spots – they wait underground or in rotten wood for rain to help them pop out.
challenges.title: Find a Mushroom Habitat

challenges.description: Get yourself a good mushroom guide and ID a mushroom. Be careful – some are so poisonous that they can make you extremely sick, or worse.
challenges.title: Identify a Mushroom

challenges.description: Once you've found mushrooms and you know they’re safe to eat, it's time to harvest! A basket is always a good harvest companion, as is a sharp knife. Don't be greedy! Only harvest what you and your friends can eat. Leave some for the other mushroom hunters!
challenges.title: Harvest Wild Mushrooms

challenges.description: Spore prints are great for helping you figure out what mushroom you have, collecting spores to propagate, or just for some cool artwork to hang on your wall! Take a picture of your spore print along with the mushroom that made it.
challenges.title: Perform a Spore Print

challenges.description: Natural dyes come from roots, berries, leaves, lichens, and fungi! By mixing mushrooms with certain color inducers, such as ammonia or salt water, you can achieve some really vibrant colors. Dye a piece of fabric and explain the process with a How-To.
challenges.title: Dye Clothes With Fungi

challenges.description: Kombucha is a fermented tea made from a Symbiotic Colony Of Bacteria and Yeast, or SCOBY. Get a kombucha culture from a friend or the internet, or make your own, and then get to fermenting!
challenges.title: Make Kombucha

challenges.description: If you don't live in a place where wild mushrooms are rampant, why not grow your own? You can buy a kit online or put one together yourself. Whatever method you decide on, be sure to take pictures as you go along, creating a timelapse of the growth.
challenges.title: Grow Your Own Mushrooms

challenges.description: Mycelium look a lot like fuzzy spiderwebs. They are the vegetative part of a fungus. You can grow mycelium on an agar plate, cardboard, or coffee grounds. Once it's fully started you can transfer it to another medium to grow even more, such as a log or spawn bag.
challenges.title: Make a Mycelium Starter

challenges.description: Mycelium that is ready start growing is called spawn. You can make your own or buy it online in plug form. Once acquired, it will need something to feed on in order to grow. Wet logs, coffee grounds and damp grains and straw make great hosts.
challenges.title: Inoculate with Spawn

challenges.description: Fungi doesn’t just mean mushrooms. Mycologists worldwide are finding innovative uses for fungi to make the world a better and healthier place. Get inspired and do something creative with fungi!
challenges.title: Experiment with Fungi

challenges.description: Make a collection of at least 3 different seashells - include labels if you can identify them.
challenges.title: Start a Seashell Collection

challenges.description: Set up your own aquarium at home to observe underwater life up close.
challenges.title: Set Up an Aquarium

challenges.description: Study exotic sea creatures, then create your own. Much of the ocean still remains a mystery to be discovered!
challenges.title: Make a Fantasy Sea Creature

challenges.description: Some of the most diverse life in the ocean lives on the border between land and sea.  Explore this ecosystem and document what you find.
challenges.title: Study Intertidal Zones

challenges.description: Oceanographers use buoys for many things, from navigational markers to data gathering tools.  Whether they are anchored or free-floating, they need sturdy construction to withstand the wind and waves. Show your buoy floating in water.
challenges.title: Build a Buoy

challenges.description: The ocean floor has mountains taller than Mt. Everest, trenches deeper than the Grand Canyon, ocean currents are interconnected across the world. Study the ocean and make a map or model of it.
challenges.title: Make an Ocean Map

challenges.description: Capturing the beauty of an underwater world can be a challenge--the water, lighting, and your subject all need to be just right.  Whether it's in the ocean or the kitchen sink, the key to successful underwater photos is practice.
challenges.title: Take Photographs Underwater

challenges.description: A Cartesian diver demonstrates the principles of buoyancy that allow fish, scuba divers, and submarines to float at different depths. Show your diver in action by recording a video.
challenges.title: Make a Cartesian Diver

challenges.description: Oceanographers need special vessels to keep themselves and their equipement safe during voyages to the deepest parts of the ocean. Build a submarine that can actually go under water. Capture it with a video.
challenges.title: Build a Submarine

challenges.description: The ocean is full of energy!  While individual water molecules usually don't move very far, their combined force as a wave can be beautiful...or devastating.
challenges.title: Make Waves

challenges.description: Remotely operated vehicles (ROV) help oceanographers study parts of the ocean that are too dark, too cold, or too deep for human divers. Build a real underwater ROV, and take a video showing how you control it while it's underneath water.
challenges.title: Build an Underwater ROV

challenges.description: Keep your sensitive camera equipment safe on your diving expeditions by building a waterproof case.
challenges.title: Build a Waterproof Camera Case

challenges.description: The ocean is highly affected by trash and chemicals that we put in it, as well as the many fish we take for food. Get to know the ocean's populations so you can eat the right fish. Find out what you can do to protect the ocean from contamination.
challenges.title: Protect the Oceans

challenges.description: Many people use Github.com to create projects, aka "repos", and make them open source. This way everyone can benefit from the work. Join Github.com and create and edit your first repo!
challenges.title: Create a Repo on GitHub

challenges.description: To contribute to a project you'll need to first fork (aka copy) the project files to your GitHub account. Fork DIY's open-sourcerer repo and upload a screenshot of it from your GitHub page.
challenges.title: Fork a Repo on GitHub

challenges.description: Git allows you to keep track of changes you make with files. Once you have a GitHub account, install Git on your computer. Upload a screenshot of your Git version in Bash, which you'll learn how to use, too!
challenges.title: Install Git and use Bash

challenges.description: Bash makes it easy to to copy files to your computer. Use Bash to copy files from a forked repo so that you can edit them on your computer. Upload a screenshot of your successful clone in Bash.
challenges.title: Clone your Fork in Bash

challenges.description: When you've changed a file locally, you'll want to push those changes to the servers at Github.com. Use Bash to push your local changes to your fork on Github.com. Take a screenshot of Bash when the push goes through.
challenges.title: Push Changes in Bash

challenges.description: When you make improvements to someone's repo, you want to submit the changes for them to incorporate into the original file. Submit a pull request to DIY's open-sourcerer repo and upload a screenshot of it.
challenges.title: Submit a Pull Request on GitHub

challenges.description: If you find a bug or have a suggestion for a project, you can submit an issue report so that the creator will be alerted to the issue.
challenges.title: Issue Report on Github.com

challenges.description: You might be surprised to learn that some familiar things are open source. Learn about open source projects and upload a screenshot of one you've heard of but didn't know was open source.
challenges.title: Find Open Source Projects

challenges.description: Pick your favorite bird and copy its call in a video.
challenges.title: Mimic a Bird Call

challenges.description: Some birds have very distinctive colors and patterns in their plumage. Find a loose feather in the wild, and try to identify the bird it came from. Share a pic of your feather and ID the bird in the title.
challenges.title: Identify a Bird Feather

challenges.description: Build a bird feeder to attract birds.
challenges.title: Build a Bird Feeder

challenges.description: Find or buy yourself an owl pellet and dissect it. Share a picture or a video that shows all of the cool stuff you find inside.
challenges.title: Dissect an Owl Pellet

challenges.description: Grab a telescopic lens and a camera and snap a zoomed photo or video of a bird. Share the photo you took and a picture of your camera setup.
challenges.title: Photograph a Bird with a High-Power Lens

challenges.description: Build a bird call that sounds like a real bird. Shoot a video as you call some birds.
challenges.title: Build a Bird Caller

challenges.description: Build a birdhouse. Keep in mind that the house's dimensions will play a role in what kinds of birds will live there.
challenges.title: Construct a Birdhouse

challenges.description: Identify a bird by its size, shape, color, plumage and call. Take a picture or video of the bird in the wild and correctly name it in the title of your project.
challenges.title: Identify a Bird

challenges.description: Create a local bird guide book that includes at least five birds.
challenges.title: Create a Bird Guide Book

challenges.description: Pick a bird in your area and accurately draw it. Name the bird and label at least 5 features, focusing on the distinctive ones.
challenges.title: Draw and Label a Bird

challenges.description: If you see a bird in trouble – don't touch the animal! Your scent might cause it to be rejected by the mother. Call the Wildlife Rescue in your town and document the event.
challenges.title: Rescue a Bird

challenges.description: Learning how to handle or restrain raptors and other large birds of prey is an important skill for every ornithologist. Make sure to watch out for the talons! Share a picture of you handling a bird of prey.
challenges.title: Handle a Bird of Prey

challenges.description: Go on a guided bird walk or interview a real ornithologist. Share everything with a video.
challenges.title: Talk to an Expert

challenges.description: Build a motion detector birdcam from scratch or put together a kit and capture pics of video of birds.
challenges.title: Build a Motion Detector Birdcam

challenges.description: The first step to becoming a great painter is understanding how to combine paint to make the colors you need. Use your favorite paint to create a color wheel, and make sure to label the primary, secondary, and tertiary colors!
challenges.title: Paint a Color Wheel

challenges.description: Make art using acrylic paints. This is a versatile paint that can go on thick or thin, and sticks to most anything.
challenges.title: Paint with Acrylics

challenges.description: Make a painting using watercolors. Build layers slowly, letting each layer dry, then detail last with a fine-tipped brush.
challenges.title: Paint with Watercolors

challenges.description: Paint a creature character from a favorite story, or one you made up. Include realistic details to make it seem real!
challenges.title: Paint a Fantasy Creature

challenges.description: Study a face and you will find many variations of skin tone. Some are more blue, some are red, some are almost grey. One more useful tip – the way the head sits on the neck and shoulders, the posture of a subject, is important in making a good likeness.
challenges.title: Paint a Portrait

challenges.description: A landscape can be painted from imagination or photos. Or you can take your brushes and materials outside and paint from life. This is called 'plein air' painting. It can help your understanding of light. You will see nature in new ways.
challenges.title: Paint a Landscape

challenges.description: Do a painting of a small collection of objects – food, plants, anything. You may find when placing objects that they look better from certain angles. Experiment with light sources to get the right light and shadow before you start to paint.
challenges.title: Make a Still Life Painting

challenges.description: Stop and look around – almost any object can be customized using a paintbrush or a stencil. Cleaning, sanding, and priming your surface will help paint stick. After your paint is dry, spraying or painting on a clear finish will help protect it.
challenges.title: Make a New Paintjob

challenges.description: Your choice of technique says a lot about your personality. Are you dark and gloomy, loud and bold, or soft and delicate? Painters must choose their angle, their colors, lighting, surface texture, even how realistic or cartoonish – try a style and see how it fits.
challenges.title: Try Various Painting Styles

challenges.description: A stencil is a cutout shape, either a positive or negative, that can be used as a mask to paint around. It can be a challenge making your stencil one piece that can lift away easily, but the nice thing is they can be used many times.
challenges.title: Paint with Stencils

challenges.description: A mural breaks up the mundane surfaces around us and adds color and life to a place. Murals take a while to make, so special care should be taken to make sure that your surface is primed and suitable to paint on. When you start, it helps to have a clear plan.
challenges.title: Paint a Mural

challenges.description: Paleontologists use fossils and data to predict what creatures looked like millions of years ago. These animals ranged from tiny rodents to gigantic undersea monsters! Design your own creature—think about what it ate, where it lived, and how it avoided enemies.
challenges.title: Invent a Prehistoric Creature

challenges.description: Fossils can be found in many places: sedimentary rocks (sandstone, limestone or shale), quarries, riverbeds and more. Carefully dig or sieve to find a few of your own, and share your finds with a photo or video. Make sure to get permission before taking them home!
challenges.title: Dig for Fossils

challenges.description: 3D models help paleontologists understand how prehistoric creatures looked and moved. Use a kit or your favorite building material to create a dinosaur or its skeleton. Make sure to include the name of the dinosaur and the period it's from in the comments!
challenges.title: Make a Dinosaur Model

challenges.description: A geologic timeline combines time and stratigraphy (the dirt/rock layers in the earth) to track the entire history of Earth. Draw a geologic timeline and label each eon, era, and period. (Bonus points if you draw the creatures that lived in each time!)
challenges.title: Draw a Geologic Timeline

challenges.description: Paleontologists use a collection of special tools to find and clean fossils. Find something to store your tools in and assemble a kit: recommended tools include a rock pick, chisels, tweezers, dust brushes, and a field journal to document your discoveries!
challenges.title: Assemble a Fossil Hunting Kit

challenges.description: There are many types of fossils that formed from prehistoric animal body parts or traces (like footprints and poop), plants, and much more. Share a photo or video of a fossil you've found. Identify what it is, where it came from, and any other cool info you know.
challenges.title: Identify a Fossil

challenges.description: There are some species of animals, insects, and plants that still exist today that are nearly identical to species found in fossils from millions of years ago. Research one of these species—called "living fossils"— and share what you learn in a video.
challenges.title: Research a Living Fossil

challenges.description: Paleontologists examine fossils and remains constantly to learn about their history. Start a collection of fossils that you've found yourself or bought. Show off at least three (3) fossils, and try to ID them by name and period if you can!
challenges.title: Start a Fossil Collection

challenges.description: Paleontologists use sifters (or "shaker boxes" or "sieves") to separate delicate fossils and old relics from rocks. They range from big and sturdy to small mesh boxes. Try building your own sifter and see what you can find in the dirt!
challenges.title: Build a Sifter

challenges.description: Fossilization is a complex process where plant and animal matter is buried and preserved over millions of years. In a video, animation, or model, explain how the process of fossilization works.
challenges.title: Explain Fossilization

challenges.description: There are many active paleontological dig sites throughout the world where new discoveries are made every year. Visit or take a tour of a professional dig site to see a day in the life of professional paleontologists.
challenges.title: Visit a Real Dig Site

challenges.description: The best way to learn about being a paleontologist is by meeting one! Share a short video or a picture of you interviewing a professional paleontologist. (Ask them about the coolest thing they've ever found!)
challenges.title: Interview a Paleontologist

challenges.description: Make a paper airplane soar. The secret is to build, test fly, then redesign, and build again – until you reach your personal best. Post a video of your best plane in flight.
challenges.title: Make and Fly a Paper Airplane

challenges.description: Make a wondrous object by folding paper. Origami started over 400 years ago in Japan but has spread throughout the world.
challenges.title: Learn to Fold Origami

challenges.description: Use cardboard and paper to make an awesome costume.
challenges.title: Construct a Paper Costume

challenges.description: Make a model vehicle out of colorful paper that looks cool, or make one from strong cardboard that really rolls. Add a propulsion system to make a real racer!
challenges.title: Build a Paper Vehicle

challenges.description: Make a paper flying disc, throwing star, or windmill.
challenges.title: Make a Paper Spinner

challenges.description: Dioramas tell the stories of places and things. Think like a great set designer or stage maker and create a miniature scene with paper and other objects.
challenges.title: Construct a Paper Diorama

challenges.description: Weaving isn't just for fabrics. You can weave some really amazing things with paper including art, bags, and mats. Cut strips from newspaper, magazines, gum wrappers, and junk mail, and weave something beautiful.
challenges.title: Weave With Paper

challenges.description: You can create a paper creature from an ancient origami pattern, or just get a stack of paper and fold it, cut it, tape it, and glue it – the most important thing is make something that has personality and feels alive!
challenges.title: Make a Paper Character

challenges.description: A Pop Up is surprisingly simple to make. A single one can become a gift card, or you can glue them together back-to-back to make an adventure book. Learn the technique that makes books explode into 3d!
challenges.title: Make a Pop Up Book

challenges.description: You can make paper hats, bags, shoes, pouches, wallets, belts, ties, bracelets, rings, earrings, and hairbands!
challenges.title: Make a Paper Accessory

challenges.description: Once you've mastered single sheet origami, it's time to tackle Modular Origami. The techniques are similar but Modular Origami requires multiple sheets of paper for making a single item. The folds are simple enough, but it's the assembly that takes real patience.
challenges.title: Modularize Your Origami

challenges.description: People often think of cardboard as a weak building material. But you can turn it into something sturdy – It's all about good engineering, folding, and glueing.
challenges.title: Build a Strong Cardboard Structure

challenges.description: A mask can be used as a kind of language that expresses one's emotions.  It can also be used to pretend to be someone or something. Sometimes it encases the entire head as in the case of a helmet and sometimes it rests upon the face.
challenges.title: Make a Paper Mask

challenges.description: Paper comes in flat sheets, but it doesn't have to stay in 2D space. By bending, scoring, cutting and folding, you can create some spectacular looking sculptures.
challenges.title: Sculpt With Paper

challenges.description: Create buildings out of paper or cardboard. Architects like to work this way because it's so easy. Some of the greatest buildings actually started as paper!
challenges.title: Build Paper Architecture

challenges.description: Decoupage is when you glue paper to objects and then cover it with a sealant like Mod Podge. Find some cool paper, cut it out and then cleanly attach it to a drawer, table, ball or board.
challenges.title: Decoupage an Object

challenges.description: Paper comes from plant material or recycling old paper. You can make it, too – soak it, mash it, press it, then let it dry really well. You can also give normal paper a beautiful colored pattern by marbling or dyeing it.
challenges.title: Make Paper

challenges.description: Using wheatpaste and paper can be great for making light and sturdy sculptures, masks, and models. Wheat flour is used with strips of paper, layered onto a structural frame, often made of chicken wire or plastic.
challenges.title: Make a Paper Maché Model

challenges.description: Cut out and build a paper model from a pattern you find online, or make your own using programs like Pepakura Designer, Dunreeb Cutout or Ultimate Papercraft 3D.
challenges.title: Make Digital Papercraft

challenges.description: What is meaningful to you? Do you have any favorite quotes that let you make sense of the world? Make a quick video sharing your insights.
challenges.title: Share 30 Seconds of Wisdom

challenges.description: Use a graph or chart to visualize a funny fact or clever concept. You can do it by hand or use a computer to help you out. Post a pic when you're done.
challenges.title: Visualize a Concept

challenges.description: What makes you different from other people? What do you find beautiful, or true? Describe your aesthetic with a video.
challenges.title: Describe Your Aesthetic

challenges.description: Who's your favorite thinker? What did they think? Record a short video and tell us a little about your favorite philosopher and what they believed.
challenges.title: Describe the Views of Your Favorite Philosopher

challenges.description: Write your own Zen story (aka, a koan). Then record yourself as you read it out loud.
challenges.title: Write a Zen Story

challenges.description: An argument isn't a fight. Pick a topic (and a friend) and have an argument. Film the whole thing.
challenges.title: Have an Argument

challenges.description: How long can you go without things that keep you bound to material objects? Can you go a week without your phone? A month without TV? Give a video update after you've felt the effects.
challenges.title: Transcend Material Reality

challenges.description: Find a topic you find false and try and prove it wrong. Record yourself as you destroy the fallacy.
challenges.title: Destroy a Fallacy

challenges.description: What's the point of it all? Record a video as you explain the meaning of life.
challenges.title: Explain the Meaning of Life

challenges.description: Photograph something very small – six inches or less from your target. Many cameras have a 'macro' setting to help stay in focus at this distance.
challenges.title: Shoot a Closeup in Focus

challenges.description: Play with lighting, mood, and camera tricks to create a portrait. Faces of living beings only to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Shoot a Portrait

challenges.description: Find a beautiful outdoor landscape and try and capture it with your camera. No taking photos from behind windows or in your house. The best part of shooting landscapes is that you get to be outside.
challenges.title: Photograph a Landscape

challenges.description: Stage a photo that fools the viewer into thinking things are not what they are. No digital editing allowed!
challenges.title: Make Trick Photography

challenges.description: A macro photograph is an extreme close-up that makes small details look larger than life. Using a special lens or a homemade camera hack, take a sharp macro photo of an object, texture, or pattern.
challenges.title: Take a Macro Photo

challenges.description: Use materials like toys or plants to build an imaginary world. Your world can be anything—an alien planet, a mystical forest, a desert landscape—but it has to be something you've actually built. No Photoshop allowed!
challenges.title: Build a Fantasy World

challenges.description: A lot of the best photos are taken with diffused light. Diffusion means that the light from a bare light bulb passes through a thin, transparent material or bounces off of a white surface. Building a 'Soft Box' can help add a lot of beauty to your shots.
challenges.title: Make a Soft Box

challenges.description: The first cameras used no lenses and needed strong shadow and light to make pictures. Build a Camera Obscura or a Pinhole Camera to understand what a camera is – a box with a hole it.
challenges.title: Make a Camera Obscura

challenges.description: A camera can make a flying object look frozen in place! To reduce blur, you'll need a fast shutter speed and lots of light to maintain correct exposure. This isn't just about shooting a moving object in the air – your photo should also be sharp!
challenges.title: Freeze Movement with a Fast Shutter

challenges.description: Build a studio with the gear you need to take great pictures. If your picture seems dark, blurry or grainy – you need more light. Set up next to a sunny window – the sun is the strongest bulb you can get!
challenges.title: Build a Photo Studio

challenges.description: Because flashes make lots of light, they can help take crisp, clear photos. A lot of point-and-shoot cameras have a flash on the front – but it often looks too harsh. Use these tricks to make a flash photo with beautiful lighting.
challenges.title: Take a Custom Flash Photo

challenges.description: A camera mount helps you frame your shot, then leaves your hands free to adjust your lights and scenery before you take your picture. A steady mount will make your pictures their sharpest. The most common camera mount is a 3-legged tripod.
challenges.title: Make a Camera Mount

challenges.description: Adapt a cheap camera to take a wide angle or microscopic images. You don't need a fancy or expensive camera to take unusual and dynamic shots! Share a picture of your homemade lens and a photo you shot with it.
challenges.title: Make a Special Lens

challenges.description: A 3d photo is two photos of the same thing, taken at the same time, as far apart as your eyes. An easy way to take one is a cha-cha dance move – click-click! To see your 3d,  use special glasses, make a GIF, or put the 2 pictures side-by-side and cross your eyes.
challenges.title: Make a 3d Photo

challenges.description: Physicists discovered magnetic lodestones over 2500 years ago, and often use them for experiments. Conduct an experiment that demonstrates the strange properties of magnets, and share it with a video.
challenges.title: Experiment with Magnets

challenges.description: Create a device that stores potential energy, then converts it to kinetic energy. A fundamental law of Physics is that energy is never created or destroyed, only changed from one form to another.
challenges.title: Turn Potential Energy into Kinetic Energy

challenges.description: Study the the unique properties of light – how it travels, bends, and refracts. Light is the only type of electromagnetic radiation we can actually see.
challenges.title: Experiment with Light

challenges.description: All objects attract each other – the more massive the object, the stronger the attraction. This is the force of Gravity. Demonstrate how the biggest object in our lives, the Earth, is pulling us towards itself.
challenges.title: Experiment with Gravity

challenges.description: There are six simple machines that Physicists use to redistribute forces.  Rube Goldberg was famous for combining these in creative, complicated, and comical ways to perform a simple task.
challenges.title: Make a Rube Goldberg Machine

challenges.description: Demonstrate Newton's First Law of Motion – Inertia – by doing an impressive trick. Whether moving or staying still, objects like to keep doing what they're doing, unless some other force makes them stop. Share your video!
challenges.title: Demonstrate Inertia

challenges.description: A classic physics experiment is the Egg Drop: create a structure that will keep an egg from breaking even when it's tossed off the roof of a building.  Challenge yourself by using as few materials as possible.
challenges.title: Save an Egg From Certain Death

challenges.description: Electromagnets are magnetic only when an electric current is running through them, while fixed magnets are magnetic all the time.  An electric motor uses a combination of these to create a machine that spins.
challenges.title: Build an Electric Motor

challenges.description: Physicists used to think that levitating something with permanent magnets was impossible, but a toymaker proved them wrong with the Levitron.  Get ready--levitation requires extreme precision and patience!
challenges.title: Build a Magnetic Levitator

challenges.description: Incredibly, high-energy particles from the sun and other sources are bombarding Earth constantly; they're zooming through you right now!  These cosmic rays are too small to be seen, but you can trace their path through supercooled particles in a cloud chamber.
challenges.title: Make a Cosmic Ray Detector

challenges.description: Create a path in the woods or volunteer to maintain a trail. Pioneers often blaze their way through untraveled areas.
challenges.title: Blaze a Trail

challenges.description: Record yourself as you build and light your own fire outdoors.
challenges.title: Make a Bonfire

challenges.description: WARNING: BE ABSOLUTELY SURE BEFORE EATING ANYTHING GROWING IN THE WILD. For this challenge, identify a wild edible or medicinal food growing in your area. See the Forager skill for more about this topic.
challenges.title: Forage for Food

challenges.description: By canning or pickling your food, you can store enough tomatoes and cabbage to have home-grown vegetables all year. Grab some vegetables and canning jars and have a canning party! Take pictures or video to document the process.
challenges.title: Can or Pickle Your Food

challenges.description: Before refrigerators, people would store vegetables underground, where it always stays a cool 55˚ F. Find a suitable spot in your yard or basement and build a cellar for your carrots, beets, potatoes, apples, and hardy produce.
challenges.title: Build a Root Cellar

challenges.description: Pioneers made their own fabrics and baskets by weaving together fibers and thin strips of wood. Weave something useful and document the process.
challenges.title: Weave Something Useful

challenges.description: Pioneers made their soap using animal fats and lye leached from hardwood ashes. The exact same ingredients can be used today, or you can experiment with various oils such as olive and coconut.
challenges.title: Make Soap

challenges.description: Ropemaking is a valuable skill for any pioneer. Use natural stuff (like grass or dead plants) or recycled materials (like plastic bags) to weave a homemade rope.
challenges.title: Make Rope

challenges.description: By carefully observing the land and taking notes of landmarks and measurements, Pioneers created maps to find their way around new areas. Find a bit of land you're not familiar with and create a map.
challenges.title: Map Unexplored Territory

challenges.description: Pioneers cut down trees for lots of reasons — for firewood and logs for building, or just to clear a path. Proper technique is required to easily and safely fell a tree.
challenges.title: Fell a Tree

challenges.description: Drying food means removing its moisture content. This decreases the chances of bacteria growing inside the food, which in turn prolongs its life. Use the sun or a dehydrator and dry food of your own.
challenges.title: Dry Your Food

challenges.description: Before indoor plumbing, people used outhouses. A basic outhouse is just a hole in the ground, but more "modern" outhouses turn your waste into compost. Find a spot that speaks to you and build one!
challenges.title: Build an Outhouse

challenges.description: Fuel can mean a lot of things. Wood for a fire, propane for a stove, or kerosene for a heater. Show how you collect, store and use your fuel by taking pictures or video and describe how you use it.
challenges.title: Manage Your Fuel

challenges.description: Tools can be anything that you use to make common tasks easier and more efficient. Pioneers made their own axes, knives, and hunting equipment from things they found in their surroundings.
challenges.title: Make Tools

challenges.description: Tanning a hide makes the leather last longer. Tannin, which is an acidic chemical, is used in the tanning process. Find an animal hide and tan it, then turn it into something durable and useful.
challenges.title: Tan a Hide

challenges.description: Building a cabin is the epitome of pioneering. A good cabin doesn't need to be large, just strong and able to keep out wind, water and animals. Build a small dwelling space to hunker down in.
challenges.title: Build a Cabin

challenges.description: Make a pot by squeezing the walls up until you get a bowl shape. Try to maintain an even thickness.
challenges.title: Make a Pinch Pot
