challenges.description: Apply a glaze to your ceramic pottery – then fire it. This adds beautiful color and seals your work.
challenges.title: Glaze a Clay Project

challenges.description: Make a pot using stacked ropes of clay. These rope patterns can be blended together to a smooth finish.
challenges.title: Make a Coil Pot

challenges.description: Making clay can be fun, and it's cheaper than the store bought stuff. Ceramic clay can be made by digging in your backyard if you have the right soil. You can also mix together things from your kitchen cupboard to make Salt Dough.
challenges.title: Make Your Own Clay

challenges.description: Throwing a pot doesn't mean chucking it across the room. It's the term used for making a bowl or vase on a potter's wheel. This wheel spins very quickly while the clay is pushed and pulled into shape. Potter's wheels can be motor powered or human powered.
challenges.title: Throw a Pot on a Wheel

challenges.description: When you fire a clay pot, a transformation happens.  The clay goes from a soft, fragile substance to one which is hard and lasts for millennia. In order to make this transformation happen, the clay must be exposed to tremendous amounts of heat.
challenges.title: Fire a Clay Piece

challenges.description: Many of the techniques of the Potter require just the right tool. Fortunately, many of these tools are very simple to make. You can build a set of tools from common materials on the cheap, such as a Slab, Wire, Block, or Loop
challenges.title: Make Pottery Tools

challenges.description: Kilns can be electric, gas or wood powered. If you don't have access to one, you can build your own. Wood fired is the cheapest, but gas powered is easier to control. Get your parents for this. Fire is deadly and ceramics can explode when heated!
challenges.title: Build a Kiln

challenges.description: Throwing a pot is impossible without a potter's wheel. You'll probably need to go to a pottery studio to do it – or you can make your own! Salvage an old motor and make an electric powered wheel, or create one that is human powered. Share with a video.
challenges.title: Make a Potter's Wheel

challenges.description: To complete this challenge, record yourself reciting the sacred Prankster's Oath in serious Prankster style.
challenges.title: Follow the Prankster's Code

challenges.description: Create a physical sign, label or ticket to prank others. Share a picture of your sign hung up somewhere. (Bonus points if you get a video of someone being fooled!)
challenges.title: Make a Fake Sign

challenges.description: Drop fake bird poop on a new car, dog poop on the front porch, spilled coffee on important documents!
challenges.title: Fake Something Gross

challenges.description: Few things are more unsettling to well-mannered people than the sound of passing gas, especially in public where it might be considered awkward or impolite to mention certain strange noises.  As with all pranks, choose your victims wisely!
challenges.title: Give a Bronx Cheer

challenges.description: The "bait and switch" is a gag that is at the heart of hundreds of classic pranks--fool your victim into thinking one thing, then suddenly surprise them with something else.  If your victim laughs when they discover the switch, you know you've done it right!
challenges.title: Pull a Bait and Switch

challenges.description: Messing with food is a classic Prankster move. From an Oreo filled with toothpaste to mashed potatoes in an ice cream cone, nothing is more surprising than an unexpected taste!  Capture your prank and your victim's reaction with a video.
challenges.title: Prank Someone's Food

challenges.description: It takes a long time to wrap a desk in tin foil or cover a car in Post-Its, but Pranksters are ready for that.  They're also ready with a video camera to capture their victim's reactions when they see the masterpiece!
challenges.title: Pull a Wrapping Prank

challenges.description: Getting from one place to another is a simple and important part of everyone's day.  So what do you do when you find your classroom covered in cups of water, or your doorway blocked by phonebooks?  Look around for a mischievous Prankster, or course!
challenges.title: Obstruct a Walkway

challenges.description: Startling someone takes a surprising amount of finesse. A Prankster needs stealth, set up, and good timing to have something or someone jump out at just the right moment.  The result of the perfectly startling prank?  A hilarious video to watch again and again.
challenges.title: Startle Someone

challenges.description: Unsuspecting people won't think twice about accepting information they see on the Internet, so it might not be that hard to convince your victims that your fake webpage is real.  What might be difficult is keeping a straight face!
challenges.title: Make a Fake Webpage

challenges.description: When it comes to a memorable prank, sometimes bigger is better.  Gather a group of people together to pull off a production you couldn't do alone.  Organizing groups takes time, effort, and planning, but the results are always worth it!
challenges.title: Do a Group Prank

challenges.description: Make a stamp pattern by carving rubber, wood, or even a potato.
challenges.title: Make a Stamp

challenges.description: Make a relief print by cutting material out of a block, usually wood or linoleum. You can also use styrofoam and a pencil.
challenges.title: Make a Relief Print

challenges.description: Do a screen print on a T-shirt or any other fabric. This can be done with photo emulsion or even Mod Podge.
challenges.title: Make a Screen Print

challenges.description: Monoprints are made by painting smooth glass or plastic – or even fish – then pressing down hard with paper or fabric to absorb the design. 'Mono' means 'one' or 'single'. Each print is unique, sometimes only one can be made!
challenges.title: Create a Monoprint

challenges.description: Scratchboard uses the same technique as etching. Completely cover a piece of paper with black paint, then scratch it off with a sharp tool as if you were drawing. You can color the paper before you start with a rainbow of crayon, or add watercolor afterwards.
challenges.title: Create Scratchboard Art

challenges.description: Lithography means “stone drawing". Traditionally, the surface of a stone slab is prepared, then paint is rolled on and clings only to the chosen spots. A DIY version of this process can be done at home using tin foil, vinegar, and oil.
challenges.title: Make a Lithography Print

challenges.description: Engravers carve metal plates with a sharp tool called a burin, fill those grooves with ink, then run it through a press, transferring ink to paper. Do a home version of this with a ball point pen and a styrofoam plate. Look at a dollar bill – it was engraved!
challenges.title: Create an Engraving

challenges.description: Use the Sun's light to make a print. The most popular type of sun print is a cyanotype. Take a video showing the process and a pic of your print.
challenges.title: Print Using the Sun

challenges.description: Etchings are made by using a sharp tool to draw on an acid resistant coated plate. Once the drawing is complete, the plate is submerged in an acid bath. The acid eats away at the metal where the plate is scratched, which creates grooves that hold ink for printing.
challenges.title: Make an Etching

challenges.description: Ages ago, Letterpresses were used to mass produce books and newspapers. Every character was set one at a time by hand, inked up on a press and printed one page at a time.  Nowadays, Letterpress printing is a form of artistic expression.
challenges.title: Use a Letterpress

challenges.description: Embossing is usually done by sandwiching a piece of material against a hard surface, forcing it into the grooves and creating a raised image. There are also variations that can be done by hand with an embossing needle, or other round-tipped tool.
challenges.title: Create an Embossment

challenges.description: A good Printmaker doesn't rely on skills alone – They also need the proper tools. While some tools are hard to make, or expensive, there are others that can be produced in your home. Figure out your options – get building!
challenges.title: Build Printmaking Tools

challenges.description: Turn your hand into an awesome puppet. Painted or covered with fabric – your hand can be the star of the show!
challenges.title: Make a Hand Puppet

challenges.description: Use your hands, paper, or other materials to create a shadow puppet show. Share a video of your performance!
challenges.title: Perform a Shadow Puppet Show

challenges.description: To complete this challenge, develop 5 different voices for one of your puppets, then upload a video.
challenges.title: Develop a Voice for Your Puppet

challenges.description: With the marionette, the puppeteer controls the puppets with strings and wires. These puppets can be as simple as a handkerchief. Or they be several stories tall and require a team of puppeteers to move. For this challenge, make and operate a marionette.
challenges.title: Create a Marionette

challenges.description: Rods are used when the puppeteer wishes to disappear completely from sight. They give the puppeteer extra distance from the character, adding to the illusion of a puppet having a life of its own.
challenges.title: Make a Rod Puppet

challenges.description: Your puppet will come alive if you build scenery. Make a world for your puppet to live in, whether it's a traditional puppet theater or a movie set.
challenges.title: Make a Puppet Stage

challenges.description: A style made famous by the Muppets are a soft foam body and round Pac Man-shaped mouth. With these puppets, the puppeteer uses one hand to control the puppet’s mouth and the other to move the puppets hands by a rod or glove.
challenges.title: Create a Muppet-Style Puppet

challenges.description: The ventriloquist is a magician of the mouth. While keeping her lips still, she can make her puppets speak. Bring your puppets to life by learning the art of ventrilocism.
challenges.title: Become a Ventriloquist

challenges.description: Pull out your camera and your favorite puppets. Create some scenery, draft a script, and film an extraordinary puppet movie. You can start small by creating a music video for a favorite song. Or aim for the stars and shoot a full-length feature.
challenges.title: Make a Movie with your Puppets

challenges.description: To make stop motion puppets, add a bendable skeleton inside, or use flexible clay. The puppeteer moves the character, little by little, then steps out of frame to take a picture. When a series of pictures plays back, the puppet springs to life!
challenges.title: Make a Stop Motion Puppet

challenges.description: Think you can make a puppet that’s bigger than you? How about one that’s bigger than your house? How about one that you wear? Create the biggest puppet you can, or the illusion of one...
challenges.title: Make a Giant Puppet

challenges.description: Record your ramblings and adventures to make a story from your life. Or make a first-person movie with a plot and characters and special effects.
challenges.title: Make an Adventure Story

challenges.description: Secure a camera to the end of a pole and you have an instant crane rig that shows an amazing perspective.
challenges.title: Make a Pole Cam

challenges.description: Only submit for this challenge if your footage was shot with a mounted camera on the bike or rider. (DANGER! Do not try to hold the camera with your hands while you ride - that is stupid and you'll get hurt.)
challenges.title: Shoot Footage from a Bike

challenges.description: Shoot footage while riding a skateboard, snowboard, skis, surfboard, skimboard, wakeboard, rollerblades, a derby car, or a sled. No segways.
challenges.title: Ride and Record

challenges.description: There is a whole other world beneath the surface of water. Go there! Bring back the magic.
challenges.title: Shoot Underwater

challenges.description: Wear a cam all day. Edit together the most interesting moments into a single, short video that shows one day in your life.
challenges.title: Share a Day of Your Life

challenges.description: Mount your camera to a kite, remote-controlled UAV, or a balloon, and capture a bird's eye view.
challenges.title: Shoot Aerial Cinematography

challenges.description: Shoot epic timelapse with your GoPro.
challenges.title: Shoot Wide-Angle Timelapse

challenges.description: Design your own toy or sculpture or part using CAD. (CAD) means using Computer-Aided Design to make things.
challenges.title: Design an Object with CAD

challenges.description: Print your model using a website like Ponoko, Shapeways, or Printo3d. Some libraries and schools also now have 3d printers you can use!
challenges.title: Print Something in 3D

challenges.description: Make a printout with the help of an inkjet printer – then cut it out by hand.
challenges.title: Print and Cut a 3d Pattern

challenges.description: Surface Contour, Isometric, or Multi View are all ways of drawing that help show the dimensions of an object. They are used in 3d design a lot. Drawing this way will help you to grasp it, too.
challenges.title: Draw 3d Form

challenges.description: Computer Numerical Control (CNC) machines like laser cutters and CNC routers turn computer design into real objects by cutting or removing material. Some of these machine are even showing up in homes and hackerspaces.
challenges.title: Make Cutout Objects with a Machine

challenges.description: Fabbing, or digital fabrication, means making a three dimensional objects from a sketch or model. Take a design you want to see in the real world and build it using fabbing techniques. Repair, customize, make something never seen before!
challenges.title: Fab a Custom Part

challenges.description: No one machine can do everything – you need different ones for different tasks. Usually, once you've gotten a few together and found a good place for them – you won't want to move them. You've built a Fab Lab - a Fabrication Laboratory.
challenges.title: Set Up a Fab Lab

challenges.description: 3D scanners transform real objects into 3d models. Using either still photos or even stereo imaging hardware like the Kinect, 3D scanners can make the process of generating 3D models much more efficient.
challenges.title: 3D Scan an Object

challenges.description: One of the craziest things about rapid prototyping is that a 3d printer can print more 3d printers! It's the Robot Revolution! Build your own rapid prototyping machine and start making.
challenges.title: Build a Rapid Prototyping Machine

challenges.description: Find a cheap RC toy and hack it to make it do something cool. Share your hack with a video.
challenges.title: Hack an RC Toy

challenges.description: Use an RC simulator, or use a trainer cable with an old pro as they teach you how to properly fly or drive your RC vehicle. Whatever way you practice, take a video to share the learning process.
challenges.title: Develop Steady Controls

challenges.description: Attach a camera to your RC vehicle and take everyone on a video tour of your house, yard, school or park.
challenges.title: Make a Video Tour

challenges.description: Build an obstacle course with at least three obstacles for your RC car, plane or boat. Take a video as you dip, weave and dodge your way to the finish line. Challenge a friend to beat your time if you're game.
challenges.title: Navigate an Obstacle Course

challenges.description: If you're building an RC vehicle from scratch, you're going to need to solder together your motor, ESC and battery. Take a video showing how you solder any or all of these things, or how you repair a soldered joint when it breaks after a hard crash.
challenges.title: Solder Your System

challenges.description: Servo motors are how you steer your RC vehicle. Take a video explaining how you mount and wire your servos.
challenges.title: Hook Up Servos

challenges.description: Build an RC vehicle that rides on land. You can build it from scratch or from a kit. Ready-to-run vehicles don't count. Your land vehicle is complete when it's ready to drive. Take a video of your initial run.
challenges.title: Build a Land Vehicle

challenges.description: Build an RC vehicle glides effortlessly on water. You can build it from scratch or from a kit. Ready-to-run boats don't count.  Your water vehicle is complete when it's ready to drive. Take a video of your initial run.
challenges.title: Build a Water Vehicle

challenges.description: Build an airplane, helicopter, or quadcopter.  You can build it from scratch or from a kit. Ready-to-run flyers don't count.  Your flyer is complete when it's ready for flight. Take a video of your initial run.
challenges.title: Build a Flyer

challenges.description: Use an Arduino and a Wii controller, cell phone, or other other wireless device, and turn it into a radio controller for your RC car or flyer. Show off your hack with a video.
challenges.title: Hack a Device to Control Your RC Vehicle

challenges.description: The only thing better than finding your new favorite book is sharing it with other people. In a video, review your all-time favorite book and explain what makes it so great.
challenges.title: Share Your Favorite Book

challenges.description: The Oxford English Dictionary contains over 600,000 different definitions, but more are added each year as the language changes and grows. Choose or invent a word that you think is missing from the dictionary, and define it.
challenges.title: Invent a New Word

challenges.description: Find detailed descriptions of your favorite characters from a book or short story and illustrate them. Share your drawings and the descriptions that inspired them.
challenges.title: Sketch Book Characters

challenges.description: Every avid reader needs a place to call home. Find a comfortable or quiet space, fill it with pillows, grab a cup of tea, and get reading! Show  off your nook with a photo or even better, a video tour.
challenges.title: Build a Nook

challenges.description: Not every book is a winner. Choose a book that you didn't like and use specific examples and evidence explaining why it didn't work for you in a video. Remember, don't be a jerk in your review. Just because you didn't like it doesn't mean others don't!
challenges.title: Critique a Book

challenges.description: Make a colorful illustration, collage, or digital design of the books on your ideal bookshelf. Include your favorites and the ones that have been the most important to you. Upload a clear picture of your final illustration.
challenges.title: Illustrate Your Ideal Book Collection

challenges.description: Censorship is when a book has to be removed from a library due to its content. In the USA, hundreds of books have been banned from schools and libraries. Check out some of the videos explaining censorship, then explain your opinion on the concept of banning books.
challenges.title: Share Your Opinion on Censorship

challenges.description: Some of the most delicious food ever imagined only exists in writing. Find a detailed description of a snack or a meal in a story and create your own version of it. (Fandom-themed food doesn't count!)
challenges.title: Make a Fictional Food

challenges.description: Fantastic creatures of all shapes and sizes exist in literature. Pick a fantasy creature from any piece of writing and recreate it in 3D using clay, papier-mâché, or any other material of your choice. Don't forget to post the name of the creature and the book!
challenges.title: Build a 3D Literary Creature

challenges.description: Readers can condense even the most complex stories into quick and enjoyable summaries. Speak, act, sing, animate or anything else that helps you condense a book's plot into a 30-second video.
challenges.title: Retell a Book in 30 Seconds

challenges.description: A graphic novel is a story that is created in comic-strip format and presented as a book. In a video, share a review of a graphic novel you enjoyed. Make sure to show off the art style! (Comic books and comic collections don't count!)
challenges.title: Review a Graphic Novel

challenges.description: Cosplay is a great way to meet other fans and walk in the shoes (literally!) of your favorite book characters. Create a homemade cosplay costume, and take pictures of how you put it together. Share your process and a shot of you wearing your finished outfit.
challenges.title: Cosplay a Literary Character

challenges.description: A book club is a group that gathers to discuss different books together. All you need are some friends, some snacks, and a book or two! Form your own club or join an existing one. Share a picture from a meeting and a list of the books your club has discussed.
challenges.title: Join a Book Club

challenges.description: If movies can have advertisements, so can books! Choose a story you think everyone should read and create a short video that advertises it to others.
challenges.title: Create a Book Trailer

challenges.description: A Little Free Library is a "give a book, take a book" box in a public space where friends and neighbors can share their favorite stories with each other. Build and decorate your box, fill it with books, and share a picture of your library in its new home.
challenges.title: Build a Free Little Library

challenges.description: Interviewing a writer is a great way to learn about your favorite stories, find new ones, and get inspired to make your own. If you can't find someone to interview, dress up as your favorite author and answer your questions in their place. Share a video.
challenges.title: Interview an Author

challenges.description: Readers know that sometimes the best way to understand a story is to act it out themselves. Pick a scene from any book and reenact it in a video. For bonus points, add sound effects.
challenges.title: Reenact A Scene

challenges.description: Build a rocket into a wheeled vehicle or a water craft.
challenges.title: Build a Rocket Vehicle

challenges.description: Build and launch a passive air rocket. This is a passive system because air is not stored in a pressure vessel.
challenges.title: Build a Passive Air Rocket

challenges.description: Make an air cannon that launches objects from a tube. Snap a video of your projectile sailing through the air
challenges.title: Build an Air Cannon

challenges.description: We've all seen what happens when you add Mentos to Diet Coke, but have you done it? What's going on? It's a process called nucleation, which, oddly, is a physical reaction, not a chemical reaction.
challenges.title: Build a Nucleation Reactor

challenges.description: There are tons of awesome Model Rocket Kits that you can put together and customize. They typically use single stage solid fuel engines, which are swapped out after each use.
challenges.title: Assemble a Model Rocket Kit

challenges.description: 5 launching caution tips: 1.Keep a distance  2.Don't launch in high winds  3.Cap the end of the launch rod so it doesn't stab you  4.Use a blast deflector to protect ground  5.Use a launch pad.  6.Discharge your alligator clips before connecting to the fuse.
challenges.title: Launch a Model Rocket

challenges.description: Water Rockets use H2O as a reaction mass and, typically, a plastic bottle as a pressure vessel. A gas must be used to pressure it, for example, compressed air.
challenges.title: Build a Water Rocket

challenges.description: Storing up air in a pressure vessel then releasing it all at once is the technique behind Compressed Air Rockets. Bike pumps or pneumatic compressors can be used to generate the airflow and a valve must be used to control and release it.
challenges.title: Build a Compressed Air Rocket

challenges.description: Its incredibly easy to strap a (relatively) cheap "keychain camera" to the side of your rocket to capture some incredible aerial footage.
challenges.title: Shoot Aerial Footage on a Rocket Cam

challenges.description: You can build solid fuel rocket engines with household materials. Sugar Rockets use powdered sugar as fuel and potassium nitrate (KNO3) as an oxidizer. This stuff is super dangerous though, so don't be an idiot and get some help from an adult.
challenges.title: Build a Solid Fuel Engine

challenges.description: Your rocket might not survive an epic fall from hundreds of feet in the sky. Model Rocket Kits come with parachutes, but if you've built your own rocket, you may want to build a parachute with a release mechanism!
challenges.title: Build a Parachute Capsule

challenges.description: Go outside and show us what direction the wind is blowing. Weathervanes, windsocks, flags and bows of boats on moorings all tell sailors where the wind is coming from.
challenges.title: Find the Wind

challenges.description: Tie four types of knots. The figure eight, square, cleat and bowline knots are all commonly used on boats.
challenges.title: Tie Four Basic Knots

challenges.description: Upload a video of yourself singing a chantey. A chantey is a type of work song sung that was sung on ships.
challenges.title: Sing a Chantey

challenges.description: A marlinspike is metal tool that is often used in the arts of rope work, which is also known as marlinspike seamanship. Use a marlinspike to whip, splice or tie a piece of line into a monkey's fist knot.
challenges.title: Use a Marlinspike

challenges.description: Flags are used to send different kinds of messages. Design and sew your own burgee. Draw your DIY nickname in signal flags. Or, upload a video using semaphore to encrypt a message to your fellow DIYers.
challenges.title: Send A Message with Flags

challenges.description: Before hitting the high seas, it's helpful to know the parts of the boat, as well as get comfortable preparing your vessel for sailing. Help someone else learn the ropes by filming a tutorial or writing a How To on rigging a sailboat.
challenges.title: Create a Rigging Tutorial

challenges.description: Knowing the different kinds of rigs and hull styles allows you to articulately describe or visualize a particular sailing vessel. Take us to your nearest marina and tell us about the boats around you. Or, draw and label your ideal boat.
challenges.title: Identify Different Types of Sailboats

challenges.description: Cast off the bow, cast off the stern! Go sailing! Upload a photo or video of yourself at sea.
challenges.title: Go Sailing

challenges.description: Practicing man overboard and capsize drills in a controlled environment prepares a sailor for when something goes wrong. Document your efforts and share!
challenges.title: Practice Man Overboard and Capsize Drills

challenges.description: If you want to up your game, US Sailing, Tall Ships America, International Sailing Federation and Sailors for the Sea are great resources for getting more involved with sailing.
challenges.title: Join a Club

challenges.description: Using a nautical map called a chart, a compass and a ruler one can determine a boat's latitude and longitude. Show us the direction you're headed on a compass or record and share your route progress on a chart.
challenges.title: Navigate with a Chart

challenges.description: While racing, sailors focus on wind shifts, course directions, start sequences and as well as playing by the rules. No matter if you win or loose, remember that, "Yachting is the winner."  Show us a video of part of the race or tell us about a lesson learned.
challenges.title: Race in a Regatta

challenges.description: From watching dinghy sailing in the Olympics, to the winged catamarans competing in the America's Cup, following competitive sailing is more accessible and more exciting than ever.
challenges.title: Attend a Professional Yacht Race

challenges.description: Look around you – use anything to build something awesome!
challenges.title: Make a Toy from Junk

challenges.description: Turn junk into something useful using your ingenuity.
challenges.title: Transform Scrap into Something Useful

challenges.description: Use recycled objects to build a brand new game or your version of a classic.
challenges.title: Make a Game from Scrap

challenges.description: Transform natural materials or scraps into a beautiful sculpture, collage, or installation.
challenges.title: Make Art from Found Materials

challenges.description: Scrap Yards, Flea Markets, Swap Meets, Pawn Shops, Garage Sales, and Thrift Stores are great places to find epic deals on unique stuff, or to get rid of stuff you don't need. Take a picture or video of something you picked up at a place like this.
challenges.title: Swap, Barter or Buy

challenges.description: Salvage valuable materials or collect something just because you like the way it looks. In order to find it all again you'll have to get organized!
challenges.title: Make a Collection

challenges.description: There are thousands of items out there, ready for the taking. The only problem is finding them. Luckily, the internet makes easy work of it. Sites like freecycle and craigslist make it possible to search for free items as well as get rid of stuff you already have.
challenges.title: Use the Internet to Find Free Treasure

challenges.description: There is a way to make things without using any human materials at all. Make a beautiful arrangement of natural materials and take a photo before the weather washes it away.
challenges.title: Make Land Art

challenges.description: It takes a lot of confidence to say what someone else calls trash is valuable to you. Your reward – free stuff! Remember, saving materials from being wasted is a noble task.
challenges.title: Go Scavenging for Free Stuff

challenges.description: A table is just a sturdy plank with some legs on it. A chair is the very same thing but with a back. Find an object that would look great as a table, chair, desk or shelf – then build it out.
challenges.title: Make Junk into Furniture

challenges.description: Sometimes something old just needs some tender loving care (TLC) to be like new again. Restore an old bike or furniture – there's hidden treasures waiting to be brought back from the dead!
challenges.title: Restore Something Old to be New Again

challenges.description: Animating a sprite is the process of making a character repeatedly change "costumes," resulting in an animation. Make a sprite that dances, jumps, or any other animation you can imagine. Share a link to your project in the comments.
challenges.title: Animate a Sprite

challenges.description: Making a sprite follow your mouse cursor is a great way to design your first game. Build a script that points a sprite towards your mouse-pointer or another sprite. Share a screenshot and a link to your finished project in the comments.
challenges.title: Follow The Mouse

challenges.description: Any project posted on Scratch can be remixed into something new. On the program page, click on "See Inside" and then click the "Remix" button to get started. Share a screenshot and link to your remixed project in the comments. Don't forget to credit the original!
challenges.title: Remix A Program

challenges.description: Create your own superhero and create a program that shows off your hero's superpowers. Share with a screenshot and by posting a link to your project in the comments.
challenges.title: Invent a Superhero

challenges.description: What’s cooler than playing a video game? Making your own game! You could make an adventure game, sports game, word game, role playing game (RPG), or any other kind of game you can imagine. Share your game by posting a link.
challenges.title: Make an Interactive Game

challenges.description: A character maker is a program that has a basic character and a ton of different accessories that can be used to dress up or change the way that character looks. Create your own sprites and build a character maker. Share a link in the comments.
challenges.title: Design a Character Maker

challenges.description: Using blocks with a "random" operator, you can build a program that generates a different result every time. Design an art generator that makes lines, dots, splotches, or anything else.  Upload a screenshot and link to your program in the comments.
challenges.title: Build a Random Art Generator

challenges.description: Create a musical instrument that others can use. You can use notes, clips from songs, or even random sounds to build your instrument. Upload a screenshot and share a link to your program in the comments.
challenges.title: Make a Musical Instrument

challenges.description: Scratch has more than 100 programming blocks. To challenge yourself, make a program that uses only the following 10 blocks: go to, glide, say, show, hide, set size, play sound, wait, when sprite clicked, and repeat. Post a link to your project in the comments.
challenges.title: Do the 10 Block Challenge

challenges.description: Create an animation that tells a story. It can be anything: the plot of a movie, book, or even be something that has actually happened to you. Use multiple characters and dialogue to tell your tale. Post a link in the comments.
challenges.title: Animate a Story

challenges.description: Make an animated music video for a song you like. Create your own animated sprites and backgrounds for your program, and share a link to your finished animation in the comments.
challenges.title: Animate a Music Video

challenges.description: Just by connecting a few blocks, you can create functional programs to that count, alphabetize, draw, and more! Build a tool that helps you solve a real problem or makes a task easier, and share a link in the comments.
challenges.title: Make a Usable Tool

challenges.description: Share what you know by making a program that teaches a skill or knowledge to others. You can make a lesson about how to use Scratch or pick a specific project or subject you want to teach. Upload a screenshot and share a link to your program in the comments.
challenges.title: Teach with Scratch

challenges.description: "Blocks" are the puzzle pieces that make up Scratch. There are plenty of default blocks to use, but advanced users can create their own in the "More Blocks" section of the editor. Create a custom block and use it in a program. Share a link to what you've made.
challenges.title: Create a Custom Block

challenges.description: Did you know you can control Scratch with a banana? Using your webcam, a Makey Makey, or any other hardware of your choice, create a program that interacts with real-world things. Share your final project with a video and a link to your program in the comments.
challenges.title: Connect to the Physical World

challenges.description: Make a sculpture out of Polymer Clay. This is a great material for small figures, charms or dolls.
challenges.title: Make a Polymer Clay Sculpt

challenges.description: Use clay to make your own action figure, doll, or statue.
challenges.title: Sculpt a Figure

challenges.description: Make a sculpture using water-based clay, also called Ceramic clay.
challenges.title: Make a Ceramic Clay Sculpture

challenges.description: Carving is subtracting material, bringing out a form inside a block of stone, bar of soap, hunk of foam, or piece of wood. If you use a sharp tool, be careful and cut away from yourself – you don't want to subtract your thumb!
challenges.title: Make a Carving

challenges.description: Oil Clay is often used for characters and designing cars. The harder clays allow for great detail, but you must work with heat. The soft kinds, like Plastecine, are good for animation. Make a mold if you want Oil Clay sculpts to last because they never dry out.
challenges.title: Make an Oil Clay Sculpture

challenges.description: Paper Clay is Paper Maché that is ground up very fine. Because It is cheap, light, and air-drying, it's great for costumes and large sculpts. Wet clay has a muddy feel that is bad for surface details, but it can be carved and sanded to a final finish once dry.
challenges.title: Make a Paper Clay Sculpt

challenges.description: If you want to transform one material into another, you must use a mold. A mold is a void, or hollow space, that you pour another material into to harden – like an ice cube tray. A mold can be made of hard plaster, or a soft sand, even flexible rubber!
challenges.title: Make a Mold

challenges.description: A casting is the positive form that comes from the hollow space in your mold. A very basic way to make a casting is to poke a hole in some clay and pour in some plaster. What comes out will be a copy of your finger!
challenges.title: Make a Casting

challenges.description: Glue, screw, and wire things together to make a sculpture. Become the master of connections. If something won't stick, try sanding it first with some rough sandpaper. A rough surface makes it easer for glue to stick.
challenges.title: Make a Found Object Sculpture

challenges.description: Your hands are the best tool, but a proper sculpting implement helps to achieve detail. Every material has its own toolset. A useful clay tool is a hard stick carved into a flattened point. A great plaster tool is a simple butter knife.
challenges.title: Make Sculpture Tools

challenges.description: Make a sculpture of a live person. It can be a hand stamped in the sand, a fist in clay, or a super detailed copy of yourself using rubber alginate.
challenges.title: Make a Life Casting

challenges.description: A final finish can make your sculpture look great or gross. Learn how to paint a sculpture well, then seal it with a finish to preserve it for the future. Coloring and protecting your sculpture from the elements is a world of its own.
challenges.title: Paint a Sculpture

challenges.description: Make a Mask or Head sculpt. A sculpture of someone from the shoulders up is called a bust. A good likeness has a lot to do with how a person's head sits on their shoulders. The head you make doesn't have to look like anyone though – you can make it really wild!
challenges.title: Sculpt a Head

challenges.description: Use a multimeter to test a sensor. Then upload photos or a video showing the high and low resistance values.
challenges.title: Test Your Sensor

challenges.description: Build a Line Following robot and shoot a video of it in action.
challenges.title: Make a Robot Follow a Line

challenges.description: Build a sensor that measures liquid content. This works because moisture changes the resistance between two metal contacts.
challenges.title: Make a Moisture Sensor

challenges.description: Pressure Sensors, Bend Sensors and Flex Sensors are essentially the same thing — resistors that change resistance based on how hard they are pushed, bent or flexed. Make one from scratch and take pictures along the way to create a How-To.
challenges.title: Construct a Pressure Sensor

challenges.description: Many Sensor projects require you to make a Voltage Divider circuit, which is just a circuit that divides voltage, usually across two resistors (or sensors). Build a simple Voltage Divider and measure the different voltage outputs with a multimeter.
challenges.title: Build a Voltage Divider

challenges.description: Musical Theremins create strange and out-of-this-world sounds. The examples here use a Photoresistor, aka Light Dependent Resistor (LDR). An LDR's resistance changes depending on how much light it "sees." Put one together and make some crazy music!
challenges.title: Build a Musical Theremin

challenges.description: Sensors are a great way to alert you of something, like an intruder. It's also a great way to surprise a passerby. Use a sensor and circuit to create an alarm or booby trap and shoot a video of it catching the unsuspecting perpetrator.
challenges.title: Surprise an Intruder

challenges.description: Once you've mastered sensors and their circuits, you're ready to combine that knowledge and transform your Body Into an Instrument. Make sure to document every step of the process with pictures and videos, and then create an epic music video!
challenges.title: Turn Your Body Into an Instrument

challenges.description: A sensor can be used to measure all manner of different things including temperature, light, vibrations... heck even air quality and your heartbeat! By connecting a sensor to the internet you can monitor it from anywhere and share it with your friends.
challenges.title: Connect a Sensor to the Internet

challenges.description: Remembering to water your garden can be a real pain. Why not hack together a circuit that can do it for you? Using a Moisture Sensor and some sweet microcontroller, rig up a watering system and shoot a video of it savings your garden from drought.
challenges.title: Automate Your Garden

challenges.description: Air Quality is hard to measure because you can't always see when air is dirty. That's where sensors come in. Put together some sensors that measure different particulates and see how clean the air is in your house, school, or city.
challenges.title: Monitor Air Quality

challenges.description: Build a small version of a house you want to build – a miniature is a great way to experiment.
challenges.title: Make a Scale Model

challenges.description: Gather logs and branches and build a shelter.
challenges.title: Build a Stick Fort

challenges.description: A Tipi can be tarps, canvas, even bedsheets. "Tipi" is the name used by the Great Plains Lakota for their cone shaped shelters.
challenges.title: Build a Tipi

challenges.description: Build a Battle Fort you can get inside. Make it strong, well guarded, defensible from all sides, with superior elevation, and with only one way in (but many ways out).
challenges.title: Build a Battle Fortress

challenges.description: A tarp might not be the most beautiful roof, but sometimes you just need a way to keep dry. You can make a quick A-frame tent with a rope and two trees, or get more serious with some hard supports.
challenges.title: Build a Waterproof Shelter

challenges.description: Snow is a great insulator, which means it can keep you warmer than you might think. Make a Quinzee by piling up a mound of snow and hollowing it out from inside, or a sturdy Igloo by making snow blocks and stacking them up.
challenges.title: Build a Snow Shelter

challenges.description: The beach can be a windy place – a perfect excuse for building a shelter. Use driftwood, sand, stone, and grass to make a hideout.
challenges.title: Build a Beach Shack

challenges.description: A tree fort can be anything from a platform you build a few feet off the ground – to a full-blown Swiss Family Robinson fortress. To make sure it's sturdy enough, you should get your parent to help you with basic structure.
challenges.title: Build a Treehouse

challenges.description: An Adventure Playground is a place built entirely by young people. Using scraps of wood and nails, these zones have sprouted up in cities all over the world. They often are built in the unwanted, undefined spaces that kids have claimed as their own.
challenges.title: Build an Adventure Playground

challenges.description: Make a sweet pair of sandals with great style, then upload a picture.
challenges.title: Make a Pair of Sandals

challenges.description: Draw a picture or make a simple model of your fantasy shoe.
challenges.title: Design Your Fantasy Shoe

challenges.description: Trick out an existing pair of shoes that need a fix. Learn a new way to tie your laces, give your shoes a new color, even alter their fit.
challenges.title: Trick Your Kicks!

challenges.description: Shoes can really take a beating, so why not make some that you can re-make or repair over and over? Sometimes a beloved pair is beaten beyond recognition--parts of them can be made into something totally new!
challenges.title: Make Some Recycled Shoes

challenges.description: A pattern is a shoemaker's blueprint--it translates the dimensions and curves of a design and ensures that the shoe fits the foot it's meant for.  Measure a foot and make a pattern for a shoe you'd like to make.
challenges.title: Make a Shoe Pattern

challenges.description: Even if you're making a shoe for your own foot, a model of its dimensions, called a "last", can make it a lot easier to put everything together.  Learn how to take the right measurements and mold or sculpt a last!
challenges.title: Mold a Shoe Last

challenges.description: Working with leather and other rugged shoe materials like canvas and rubber requires special tools and techniques.  Master a way of joining or shaping materials and take a picture.
challenges.title: Stitch, Skive, and Carve!

challenges.description: Once you know how shoes are made, it's much easier to re-make them when they fall apart.  Sometimes it only takes a bit of glue, some polish, or a few stitches, sometimes a massive reconstruction is required.
challenges.title: Repair Some Shoes

challenges.description: Shoes can be as simple or as complicated as you want them to be, but the most carefully constructed ones are built to last using age old techniques.  Make a pair of heirloom style shoes out of leather or canvas and share them with a video.
challenges.title: Build a Sturdy Pair of Shoes

challenges.description: Find a local skate park and get some footage of you on your skateboard.
challenges.title: Skate a Park

challenges.description: Use paints, markers, stickers, LEDs or whatever to trick out your board.
challenges.title: Customize Your Board

challenges.description: Show how you repair and service your skateboard.
challenges.title: Maintain Your Skateboard

challenges.description: Rails and curbs make great places to grind the trucks of your board. Make sure you're comfortable on your board and then give grinding a go. Take videos of all your attempts as well as when you finally get it.
challenges.title: Grind

challenges.description: Make a fingerboard and snap some video of your fingers doing tricks.
challenges.title: Fingerskate

challenges.description: Practice your ollie until it's second nature and upload a video of your best one. Ollies are the foundation of skateboarding.
challenges.title: Ollie

challenges.description: Most people ride regular, meaning left foot forward, but there are some among us that ride goofy, putting their right foot in the front. Good skaters can go back and forth between regular and goofy. Take a video showing how you can ride both.
challenges.title: Ride Switch

challenges.description: A kickflip is an ollie that rotates 360 degrees along its axis. Master your ollie before you attempt your kickflip. Take video of the learning process as well as your best kickflip.
challenges.title: Kickflip

challenges.description: A powerslide is to slow down or stop your board. This will definitely come in handy, especially if you're skating somewhere with a lot of traffic. Shoot a video of you sliding to slow or stop yourself.
challenges.title: Powerslide

challenges.description: Rails aren't just for grinding your trucks. You can also use them for slides. Whether you do a tail, nose or lip slide, be sure to take a video for all to see.
challenges.title: Slide

challenges.description: Doing an ollie over a gap is a great way to clear curbs, bushes, or anything else that's in your way. Have your ollie perfected on the ground before moving on to gap tricks. Snap video of your best gap ollie to share with everyone.
challenges.title: Ollie a Gap

challenges.description: Building your own skateboard is a great way to make something custom that fits you better than anything you can buy in a store. Take pictures and videos of your process as well as the final result. It doesn't count if you can't physically ride it.
challenges.title: Build a Skateboard

challenges.description: Using rails and boxes are a great way to practice your grinds in your backyard. With scavenged wood and a little ingenuity, build a structure where you and your friends can grind. Upload pictures and videos of the building process and the finished piece.
challenges.title: Build to Grind

challenges.description: Kicker ramps, quarter pipes and half pipes are all awesome for skateboarding. Gather a bunch of friends and supplies and build an epic ramp! Take as many pictures and videos as you can to show all the stages of the building process, from design to completion.
challenges.title: Build a Ramp

challenges.description: Once you have a ton of awesome skate footage, you're going to want to splice it together, add awesome music, and share it with everyone. Gather inspiration from great videos that already exist and then create your own!
challenges.title: Edit a Skate Video

challenges.description: Make your own basic solar cooker using a cardboard box and aluminum foil.
challenges.title: Build a Solar Cooker

challenges.description: Make a gadget that runs right off the sun's rays or charges up a battery for later use.
challenges.title: Create a Solar Powered Device

challenges.description: Why would you need a solar powered light if the Sun is shining? The trick is to capture and store the sun's energy in a battery. The captured energy will power the light when it gets dark.
challenges.title: Make a Solar Powered Light

challenges.description: Solar Powered Chargers are a fun way to charge your devices, especially when you're miles away from a power outlet. All you need is a cheap solar cell, a basic circuit, and the Sun. On a bright day you can be charged up in just a few hours.
challenges.title: Build a Solar Powered Charger

challenges.description: Solar concentrators use lenses or mirrors to focus sunlight into an extremely small point – the same way a magnifying glass does with the sun. This focused light is intensely hot and can be used to cook food, make electricity, or scorch things.
challenges.title: Make a Solar Concentrator

challenges.description: Draw or build a house design that uses the sun's energy to heat, cool, or ventilate.
challenges.title: Make a Solar House Design

challenges.description: While most modern solar cells are made with silicon, you can make your own using common objects. These cells won't be nearly as efficient as the store bought ones, but they give you some insight into how a solar cell works.
challenges.title: Make a Solar Electric Cell

challenges.description: Building a solar panel from cells that you salvage or buy is a great way to learn the technology. Of course, panels from the factory will cost you about as much as making one yourself – there's no beating factory efficiency, unless you've got a lot of time!
challenges.title: Make a Solar Electric Panel

challenges.description: One of the most common types of solar design in the world is for the purpose of heating water. Use 'passive' solar power to raise the temperature of water and save electricity normally used by a hot water heater.
challenges.title: Make a Solar Water Heater

challenges.description: Solar Dehydrators use the Sun’s energy to heat up air, which causes a chimney effect. As hot air is sucked through the dehydrator, it pulls away moisture in the food, thus drying it for storage. You can dry all types of foods, but fruits and vegetables dry best.
challenges.title: Make a Solar Dehydrator

challenges.description: A Photoresistor is a type of resistor that decreases its resistance when exposed to light. Don't let that dry definition fool you. Circuits using Photoresistors can be used to create things like light powered music boxes and laser tripwires.
challenges.title: Build a Circuit Using a Photoresistor

challenges.description: Millions of people become sick every year because they lack access to clean drinking water. While boiling contaminated water kills all the bacteria, it also uses large amounts of energy. Solar pasteurization is a free and safe way to obtain clean water.
challenges.title: Pasteurize Water Using the Sun

challenges.description: Make a puppet that lives – bring creatures to life!
challenges.title: Make an Effects Puppet

challenges.description: Make your own special effects prop for a costume or film.
challenges.title: Make a Prop

challenges.description: Change your face with fantasy makeup – anything from a thin layer of paint to a thick mask.
challenges.title: Apply Makeup

challenges.description: Some ideas in movies are just too big and expensive to make normal size. That's when artists are employed to make a miniature version of scenes – on camera they look full size! The challenge is to very carefully shrink things down to 1/2, 1/10 or even 1/100 scale.
challenges.title: Make a Scale Model

challenges.description: When you want something in your movie that is too precious, too heavy, or too delicate – make it from styrofoam, paper, or plastic instead and paint it to look real. Recreating the surface textures and colors of reality are your focus here.
challenges.title: Make a Fake Surface

challenges.description: Create a photo that shows cool special effects. Use staging techniques, makeup, costumes, or digital editing tricks to make a shot of something amazing, like a person levitating or holding a huge, heavy object.
challenges.title: Make a Special Effects Photo

challenges.description: FX is another word for Special Effects. These techniques are needed to create the impossible images seen in Horror, Fantasy, Science Fiction or Action movies. Using some combination of in-camera and digital tricks, make your own FX movie.
challenges.title: Make an Effects Movie

challenges.description: Make rain on a sunny day, create tears on an actor, or cause slime to leak from a monster. Liquids ooze, spill, squirt and dribble in ways that bring emotion out in your audience – learn to control them and transport your audience to another realm.
challenges.title: Make Liquid Effects

challenges.description: A camera is the eyes of your story. For a fairy tale, blurring your lens makes your image dreamy. In a horror movie, hiding what the audience wants to see makes it scarier. Wide lenses make big things look small, while macro lenses make small things large.
challenges.title: Use Camera Effects

challenges.description: The costume makes the hero, the villain, the monster, or the magician and tells everything about a character in one glance. Your character is a canvas ready to be painted – now fill your costume full of carefully crafted details.
challenges.title: Make a Costume

challenges.description: Most FX movies today use 3d animation. These projects are made by teams of highly trained artists – Modelers, Painters, and Animators all working together – but you can make your own simple animations right now, and get started on the path to learning 3d.
challenges.title: Make a 3d Animation

challenges.description: Learn the basics and get the feel. Put a needle and thread through a piece of fabric, then repeat.
challenges.title: Sew a Basic Stitch

challenges.description: Get your earned patches from the DIY Marketplace, and then stitch it on your backpack, hat, jacket, blanket - anything!
challenges.title: Stitch Your Patches

challenges.description: Use your sewing skills to make an awesome stuffed animal or pillow.
challenges.title: Stitch a Stuffed Animal or Pillow

challenges.description: You can add all kinds of changes to your clothes. Mod, fashion, and tailor them – make them more stylish, useful and comfortable.
challenges.title: Mod Your Clothing

challenges.description: It may seem complicated at first, but the time you spend learning to sew with a machine will soon be paid back as your stitches become faster, more accurate, and more sturdy.
challenges.title: Sew with a Machine

challenges.description: Hand operated Fabric Puppets can be incredibly entertaining and mysteriously alive. Use your sewing skills to invent a character with personality. Use felt to create something with the same texture as a Muppet.
challenges.title: Make a Fabric Puppet

challenges.description: Make a sweet looking bag to go on your back, bike, or waist.
challenges.title: Sew a Bag or Pouch

challenges.description: Grab some paper, a needle, and thread, and you'll have a homemade journal or sketchbook in no time. Take pictures of your process and your final book.
challenges.title: Sew a Book Binding

challenges.description: Put a patch on that hole in your jacket, or cover that old chair with new fabric. Time to restore a busted thing to beauty and style!
challenges.title: Stitch Something Busted

challenges.description: Say you just want stitch on your clothing, bag or a piece of fabric because it looks cool. When you sew a design with thread – that's Embroidery.
challenges.title: Embroider a Design

challenges.description: Quilting started hundreds of years ago as a folk tradition. Everyday materials sewn together with padding to make a cozy blanket – They can also be works of art!
challenges.title: Make a Quilt

challenges.description: In the future, we will all be Cyborgs! Just kidding, but we will probably wear electronics in our clothes. We're just beginning to discover uses for E-textiles – what new uses can you find?
challenges.title: Sew with Electronics

challenges.description: Grab some plastic sheets, a bit of soap, and a bunch of water and create a huge slip 'n slide. Take videos of the action.
challenges.title: Make a Slip 'n Slide

challenges.description: Create a device that hurls a water balloon further than you could ever throw it. Shoot a video of the launch.
challenges.title: Build a Water Balloon Launcher

challenges.description: Summer time is a great time to start a business. You can mow grass, deliver newspapers, babysit, or anything else to earn a few bucks.
challenges.title: Start a Summer Business

challenges.description: Water is a great way to cool off in the summer. Be sure you're mindful and try not to waste it.
challenges.title: Hack Your Water

challenges.description: FIll up some balloons or super soakers and challenge your friends to an epic water battle.
challenges.title: Stage a Water Fight

challenges.description: Build a fire pit and enjoy it's warmth or cook food over it.
challenges.title: Build a Fire Pit

challenges.description: Plant something that grows well in Summer. Add a description of the plant your project's title.
challenges.title: Grow Summer Plants

challenges.description: Sand is the perfect medium for castles and sculptures. Take a video or picture of the finished creation.
challenges.title: Sculpt with Sand

challenges.description: Build a tree swing, rope swing, porch swing, tire swing, swing chair or a swing set.
challenges.title: Build a Swing

challenges.description: Build a raft big enough to hold you and strong enough to keep you afloat.
challenges.title: Build a Raft

challenges.description: Get away for a few days or for a few weeks and have a blast at summer camp.
challenges.title: Go to Summer Camp

challenges.description: Grab a pole and some bait and catch a few whoppers. Be sure to tell us about the one that got away.
challenges.title: Go Fishing

challenges.description: A good barbecue is a great way to bring together awesome people to share some awesome food.
challenges.title: Host a Barbecue

challenges.description: Camp, bike, raft or hike your way to a summer adventure.
challenges.title: Take a Summer Adventure

challenges.description: Grab a board and hop on a wave. Share a picture or video of all the action.
challenges.title: Ride a Wave

challenges.description: Create an ORIGINAL project and give it a hashtag. It can be a new fan hashtag on DIY or you can contribute to an existing hashtag like #harrypotter or #adventuretime. Take a screenshot of the project you created with that hashtag.
challenges.title: Contribute to a Hashtag

challenges.description: What if you combined Harry Potter with Lord of the Rings? Adventure Time with Star Wars? Create an illustration, video or figurine that combines two characters from your favorite books, movies or TV shows.
challenges.title: Create a Crossover

challenges.description: Cheering is a great way to get the players as well as the other fans energized. Share your best cheer with a video, or better yet, provide some footage showing how you get others amped by attending a live game or event.
challenges.title: Cheer

challenges.description: Give a rousing 2–minute video summary of your favorite book, movie, TV show or sports team. Be sure to mention plot, characters and players, and why you think it's so dang cool.
challenges.title: Explain Your Fandom

challenges.description: Pennants are triangular flags that commemorate your favorite team. Paper is cool for a prototype, but your final design should be made from fabric, like felt, so it last a long time.
challenges.title: Make a Pennant

challenges.description: Most teams have a fight song that the fans can sing before a game. Sing your favorite team's song, or make one up and sing it.
challenges.title: Sing a Team Song

challenges.description: Fan art is any visual or musical art that is made to pay homage to your favorite character or make believe world. Bust out the paintbrushes, or tune your guitar, and create something that brings your fandom to life.
challenges.title: Do Fan Art

challenges.description: With fan fiction (aka, fanfic), you can rewrite or make up a whole story involving the characters or realm of your favorite fandom. Create a comic, or write a story. If you write something, post the text using Justepaste.it or read it aloud and record it.
challenges.title: Write Fan Fiction

challenges.description: When you're a fan of something, you tend to collect a ton of memorabilia. Share a video or photo showing off all of the cool stuff you've collected or made!
challenges.title: Show Off Your Collection

challenges.description: The next time you're at a stadium, start a wave! It just takes a few people to get it started, but in order for it to look really cool you need at least 100 people participating.  Make a video of the whole thing.
challenges.title: Start a Wave

challenges.description: Harry Potter is full of props. So is Doctor Who. Pick your favorite and build it from scratch. No boring sticks as wands, and no store-bought props. Get creative with your prop and share it with a video or some crisp and clear pictures.
challenges.title: Make a Prop

challenges.description: Make a tasty treat inspired by your favorite book, movie or video game. No store bought, ready-made cakes. This thing needs to be made from scratch. Snap some photos, or, better yet, make a video describing your process.
challenges.title: Make Fan Food

challenges.description: Make a funny video reenacting a scene from your fandom or create your own scene using your favorite characters.
challenges.title: Spoof Your Fandom

challenges.description: Making a cosplay costume is your chance to be any character from your favorite book, TV show, movie, or video game. Show how you made your costume with a series of pictures, or explain how you made it with a video.
challenges.title: Build a Cosplay Costume

challenges.description: Blogs are a great way to share all your thoughts about your favorite fandom. You can also post amazing pictures you've found or things you've made. Post three things to your blog, then take a screenshot and share a link to it in the comments.
challenges.title: Make a Fandom Blog

challenges.description: There are many standard definitions of surrealism, but what is surrealism to you? Why do you think it's important? Make a 30 second video explanation.
challenges.title: Define Surrealism

challenges.description: Exquisite Corpse is a multiplayer game in which a player draws something, then covers most of their work, leaving a small amount for the next player to draw off of. Upload a photo or video of your completed exquisite corpse collaboration.
challenges.title: Play Exquisite Corpse

challenges.description: Distort reality and create fantasy by altering a real photograph. Add drawings or combine pieces of photos together to create a masterpiece.
challenges.title: Make an Impossible Photograph

challenges.description: A visual pun is a play on words using images. Edit photos together, draw your own, or take a photo from the real word that creates a pun. Submit a photo and write your pun in the title of your post.
challenges.title: Create a Visual Pun

challenges.description: Using a page from an old book or writing from a magazine, compose a poem entirely from found words. Share your found poem with an picture or read it aloud in a video.
challenges.title: Make Found Poetry

challenges.description: Have you ever thought about living in a world with dragonflies the size of humans? An entire world made of chocolate? Paint, draw, or sculpt your surrealist world and put up a photo or a video guiding us through it.
challenges.title: Design a Civilization

challenges.description: Dreams are crazy combinations of ideas and emotions that surrealists often try to capture and understand. Use drawings, a photo montage, or a video to visualize your dream.
challenges.title: Draw Your Dream

challenges.description: Surrealist works are often full of weird surprises and total nonsense, but all of it means something. Make a video and explain your interpretation of a piece of surrealist artwork: What do you think it means? How does it make you feel?
challenges.title: Analyse Artwork

challenges.description: A virtual machine is like a computer inside your computer. Set up a VM with Ubuntu, an open source operating system, so that you can learn the Sys Admin ropes without affecting anything on your normal computer! Upload a screenshot of your VM!
challenges.title: Set up a Virtual Machine with Ubuntu

challenges.description: Sys Admins are at home on the command line. Use Bash to get the latest Ubuntu updates and upgrade for your VM. Take a screenshot of your Terminal window with the successful update to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Fetch Ubuntu Updates

challenges.description: As a Sys Admin you'll want to check to make sure your server or networks are running smoothly. htop is an application that shows you just what's using up your computer's power. Upload a screenshot of htop running on your Ubuntu VM to complete the challenge!
challenges.title: Check Processes with htop

challenges.description: Sys Admin's use firewalls to protect their server and network from outside requests. Not all requests are bad, though - complete this challenge by learning which are ok and which aren't and set up a firewall on your VM. Take a screenshot of the firewall status.
challenges.title: Lockdown Server with Firewall

challenges.description: Shell scripts are programs for your system. Sys Admin's are awesome at automating common tasks. Get started with a simple shell script and take a screenshot of it completed!
challenges.title: Write a Shell Script

challenges.description: A really useful shell script is one that backs up important files. Follow the DIY intro on writing and executing this script to backup a folder in your Ubuntu VM. Upload a screenshot of your .tgz file to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Backup Files with a Shell Script

challenges.description: Setting your script to run automatically is called a cron and is the next level of awesome in Sys Admin. Have your backup shell script run everyday - on its own! To complete the challenge, upload a screenshot of your crontab file.
challenges.title: Create a Cron Job

challenges.description: Sys Admin's often also manage the web servers hosting their organization's site. Learn to install a package from source and write a simple server in Node.js. Take a screenshot of your server running locally to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Set up a Web Server

challenges.description: Find your favorite color and pattern of tape, then construct a sweet wallet.
challenges.title: Construct a Tape Wallet

challenges.description: Create something stylish and creative for an outfit, like a tape hat or rolled tape bracelet.
challenges.title: Accessorize with Tape

challenges.description: Make a tape bag with your favorite colors – stylish, easy to repair, and waterproof!
challenges.title: Construct a Tape Bag

challenges.description: Tape shoes are a quick, simple and stylish solution to provide your feet with a bit of protection. Create a pair of sandals for the beach or make waterproof boots for those rainy days. Feel free to use something sturdy for the sole, such as cardboard or plastic.
challenges.title: Make Tape Shoes

challenges.description: You've probably heard it hundreds of times — "Duct tape can fix anything!" There's some truth to that statement. From airplanes to cars, tables to toys, tape is a viable option when something is broken.
challenges.title: Fix Something with Tape

challenges.description: Hammocks are a great way to spend a lazy afternoon. Construct a hammock from tape and kick back with your favorite book as you enjoy the fruits of your labor. Take pictures or a video of the process, as well as a snapshot of you lazing away in your creation.
challenges.title: Construct a Tape Hammock

challenges.description: Tape clothes can be stylish, wacky or practical. You can create a tape copy of your favorite sweatshirt, or design and make a completely original outfit. Go all out and add zippers, buttons, or anything else that gives your clothing a finishing touch.
challenges.title: Make Clothes from Tape

challenges.description: There are a ton of things you can do with tape, all in the name of science! Explore what's possible with the science side of tape, and once you've found something cool, explain it so everyone else can test it for themselves.
challenges.title: Use Tape for Science

challenges.description: Tape makes great stencils that allows for crisp and clean lines. Some tapes work better than others. You should experiment yourself, but a tapes that are less sticky, such as masking tape, work best. Cut a tape stencil and paint something cool!
challenges.title: Make a Stencil From Tape

challenges.description: Art mediums are endless. Some use paint, others clay. Why not tape? Let your creativity shine and create a museum-worthy piece of art using only tape. Try and document the creative process with a video or series of pics.
challenges.title: Create Tape Art

challenges.description: Costumes aren't just for Halloween. Design and create a costume and then make it with tape! You can be as crazy and original as you want. Be sure to take pictures along the way so you can share your technique with all your friends.
challenges.title: Design a Tape Costume

challenges.description: There are plenty of tape contests out there that you can enter. If that's not your style, then create your own contest right here on DIY! You can have as many categories as you wish — best tape costume, best tape bag, or best tape anything else you can think of!
challenges.title: Enter a Tape Contest

challenges.description: Make your own toy figure – robots, cartoon characters, space creatures, super hero – anything!
challenges.title: Make a Toy Figure

challenges.description: Your toy vehicle doesn't have to be on wheels – it can be a boat, or a plane!
challenges.title: Build a Toy Vehicle

challenges.description: Make a small-scale version of a real thing – animals, cars, buildings, anything.
challenges.title: Make a Miniature

challenges.description: Puzzles can range from a picture you put together to a box with a secret opening method. Put some thought into what type of puzzle you would like to solve yourself, and then make it. Snap a shot of the finished puzzle as well as images explaining how it was solved.
challenges.title: Design a Puzzle

challenges.description: Humans aren't the only ones that play with toys. Pets love them, too! Figure out what sort of play your pet likes the most and design a toy for them. Snap some pictures of the making process and share a video of your pet playing with your creation.
challenges.title: Make A Toy for Your Pet

challenges.description: Flying Toys can be anything as long as they soar, zip or float through the air. Most can be made with found objects, like a plastic bag or a soda bottle. Snap a video or picture of your toy soaring high in the sky.
challenges.title: Build a Flying Toy

challenges.description: Two parts broken toy, one part super glue, and five parts wackiness. That's the recipe for creating a Frankentoy. Find some broken toys and bring them back to life by splicing them together to form something crazy.
challenges.title: Create a Frankentoy

challenges.description: Games are a great way to pass a rainy day or spend time with the family. Games you buy in the store are great, but nothing beats one you've made yourself. Recreate an already popular game or invent your very own.
challenges.title: Make a Game

challenges.description: Puppetry has been around for hundreds of years. Most things change over time but the purpose of Puppets has remained the same — to entertain. Some Puppets can be as simple as turning a sock into a talking creature while others move and act like real people.
challenges.title: Build a Puppet

challenges.description: Make a ball that bounces or rolls. Shoot a video to prove it.
challenges.title: Make a Ball

challenges.description: Spinning Toys can be as simple as a spinning top or as advanced as a ball-bearing yo-yo. The trick to this challenge isn't to find any ol' object that spins. The goal is to make your own Spinning Toy from scratch. Give it a whirl and snap a video or picture.
challenges.title: Create a Spinning Toy

challenges.description: Construction sets are simple in design, but the things you can create with them are endless. Most construction sets consist of blocks made from scrap wood, old cardboard, or anything stiff enough to hold it's shape. Once they're made, build something amazing.
challenges.title: Make a Construction Set

challenges.description: When science and fun collide, you get awesome toys like Kaleidoscopes. The concept is simple: use mirrors to reflect bits of material. The magic is in the outcome. Bright beads, glass fragments, bits of metal... These are what give the Kaleidoscope its beauty.
challenges.title: Build a Kaleidoscope

challenges.description: Electronic toys combine classic themes with today's technologies. With a basic knowledge of motors, batteries and circuits, you can create high-tech toys that do some pretty cool things. You can add electronics to an existing toy, or create one from scratch.
challenges.title: Make an Electronic Toy

challenges.description: The interesting thing about a Toy Walker isn't in what it does so much as how it does it. Classic walkers rely on finding the center of gravity, while modern walkers make use of insane mechanisms. Create a Toy Walker of your choice and snap a video of it in action.
challenges.title: Build a Toy Walker

challenges.description: Acrobatic Toys use simple physics to climb, tumble and flip. Years ago, Acrobatic Toys were hand carved and painted. Some even used mercury to help them tumble. Todays versions are much safer. Create your own and snap a picture of it tumbling.
challenges.title: Make an Acrobatic Toy

challenges.description: Automata was invented long ago by the ancient Greeks.  They were built as toys, religious idols, and tools for demonstrating basic scientific principles. Today they're making a comeback as kooky toys and works of art. Share a video of your automaton in action.
challenges.title: Build an Automaton

challenges.description: Find a real track and give your best guess of what animal it is.
challenges.title: Identify a Wild Animal Track

challenges.description: Find and record signs of wild animals – crushed grass, a nest, stripped bark, scat, and more.
challenges.title: Find Wild Animal Signs

challenges.description: Look for cough pellets, bones, feathers and fur that animals leave behind.
challenges.title: Find Animal Remains

challenges.description: When other signs are vague, you can often identify an animal by its scat. Take a photograph and guess what animal it came from to complete the challenge.
challenges.title: Identify Wild Animal Scat

challenges.description: One of the best ways to recognize the signs of an animal is to understand its habits.  Study your quarry--discover what it eats, where it sleeps, when it hunts for food.  Document your findings in a notebook or file that you can take with you on the trail.
challenges.title: Make a Quarry Profile

challenges.description: Careful inspection of tracks can not only identify an animal but tell the experienced Tracker its age, gender, and how fast the quarry was moving.  Document existing tracks or make your own.
challenges.title: Analyze an Animal's Gait

challenges.description: You can create a lasting record of a track by casting it in plaster. The plaster footprint can then be later analyzed and used as evidence.
challenges.title: Make a Track Casting

challenges.description: Sometimes wildlife is difficult to find.  A tracking box, scattered flour, or water on concrete allows you to practice your tracking skills in a controlled situation, studying the effects of different situations on the tracks.
challenges.title: Trap Some Tracks

challenges.description: The song of a bird, the howl of a coyote, the bark of an elk--these are all unique sounds that can help a Tracker identify and trail their quarry.  Familiarize yourself with the sounds, and then get out on the dirt and record your own!
challenges.title: Record and Identify Animal Sounds

challenges.description: The data that Trackers gather along the trail makes for good practice and can be extremely useful to researchers and scientists.  Record your observations as you spend dirt-time out in the field.
challenges.title: Record Tracking Data

challenges.description: Once you've mastered the skills of a Tracker, it's time to trail a quarry!  Find a trail that's fresh and try to carefully catch up with the animal that made it.
challenges.title: Trail a Quarry

challenges.description: Build a model vehicle. Pinewood derby cars, finger skateboards, model trains, raingutter regatta sailboats, and remote controlled cars are all great!
challenges.title: Make a Model Vehicle

challenges.description: Build mini transport system by making a marble run, model railroad, or car track.
challenges.title: Build a Mini Transport System

challenges.description: Build a vehicle that stores energy in a rubber band or mousetrap, and releases it as kinetic energy to go flying! Share a video that shows your vehicle in motion.
challenges.title: Build a Potential Energy Vehicle

challenges.description: Bicycles, skateboards, row boats, rickshaws, rollerblades, kick scooters, tricycles, quadracycles, balance bikes, wheelchairs, wheel barrows, and draisines – all are types of vehicles that move with the help of human muscle. Fun to make, amazing to ride.
challenges.title: Make a Human Powered Vehicle

challenges.description: A zip line is a mechanism that helps you get from one point to another using a line that starts at a higher point than where it ends. Using the decline of the slope, an object can travel along a line that minimizes friction to help the rider go faster.
challenges.title: Make a Zip Line

challenges.description: Hauling stuff around is an essential capability of any Maker. Cargo bikes, wheel barrows, sleds, and flatbeds are all useful ways of moving around materials.
challenges.title: Build a Cargo Transporter

challenges.description: Making a vehicle can also be a way of expressing something other than efficiency. You can make a joke on wheels, or bend people's minds with something they've never seen.
challenges.title: Make a Crazy Vehicle
